Q007hw07X2ZAw0Zjxt5BtQ.text: My team and I were trolling the strip looking for a place to eat. We decided that a burger would be simple and ideal. We found this French themed burger place inside of the Paris hotel and thought it should be good.  When we walked up to the doors, we were greeted by a couple of hostesses that were way too ugly to have such a shitty, snooty attitude. They barely acknowledged us and just pointed inside to the bar and said "seat yourselves"  We were too hungry to care so we sat down at the bar and the bartender just seemed tired, overworked and didnt really care about the people. To him, we were just another party crew passing through Las Vegas.  He handed us all dirty, sticky greasy menus and disappeared for 10 minutes. We finally gave him our drink orders and he was snappy with his response and seemed so annoyed by us, the people who tip.   When I ordered my Guinness, he just poured it in the pint, one pour and let it sit and settle by itself. Any self respecting bartender would NEVER pour a pint of Guinness so poorly. If I were a manager or the establishments owner, I would give him his walking papers just for his lack of respect to Guinness and the art of the "Perfect Pour." I let that slide in hopes that the food would be great.    I ordered the Blue Cheese burger and when it finally came out, I sank my teeth into it and, while it was a tasty burger, it was without a doubt the greasiest thing I have eaten in very long time.   It had disrupted my stomach that I could not even eat it anymore. It was heavier by the grease and not by the meat. Huge bun designed to fill you up and distract you from the fact that youre eating a greasy pile of beef in a huge doughy bun.   I perhaps wouldnt have been so disappointed by this if the $15 burger at least came with french fries, but I left with a stomach ache and never a desire to return.  I would never recommend this place. If you want to eat a burger. Do NOT go here. There is a Fatburger right down the strip and is worth the extra time/distance walking.

Vo_L1N5P7FCuKfYjpJLGqQ.text: We got told 10 mins to be seated. 20+ mins later we got called to be seated (around 9:30pm).  25 mins after being seated we got our waters that we asked for AFTER people who got seated after us and who ordered cocktails. Yes, they delivered paid drinks before free drinks. That's how they roll. The guy blamed his bus boy. Way to rip on the place you work.  Food came out around 10:20pm. Honestly, the food was decent. I enjoyed every bite of my L'American burger and fries. When he dropped it off, the wiater said "I'll be right back with more waters." They never came.  An older couple next to us complained to the same wiater about wait times and asked for a full refund on their check. He got a manager and they talked for a bit and got their refund. We didn't want to be a harsh because the waiter is just doing his job. It's the managers fault for overbooking the place.  We straight up told him we didn't want to tip because of the awful experience, but that we'd pay for the great food.  If they're busy, don't eat here. If they add you to a list to be seated, go somewhere else. If they're quiet inside then I'd recommend the food. We expected to be in and out withing 30-45 mins to get our night on in Vegas. Instead we spent over an hour and a half complaining about everything going on around us, from the waiters conversing when people are waiting to big parties getting "VIP" treatment.   America has butchered Paris!

N2LoW_WP1LWEc4WZVaSPow.text: I have nothing spectacular off hand to say about the food..but I do remember it was pretty good.  My stomach wasn't feeling itself, so rather than have a burger, I got a salad and the chicken soup.  Both were above average in my book, considering I got then from a burger bar.  My boyfriend got a burger and I stole a bite (of course :) ) and it was A-OK :)  What stole the show was the service.  My water was refilled as if by magic and our server was very pretty and helpful with suggestions.  Not bad, overall!

gWtSxp09vNRydbopeBx9Xg.text: Dropped in here since its located in the hotel we're staying in. Burger was wonderful, the best I've had in a long time. My friend's burger, on the other hand, wasn't cooked the way she asked. But they politely replaced it. The service was actually great too. It wasn't too busy when we went for dinner.

fOhItN3zZloEdfePPJLvOw.text: I'm not sure how my friends and I ended up here. No, we weren't drunk at all because we happened to walk around Paris right after our ~3hour drive. I didn't think I was hungry since it was 10 pm but somehow our group ended up in this quite spacey, dark, nicely decorated sports bar. I glanced around the restaurant and I mainly saw older... uuhh white haired men. The waitresses wore uniforms that consisted of bustiers and fishnet stockings and all I remember is: wowww fake boobies and how is she so toned and ripped?? (while eating my greasy fatty food =) )  Our waiter was nice and patient because we were being indecisive. He recommended 'Le Paris' Burger, so with two other friends we ordered that and 'Le Combinaison.' The food seemed to take a bit while, not tooo long, but still testing our impatience just a little. But all the orders came out together and us girls DEVOURED everything.  Le combinaison (12.99) is like a typical all-american sportsbar sampler with hot wings, chicken tenders, potato skins, onion rings, popcorn shrimp, celery and carrot sticks, with ranch and bleu cheese sauce. omgggg. i haven't eaten so much greasy and fried and calorie-glorified food in so long, especially around the time I went to this restaurant because I was trying to look fit for vegas (we went right before summer was ending).  And Le paris (11.99) burger with brie cheese, caramelized onion, smoked bacon, and I think with pickles on the side? I don't know what made this burger so delicious, but it was juicy and flavorful! That burger disappeared so quickly. :( hahaa. I would definitely like to eat the Le paris again.  Oh and wash the oily food down with blue moon with orange slice garnish. yummm start off Vegas by being a fatty ahhhh!   In my opinion, the portions weren't too big so the orders were a little bit on the pricey side. And I'm sure I would've rather used the money for something mindblastingly delicious (albeit expensive) elsewhere in Vegas. But the food left us satisfied and content. I think it might've been just my stomach from not being used to eating such greasy food in so long, but we were walking down the strip and I had such a tummy ache. That's why I give Le Burger Brasserie 3 stars because I associate it with greasy, fried food that gave me tummy ache!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. le combinaison

LPWyi83YhsvZXgTa4FAWxA.text: Located between Paris and Bally's this place has tons of tvs, plus food and beer options. Their service is great and everything is moderately priced.  Give this place a try and I'm sure you'll be back.

JWvl6V7J9rKoaxSqHjoCrQ.text: It is an upscale hooters! Works for me, video screens for sports and good burgers and salads

bQP8CHMoXXR8XIIORUj0Qw.text: Unbelievably super delicious French Onion burger! It was cooked perfectly and had an outstanding balance of flavors. Nothing was overpowering; I could taste everything.  I promised half to my other half but it was hard to give up. Also had the Panzanella Salad and it was fabulous! It was such a unique and flavorful salad. Great big chunks of mozzarella as well as artichokes.   We never would've discovered this place if it wasn't for the Groupon and I'm so happy we did.

eQgkZl-bL5GzT7ZWqSjW7g.text: The menu changed pretty drastically and I'm fully convinced that it's been (gordon) ramsayed. Let me explain what I mean. I've watched enough kitchen nightmares and eaten at Ramsay's burgr to realize that by the time Ramsay is done with a restaurant, the menu becomes short and concise, portions are very exact - just enough to get full, and combos so to speak are non existent. Now I don't know for a fact that Ramsay had anything to do with the drastic changes (it's just my theory), but it sure felt that way.  I enjoyed my food, but honestly, I was really disappointed with the changes. There isn't much unique about this place anymore. Before, they had all sorts of different options for burgers - lamb, salmon, chicken, burgers (even a kobe beef option), and it had sort of a French twist to it. Now, everything was pretty standard for any other high end burger place. I was kind of fantasizing about the lamb burger, so seeing it removed from the menu was kind of tragic to me. It also somewhat annoyed me that about a third of the significantly reduced menu entrees were hot dogs or bratwursts. Not that I have anything against hot dogs, except the name of the restaurant is BURGER Brasserie.  They also used to have combo options, where you could add fries and/or milkshakes at somewhat of a discount as opposed to ordering separately, and those were gone too.  I got the shaft bleu burger and my boyfriend got the french onion burger. Mine was delicious, but there was a bit much bleu cheese for my taste. The french onion was good, but in my opinion, it's pricey for just being gruyere and onions.  We also got the gravy fries and the chocolate nutella milkshake. One thing that I thought was odd was that all the milkshakes on their menu had alcohol, which is fine because I didn't mind the alcohol. But if I didn't want the alcohol, I would have been a bit upset to pay for it and have them not include the alcohol. I liked the nutella shake from my last visit a lot better. Don't know why, but it wasn't as good this time. The gravy fries had really delicious flavor, but unfortunately were a touch too oily for my taste and also, like I said, I feel like it was Ramsayed because the portion was considerably smaller than what I expected (last time when we got bleu cheese fries, the portion was very generous - the bleu cheese fries were also no longer on the menu). I mean I'm not expecting them to be healthy by any means (they're called gravy fries for pete's sake), but I didn't like seeing all the oil seeping out.  Service: Our waitress (Nicolette) was wonderful. She walked us through the new menu, and came to check on us enough, but not too much and she was very friendly.  The hostesses on the other hand...were just meh...there were three of them that were just kind of huddled around the stand. There was a wait time to be seated, even though there were plenty of open tables. (This might not have been their fault though...I don't know if the restaurant was understaffed or something...I don't know this for sure, but regardless it was still weird to me.) When it was our turn to get seated, they just called out my name. But they didn't call it very loudly and I think it was just chance I heard it, because my boyfriend didn't hear it. There's a water fountain right outside the entrance to BB and there's a lot of people walking through so it's hard to hear. But it seemed like they weren't making a lot of effort.  Overall: I'm disappointed with the changes. The experience this time really was just ok, hence the 3 star rating. There's nothing special about this place that will really cause me to make a special trip anymore.

BXaUWLlxRWbulUHG6QaXJA.text: Good was great really liked the pork sandwich and the French dip. Cheddar onion rings were great too. Service was super good, I hated my cocktail and she was on top of it to give me a new one.

wRnhXrWNICBMdnveE2NdxA.text: A little over a year ago Burger Boy and I went on a burger eating binge across Las Vegas, and were able to check off most of the locations we wanted. One of them that we didn't get to, and one that took me over a year to get back to, is Le Burger Brasserie at the Paris. It's a location that seems to fly well under the radar of burger enthusiasts in town as I never hear about it, and the few times I've brought it up in conversation no one seems to know what I'm talking about. And even though it's a strip location and not the hidden local gem I'm searching for, this place is still an unknown that I'm glad to have discovered.  The restaurant is located in a strange transitional connector area between the Paris and Bally's amidst a few retail stores and other touristy junk. The venue is billed as a 'Sports Grille', but due to the lack of sports events going on the night I was there I didn't really get that feel, but instead it just felt more like a typical touristy strip restaurant. Not that this is a negative, just wasn't all that fancy or unique of an interior.  The menu is French themed as one would expect, with your typical offerings of sliders, salads, entrees, and of course burgers, but all with a French theme and French names. For burger patty options you can chose from beef, vegetarian, salmon, chicken and turkey. And if you're feeling really spendy you can order the 777 Burger, with Kobe beef, Maine lobster, a 100-year aged balsamic served with a bottle of Rose Dom Perignon Champagne. I was not, so I went with a Le Paris burger, which came with Brie, caramelized onion and smoked bacon on a caramelized onion bun. The bartender talked me into getting the waffle fries which I typically don't like, but more on that shortly.  The burger came out in a nice presentation with the top bun next to the rest of the ensemble, and an olive stuck on top. The bun wasn't quite cut in half as the top portion seemed extra thin, but didn't present as much of a problem as I feared. Upon first bite I was impressed with the burger; the meat had great flavor, was cooked perfectly, and was proportioned very well to the bun. The brie and onions also had really good flavor, and the smoked bacon was cooked just right. The bun was sweet and delicious, and almost had a croissant flavor to it which I appreciated. The French theme carried through all the way, and it was great.  The waffle fries were also quite good, even considering the fact that I don't typically like them. This selection prevented me from checking out their regular fries, but based on the burger and waffle fries I had, I'm sure they're ok. Also, the pickle that came on the side was good, but I'm starting to think that's it's kind of hard to mess up a pickle.  The overall price of my meal was $21.08, which included a $12 burger, $4 waffle fries and a $3.50 iced tea. While I have a bit of a hard time paying over $7 for the fry and drink portion of my meal, the total price for a strip location, as well as the quality of my burger was more than acceptable.  So although you may have never heard of the place, and the Paris probably isn't too much of an attraction these days for locals, Le Burger Brasserie serves up a great burger and is worth checking out. Plus, it's located very close to the garage entrance so it's easy to get in and out of the property without straying too far.

W7Vt208PV1kOqeNk9aySEQ.text: I was expecting a bit more. Service was OK, ambience was OK, food was OK - All in all, a very "meh" like experience.

skFz8gBeaK2P2Fxsdi68rQ.text: The burgers at this place are FANTASTIC! I was hungry and the rest of the girls weren't, so walking around Paris, I find myself sitting at the bar. Although the place wasn't busy, the bartender had no problem striking up conversation (his name slips my mind). He gave great recommendations on a burger and a beer. The beef was cooked to perfection in hearty portion. Two thumbs up!

82EUY5deGjQ9u1n8Oi1QNw.text: Do NOT get the lamb burger, it is a processed patty not made from scratch, horrible, with bits of gristle/bone I kept biting into.  The regular burger is okay, it's real beef from scratch, but for the price you pay nothing special.  But the FRIES, both waffle and "shoestring" fries which are really not thin enough to call shoestring, are both frozen Albertson's french fries, I've tasted them before, there's no mistaking.  Really poor quality french fries for the price you pay to eat here.  You get better french fries at a Denny's.  If you've heard of BLT burger in Mirage, or LBS at Red Rock, and thought this would be a similar upscale burger joint, you are as mistaken as I was.  This is simply a crappy sports bar with a french name, not gourmet in the least.  You would be better off at Applebee's, the food quality is better there.

qNFi99r8Riv2fJU0AqC3oQ.text: Although I am interested in their super expensive burger, I thought this place was okay.  Atmosphere was nice and the bartenders were friendly.

T2TbjpF3Ovh6BhOaIXAxQg.text: On the road again, this time in beautiful Las Vegas. Stopped  in for a quick burger for dinner here figuring how hard is it to mess up a burger when it's actually part of your name, right?  Wrong!  To top it off, they were running a restaurant week special, usually designed to showcase what you can do to promote your restaurant. This was an all around fail. The special offered pita chips and spinach dip, a couple of burger prions which I choose the pastrami burger,and cheesecake for dessert. The dip was good,  unfortunately the pita chips were burnt. Not sure what they were trying to do there.  Then comes the burger. Only the burger in the middle of an otherwise empty plate. Not even garnish.(maybe they were trying to showcase...?)  Basically a pretzel bun, burger cooked a perfect medium-rare, (realty the only good part)  1000 island dressing (aka "special sauce") grilled onions and a pile of thick cut pastrami. First on a burger, the thick cut meat was way too much.  Hard to bite thru everything, and since the bun wasn't toasted,  the special sauce soaked thru the bottom turning the whole thing into an over salty (heavy pastrami) mess. Sat at the bar,  was never asked how everything was, not even when they picked up the plates with only half the burger eaten and most of the app left.   After 10 minutes of sitting there with no other service I finally just got the check and left skipping the last part of the dinner which was a piece of cheesecake.  I was never even offered the dessert ...  If this is how they show what they can do for restaurant week,  I'm glad I didn't get any deeper into the menu.  Next time in Vegas if your at Ballys or Paris, this us a definite skip!  To many other options for good food!

yABl-68EoiRItn28MJxnXA.text: Loved this place! Super quick service and great food. Lamb burger was excellent and the fries were seasoned to perfection. Can't wait to back for the captain crunch infused shake as I'm pregnant and not able to indulge. I know, I know....that sucks!

7-xuucen5cpUd7ZqQOEwEg.text: Burgers are on a quality basis.. Asides that you have gorgeous waitress serving you.. Amount is pretty decent.. I love the Le Saumon..

K06c769sq-vz_92xcBy5Zw.text: Bf and I went here for a late night snack. We decided to share a burger , a basket of skinny fries and waffles fries. For dessert , I got the beignets. Overall, the food was amazing. I was disappointed in waffles Pom frites , but I guess I expected crispy Pom frites similar to Mon Ami Gabi, and I ended up w waffles fries similar to Carl's jr. At least, my bf likes it. My favorite was the beignets. Yumm...  However,if there was star that I could give for the service, I would give them 2 stars. When my bf pay w his credit card, the waitress asked for his ID. That was the first. I thought maybe it was their policy to check ID but as I pay attention no one else was asked for their ID w credit card payment. We didn't even have alcohol. It just makes me wonder if it's because we looked like two teenagers who can't afford to eat there?

CTOqn23hXPDhSFGjotG8ig.text: Yummy food! pretty good prices... super cute outfits too!  Casual sports bar feeling~ I dig it :)

T0_tyNfG2u2dHONHLZsaQg.text: My lamb burger and peanut butter shake was very good.  But service...what service ?  No one had time for anything !  Manager, pay attention, you need to train your workers better.

ViXtp9hKi1lHFYtnMbUYxw.text: Excellent burger and the waffle fries were delicious to. I dipped them in ranch to make a good thing better! Great food for a decent price by Vegas standards. Will definitely return to this place the next time I'm in Vegas!!

oIU8krjOdub1uXiPy9MCPA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE the filet mignon sandwich!  Fries don't come with the sandwich and have to be ordered separately :(  Drinks are pretty good and the service is decent.  There has only been one time I actually had to wait.  Would recommend for a REALLY good burger or sandwich!

rd8ReO0s2UNdUBF9VD7kTA.text: Service was very slow and bordered on surly.  Plenty of other options in Vegas - take them.

WDBjZbBkHVqc_9S06c-eFw.text: Wow, I'm surprised by the bad reviews because I had a great experience here. Came shortly after my 21 (by  the way, you notice you never get carded once you turn 21?) and had my first kobe beef burger which was just so juicy and wonderful. The big seller and my main suggestion for this place is the french martini which tastes like an boozey jolly rancher. SO FREAKING GOOD!

vHqwH6c6Pmxu29_jv_8ZJA.text: I love this place.  Pretty cheap for vegas, good service and atmosphere.  The burgers are amazing, loved le paris and the american was really good too.  Topped it off with some waffle fries and ranch.  I would suggest anyone craving a burger on the strip to check this place.

KIQZEYZJz2JwP2vYhkaECQ.text: We had lunch here and I was surprised it was so good.  I had the lamb burger and waffle fries.  The lamb was perfectly medium, juicy and big.  The fries were crisp on the outside and soft in the inside.  The peanut butter shake was delicious.  Wish I had asked if they could spike it with Malibu Rum.  Oh well.  Yes, I agree, $20 for a burger, fries and a shake seems excessive.  But, its in the Paris Shoppes, and everything was fantastic quality.  Having spent $12 on a lamb burger at Unami in L.A. a couple of weeks ago, and it was 1/2 the size of this lamb burger, I have no complaints about the price.

0IHeEo2TvqQ8TcVT1qLVaQ.text: This was a surprise during my recent trip to Vegas. I didn't expect all that much from the place, and it greatly exceeded my expectations. The burger combinations are almost endless, so you'll find a combination of toppings and roll that you'll enjoy. The meat itself was tasty and was cooked as I requested (which is more than I can say for Mesa Grill).  I would definitely go back if I was craving a burger and would recommend it to friends. The fries were crispy and fresh and my beer was nice and cold. For a little place tucked away inside Paris, this is a very good burger joint. Reasonable prices too.

f4ubtWpP5BjYhj-P7cnWtw.text: A great tasting burger at  a reasonable price in a Las Vegas strip hotel? I was just as shocked! Located in the mall area between the Paris Hotel and Ballys is this great spot! Juicy burgers with great fries. They also have a fantastic happy hour with drink specials. Will defiantly go back. Skip the lunch Buffett one day and head there instead.

OXdKe6Fwk8oAj4PKnqbdfg.text: Get the 777 Burger without the champagne and it's only $77. It's a kobe beef patty, lobster tail, imported brie cheese, carmelized onions, 100 year old balsamic. Definitely worth trying once! Probably the best thing I've ever ate.

tpYkvLgVWHV3d2lMEBJgFA.text: Total rip off.  The check was 80.00 for two ffillet burgers and two glasses of wine plus fries are an extra charge. Never going back.  The meat was horrible, a regular burger would have had some taste to it,greasy melted cheese and greasy overcooked.(not carmelized, there is a difference).  In and out has better food I recommend going there.

7qpQiW4PkOFtIjmDH4bgnA.text: Went here with the wife on our last visit to Vegas.  Looked up a couple of the new Burger places online and we decided this is the one to try. I wish we would of gone somewhere else. The burgers we ordered were great. Cooked just the way we ordered them. The bread for the buns were toasted perfectly. Our issues were the fries. We ordered the sampler with their three fries. All three looked and tasted like any frozen fries you could buy at the store. Remarkably unremarkable.  A good buyer is only half the meal. You have to have good fries. With the options available there in Vegas, I would choose to try somewhere else rather than go back.

_hsR_ITrF6y7gCsMrZ5CHQ.text: Had a groupon for this place, the burgers were amazing!!! I had a chicken Cesar it was decent but my hubby had the salmon burger and it was absolutely amazing. We had great service!!!

EzyfowDcj9942P2KWLCMVQ.text: Even with a Groupon way overpriced. Food is good but not even close to being worth the price. Went on a Sunday.. did not read the fine print, waitress did not want to honor it, manager finally did, He said Groupon made them not honor them on Sundays, right! Totally a not good experience.

OJ_ArJL_AI90_F3VUDig4Q.text: For the price and atmosphere, everything was just about what it should have been. The burgers were well cooked, not anything special, but very tasty none the less. We ordered the potato skins appetizer and that was very good also. But the best part of the meal honestly were the shakes! They were very tasty and smooth! Service was good, not great, but certainly not terrible.

zIqB_G5ifXJd_MdiGMtNVQ.text: Paris Las Vegas does a good job of hyping a typical sports bar.  Here, they tell us, even the condiments are sensual.  At the end of the day, however, it's a sports bar in a fancy casino, so expect some gussying up of typical American food.  The menu was impressive.  Sure, they had the traditional cow burgers, but they added turkey burgers also. And salmon! And lamb! And, relegated to the bottom right corner of the menu, were some vegetable burgers that may be perfectly tasty, but who would come to a burger joint for that?  I chose the lamb burger, and ordered a side dish of fat fries and waffle fries.  I'd figured they'd give me two smallish servings of each type, but no, they trotted out a full order of potatoes.  Although initially I got the petit fries with the waffle fries, the waitress realized her mistake and brought out a full order of steak fries as well.  Turns out I liked the petit fries better; they were crispy and seasoned, the steak fries were kinda bland.  As was the lamb burger, surprisingly.  I'd chosen the lamb because I thought it would have a darker flavour to it, but apparently this is not the case.  Don't get me wrong, I've got no doubt that this was one of the better lamb burgers out there.  But I've come to realize, after eating here, that I shall be keeping my lamb on its rack, and having the traditional cow in my burgers.  The condiments, by the way, are plain old condiments.  Ketchup and mustard come in the standard squeezable bottle, and the pickle was just a pickle.

vlvsgwPvyIKSvXvHVaBHsw.text: The restaurant is in the pathway between Bally's and Paris hotels.  Being a sports bar, the ambiance is fun but also elegant.  We enjoyed good burgers for a fair price.

KLWDsHT58-kZTUo9lnaexA.text: Burgers were good but I have a hard time paying $32 for burger, fries, coke, and tip.  Even harder time when the waitress is going to "punish" me for asking her for a copy of my signed receipt by telling me she threw it in the trash and would bring it back to me when she isn't busy.  The mgr got it for me.  Great burger, terrible value, service that was ok by union standards but terrible by normal standards.  I won't be back.

sayDmHJm4RVyg0VTsPhC8w.text: Super yummy burgers! Had an awesome waiter our first night- Christopher- excellent service friendly etc. second time eating there we ordered from The bar and the bartender lady was in a MOOD!  Even the man working with her was a bit sour. Not accommodating , acted as if we were inconveniencing them. Still good food though

vKA77aZ8G3QwM51QiGRIbg.text: This is a nice quiet place to grab a bite away from the noise of the casinos and excitement.  The burgers were good and their were plenty of wine and beer options.  Wasn't digging their appetizer options, but there were some good sides to make up for it. The burgers were inventive and varied and there were other sandwiches that were meat-free, so that was good.   I will be back when I'm in vegas because I'm lame and like to escape the noise and excitement sometimes.

1Zb14p1hmB-qj0KrRqmCug.text: Very disappointed. Seated promptly and told our waiter would be right with us. Waited around 10 minutes before our person showed up but he was friendly so let it go. Ordered drinks and decided on an appetizer for our late night snack. Bloody Mary was drinkable but very boring. Pretzel with cheese and mustard was blah. The kicker...no one came back to see if we wanted or needed anything else. Instead another waiter brought our bill. Never been rushed out of a place before.

qy9niBZUh2BMimRI01fBvg.text: Everyone is miserable. We sat at the bar and were helped by the bartender. He was okay. He served us drinks and took our order. We ordered appetizers and meals. We never got the apps. When our food came out, someone in our party asked for jalapenos. Our bartender had walked away so she asked a server that was behind the bar. He had a thick mustache and a horrible attitude. He said, "did you ask your server?" No we hadn't but what does that matter? You work here, figure it out yourself. He rolled his eyes and brought the jalapenos. When the bill came, we saw we were being charged for the apps we never received. We mentioned this to the bartender and he said he was going to have his manager take them off the bill. We waited for about 10-15 minutes for this and they weren't even busy. Finally the bartender gave us the "new bill" and I saw the apps were still there. So I said enough is enough. I did the math myself and left exact change and underlined the apps so they'd know why there wasn't tip. I felt like no one wanted to help one another out. I realize servers have their sections but it really felt like we were bothering by asking for another round or for jalapenos. And no one smiled!!!!! Ever. Also, check your bill over well. They'll take advantage. Never returning here. Food wasn't great anyway.

w4zvZd6hvwGV7D12So9U8g.text: Excited to be in Vegas, even started my Easter Sunday bright and early at 8 am. Wanted a nice place to eventually have lunch/dinner. Passed by this location, checked out the menu and then tried to maybe find somewhere else with more of a variety. WELL, we were so hungry we then decided to go back.   Go to the hostess, she says 10-15 minute wait. Um, okay seems average. I look inside the restaurant and there were literally a handful of people in there.   Finally get seated. It takes this guy FOREVER to come by, greet us and get out drink orders. Cool, you may be busy(?). Well let's just say kids...the fun doesn't end there. We ask him questions about items on the menu, he rudely cut us off with every other sentence to "answer our question".   Ugh, so that takes for ever. Just the appetizers! I would  like to have also been told that the BURGERS didn't come with FRIES...yeah I will just leave it at that. The waiter was slow and not to mention the couple next to us was mentioning to the waiter his wife had to use the restroom because she was not feeling well because of her lunch. Thankfully I have 4 more days in Vegas to make up for that bs "burger joint".

vtvnXMJ10pyscPAgbpggcw.text: This place is EXPENSIVE...bring your appetite and deep pockets!!! With that said, everybody in our party enjoyed their meal.  I had never been here, but was planning an upcoming trip to Vegas, when I saw a Groupon advertised. I briefly checked out their menu and decided to purchase the Groupon.   When we arrived, we were seated immediately, as there was hardly anybody there. This place seems to be more suitable for adults. The wait staff was good, very friendly and kept checking on us to make sure we had everything and that our drinks stayed filled.  I ordered the French onion Burger and man was it goooooood!!! The cornmeal bun was just right, not too big, not too small. I ordered my burger well done, and it was cooked just right. The cheese was ooey-gooey and the french onions were very tender and had a perfect balance of flavor. The burger was expensive, I believe $14 or $15 and it did NOT come w/ any sides, just the burger.  My husband ordered the housemade cheddar dog w/ cheese curds. It was about a foot long and had cheese melted on top and down the sides. You could tell that the cheesecurds were also housemade and not out of a freezer, they were tempura style. There was also some sort of redpepper relish on top that was tasty.  This place is super expensive for a burger joint. I purchase my burger, my husbands burger, a plain cheeseburger, pretzel appetizer and 3 soft drinks and the bill was over $70!!! We did not have any fries or side dishes w/ our meals, everything is a la carte. Even w/ my Groupon I still ended up paying over $40. They have a burger called the '777' and it costs just that, $777!!! I dont think I could even convince myself to order that even if I had that kind of $$$.  The food is really good, but for that price I would have rather gone and had a nice steak dinner w/ all the fixings, appetizers and dessert. If you dont mind shelling out over $14 for a burger, I would recommend eating here cause everything we ate was delicious and the service we received was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion...very good
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A cheeseburger...seriously that&#39;s the name &#39;A Cheeseburger&#39; w/ velveeta cheese
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House made Cheddar Dog w/ cheese curds

8qeJCGXk-EFsGYIX2XiHbQ.text: Located in the shopping area which connects Paris to Bally's this is a medium to large size burger bar.  There are several televisions and one large projection screen for viewing sports while enjoying burgers and drinks.  There is a full service bar and  bar seating as well as tables and booths.    The menu consists primarily of burgers, a few salads, appetizers, shakes, drinks and a couple of sides.  Prices for burgers run in the $14-18 dollar range along with a gimmick "777" burger which costs $777.  I tried to ask our server about it, but she wasn't listening to me, a theme which continued throughout the night. My wife had the bleu burger which came with bacon, and a delicious house made sesame bun.  I have never seen so much bleu cheese on a burger and although I enjoy bleu cheese on burgers and steaks there was way to much cheese.  My wife had to scrape off the excess cheese.  The burger itself was cooked perfectly with a little pink in the center.  I ordered the No Bones Rib Sandwich.  It was served on the same house made sesame roll and when I picked it up it weighed a ton.  Seriously that sandwich weighed at least a pound. There was a large amount of boneless rib meat, onion strings and some type of pickled cabbage or slaw.  The sandwich looked and sounded better than it tasted though.  Unfortunately if was just okay for me.  We ordered a side of fries to share and were hoping for the thin crispy delicious fries served in the Eiffel Tower Restaurant, but unfortunately we got plain old fries which broke in half every time we tried to dip them in the tasty spicy ketchup that it came with.  The highlight of our meal were the alcoholic shakes. We ordered the cookies and cream and mint chocolate shakes which were pretty tasty for $8 each.  Although Holsteins and Burgr serves better shakes these were pretty good and cheaper than the other two places.  Our server was friendly and attentive but irritatingly only spoke and listened to my wife.  Now I have worked in food service before and I know that female servers will often focus on the female when serving couples as to not risk the female thinking the server was flirting with her man, but this was just outright being ignored. Perhaps the skimpy outfits the servers wear played a part in this, but for me this was just BAD service.  Our food also took at least 20 minutes to come out even though the place was not busy.  Overall even with the $20 for $40 Groupon we still spent $40 after tip.  We had a burger, a sandwich, one order of fries and two shakes. Without the Groupon our bill would have been $60 assuming a 20% tip.  With all the great burger places in Vegas I can't recommend coming here and paying these prices for average food.

Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bleu burger
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No bone rib sammie

E8h5AT1dqKx0Us0SVHNcBg.text: We stopped here for dinner; I had the BLT and my boyfriend had the French dip. Overall the food was very good, but the burgers and sandwiches didn't include any sides. We ordered a single of the sweet potato fries, which were amazing. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.

MzXxjTT5_Z02ffRRQ3t6_w.text: We really like the food and the portions are a good value for the price.  We really liked the shakes and the Paris burger with the brie cheese is very good

a0lYPc-rLmjzX_u3GYpwcA.text: I was horrified to hear about my girlfriend and her friend's visit to Burger Brasserie while in Vegas. My girlfriend is Vegan and has food allergies, so her options for eating out are limited.   She was able to order a "veggie burger" with a lettuce bun. It ended up consisting of a bunch of mushrooms tomatoes onions and pickles. That's it.... No fries. Nothing!  They charged her $17!!!   Her friends burger cost $15 with meat and fries. I think it's disgusting that they thought they could do that. Massive thumbs down Burger Brasserie. You suck!

6yF1gcc1hOgbOnfWXFHeYw.text: Ordered a well-done burger and it was moist AND well-done. Pricey, but I will definitely go back.

QFIjChUZVy1YeEhir8SrOQ.text: Best burger place EVER!! The food is fantastic......and the service! The service is unbelievable, I would definitely recommend this place to eat! The waitresses are beautiful and the service is amazing. The price is well worth it! Love this place, I will come back here with my friends every time I come to vegas!  #LOVE VEGAS!

HwSa3z4zSiTW1JBa5JNGAg.text: Amazing burgers !! I had the Parisian one if I remember correctly, brie, bacon and onions. The brie tasted so good & the bacon was the best I had.  Great service.

bDmiMAcXsM7L7sIRrGeYzw.text: This is a vibrant location to grab a bite in between the two hotels. Service was good and very accommodating even though she was busy. While no one had a burger, the chicken sandwich, salads and French dip were all very good. The folks next to us knocked back to Humungous Burgers and Onion ring stack. They looked awesome for sure. Prices were decent for a strip property and it had a vibrant bar scene even at lunch.

jv7vPpbutGIQYrVGFWFZJg.text: What can I say about Le Burger Brasserie?  It's just okay, in my opinion. A friend and I didn't have burgers on our dinner agenda, but when you're hungry you do what you got to do.  Let's start with the positives... -No wait -Served quick -Service was great -Le Saumon Salmon (their salmon burger).  I had this on my most recent visit and was actually surprised.  I've had their burgers before and rather stick to a good old fashion American burger.  However, their salmon was pretty tasty, on the healthier side, and packed with protein.  Not complaining here.   Just Okay... -The rest of their burgers. I've had their Le Kobe Burger and Sliders on past visits.  Let's just say that I wasn't too impressed, especially since their known for burgers -Menu Selection -Price  Overall,  I really don't have too many negatives.  I rather go elsewhere for a burger.  Ironically, their salmon is pretty good.

RhOytI9sh4a-YV0dfyeP0g.text: Food was good. Service was a little slow but it was a Saturday lunchtime. Maybe needs some more staff. Reasonable price for on strip property. $30 for burger, fries and soft drink. I'd go back again for sure but probably not at the weekend.

QiHWMZuYA3fLTBhkwofw3w.text: My wife and I have been visiting the Burger Brasserie for the past 5 years and they have never disappointed.  I recommend the make your own burger -- lamb, mushrooms, onions, garlic aioli and the cornmeal bun and the onion ring stack-- delicious!    Plus we are entertained with all the games being played on all the tv's.  Great place, a must go for burgers!

-UMCYPpIyd7rYLV44Ne0eA.text: Not a fan overpriced and not very good.  The service is the worst understaffed and slow you will definitely wait for your food

sAcfRJxRn1y9ynpqxUo7Fw.text: What can I say..Me and my husband went here for the first time.. I ordered American burger it was ok.. I also ordered clam chowder and I'm very disappointed.. very thick and it came out cold.. Also they have a promo of $21.95 free beer with burger and fries.. unfortunately they didn't mention on the promo that you can only choose cheeseburger..

PA1IK9bHQfyboPLA8TF-Kw.text: Good food, priced as you'd expect on the Strip. I had the salmon arugula sandwich and onion rings. Rings are large, thick and delicious, come with hot cheeto ranch dipping sauce, but you only get about 6 of them for your 8 bucks.

xn1Fv1bxfdjq6bTnpRq2GA.text: Came here using a Groupon.  My husband, who is particular about his hamburgers, really enjoyed his bacon cheeseburger.  I got the panzella salad which was fantastic but probably the smallest entree salad I have ever ordered.  The atmosphere is a little bizarre.  The waitresses wear sexy corsets but there is a definite sports bar feel to the place.  My husband's burger was $16 and didn't come with fries which seems a bit expensive - course this is LV.  Glad I had a Groupon which helped soften the blow of a $70 check for two burger, two beers and a salad.

1qcySIA2YRqIB4uatplIfw.text: I tried it again.  They brought back a veggie burger made of mushrooms and kale. Okay.  I was willing.  Gag!  It was so salty I could not even eat it.  If we had not been there to celebrate a birthday, I would have made a fuss.  Not good.  Not going back.

PCcTsGioYrgbz_5lY-gdCA.text: Second time coming here and liked it just as much as the first time. Had the Le Paris burger - very tasty but was lacking salt. The sweet potatoes fries,  while good, could've used some more flavor like garlic powder, fresh herbs and some sea salt. Out if everything we ate the grilled chicken salad was be far best thing we had.   Overall I was pleased as was my girlfriend and it was her first visit. Can't wait to take my husband here.

y5tQFP9MukDyk3IV6fOpmQ.text: Wow, best French Fries I've had in a long time! Served hot, with a nice crispy crunch. Even the Sweet Potato Fries were perfectly crispy.  They've got a nice 2-1 deal on all drinks at the bar during certain times (just make sure to order 2 of the same drinks.) Service was a little slow and sloppy and the manager was a little rude when we tried to move some chairs, but not terribly.  Come for the fries.

-ODRbdKsRIwTcc8zM2gpVg.text: The food was fine, nothing to write home about. It took almost an hour to get our order and there were only two of us and it wasn't busy. I'm sure we could find the same burger with better service anywhere on the strip.

hTsZSiftorNUFb1VaHCHHg.text: I loved my husbands Kobe beef burger, it was better than my French dip but it was still good. My sweet potato fries were cold and our server "cowgirl Christina" ( something like that ) was happy to get me some more piping hot ones. She was what really made the experience super nice and super friendly. Atmosphere is cool and relaxed and they had the football game on, I dig it.

TCtpbRbtgHCJV9-Hnr_n3w.text: Sorry. Can't give this place more than 2 stars for a couple reasons. First time I came here, the waitress was really sweet, but forgot to put in my boyfriend's order for a shake, and neither of us were that terribly excited about the food we did receive, especially for the price. Also, I realize it may be hotel policy, but they wouldn't honor our Harrah's comp voucher unless we charged the meal to the room.  Second time, I go to place a to-go order for a burger and fries. Hostess says I need to order at the bar. Well, that's no problem for me. I don't care where I order.   But I proceed immediately to the bar, where for the next 7 minutes I witness the bartender flair pouring a vodka soda and opening two beers. Nobody clapped... nobody was even watching him. Nobody gave a crap about him rolling the cocktail shaker and Skyy bottle around on his palm and forearms for 3 minutes. Even the chick who ordered the round wasn't watching. (FYI: I have 8 years in the restaurant industry... 7 of which were as a bartender, so don't give me crap about not knowing what was going on. I would have filled that entire order in 40 seconds.) No matter where I go, I ALWAYS watch the bartender work, and this guy was a waste of waiting, paying customers' time! He and the barback never acknowledged me or anyone else, really, and I waited around a further few minutes after the "show" was over. I walked out and ended up finished leftovers instead.

MNlRZ-9h3r8QJu50F_5nWg.text: I read reviews on how good the burgers were and decided to give it a try. First of all, we asked the hostess if we could sit at a booth and her response was, 'she' referring to the waitress for that table, will be a while because she has other tables. So we sat in a different booth. We sat, and sat, and sat some more and no one ever asked us if we wanted water or anything to drink. We were treated as though we weren't even there. Worst service ever. 15 minutes later with no one approaching our table, we got up and left. I don't even think they noticed we left. We didn't even get a chance to eat the food, this review is solely on the service. This was around lunch time (3ish), hopefully dinner crew is more attentive. Very disappointed! !!

lJAh4HAF7S-lEX2yxdI_lA.text: Don't get fooled by the Trio of fries!!! If i see a fries sampler, i always want to get all of them. It said on the menu- waffle fries, steak fries and petit fries. You would think petit fries would be shoestrings (a neighbor made the same mistake), but they were just mini waffle fries. yelp.com/biz_photos/AjWF.... You're better off just ordering two different kinds. We ended up too full and not even finishing half of the trio order. Good to share though between 4 people or more. I got the signature burger Le Paris. Comes with brie, caramelized onions and bacon. yelp.com/biz_photos/AjWF... Tony got the Le Blue yelp.com/biz_photos/AjWF... with blue cheese, avo and bacon. The burgers were decent, but at 12 bucks each, i wanted Uhmaaazzing and they were not. The hefty burger patty was perfectly round and flattened, but i like my hamburger kind of mishapen so you get those nice charred marks around the edges. Service was friendly, everything tasted ok, but i wasn't wowed enough to add to my vegas favorites. Inside the Paris Hotel. Buddies: please chime in on your best burger in vegas!

iIt95eTsdYHZUciEwMEhrA.text: Stopped in here for lunch and saw an appealing menu. The only decent things about this 2-star "restaurant" were the environment and the wait staff (very friendly!) Drinks were solid as well. The food on the other hand, was awful. I honestly can't remember a time I was more upset with a meal while dining out. My wife and I had Lemon Parmesan Wings and then split the Italian Burger - both extremely disappointing.

dGK2OOMOrbEaD6qazDdrjg.text: Excellent Blue Cheese burger! Medium is really medium, juicy, red meat with a fantastic blue cheese. Instead of bacon I opted for grilled onions, great choice. The onion rings were good not great, the batter was a bit doughy.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese Burger!

DAV-Uxc-JLUhxHpgN0ciRw.text: Let me beginning by saying that the food is great so if your staying at Paris or Bally's and craving a burger it's a must!  The reason I'm giving them only 3 stars is because of the service. Our waitress Olivia was just so rude with an attitude. It seemed like she didn't like her job and didn't want to help at all. By the time she brought our ranch and hot sauce our food was cold already. So overall good food but bad service.

wvcXnapdhBdtzLAnmRb7cg.text: Very simply, gourmet burgers at above average prices.  It is a sports pub kind of set up so lots of TV all around to keep you distracted which isn't a bad thing if your blind date turns out to be a fuglie or a total tool.    The selection of draft beers was kinda skimpy but, oh well, I'll just get my fix somewhere else.  It is Vegas after all so no shortage of booze anywhere.

A4ecyi7AvxIVtAysQM2Bmw.text: I actually forgot I ate at Le Burger Brasserie. It was okay, not memorable. Wife and I had been heading out of Vegas that time around noon, and decided we better get sometime to eat. We hadn't had breakfast and to be honest, weren't really all that hungry. I guess that's what a week in Vegas will do to anybody. We actually split the le kobe with crispy bacon on a seasame bun with the waffle fries and the chocolate shake. It was pretty good, maybe we should have had a sauce or spread on it. Didn't realize we had to add sauces for an additional charge. The patty wasn't bad, although I'm sure that guy wasn't made in house. The waffle fries were crispy and hot, however way over salted with the seasoning. The chocolate shake was good too. Nothing out of this world. Actually, we would probably try it again.   The hostess was actually one of the more friendly out of all the restaurants we dined at this round in Vegas, however our server was hasty and a little insincere. When she picked up our bill, I had wanted to use some hotel credits towards the meal, and remaining balance on my debit card. As I'm trying to explain to her she is still walking off with the check. Oh well, she figured it out. But please... To all servers... Listen to your patrons. I know you hear it all, but at least to us, and most people, the service makes our meal, not always the actual food. I feel in this case, the food would have been better if the server was actually there for us.

X55VBE7fmufUDDbbM1Q8Qg.text: Was sad to see a menu change, with my favorite grilled cheese not on it :(  Decided to try the cheddar dog, which is HUGE, and quite good.  Had a caparina to drink, in a tall glass, but it was also good.     Not sure I will make a special trip to eat here on my visits to Vegas anymore (I really lived that grilled cheese), but it was good.

jagXiXTXU6IbInQnrdtqIw.text: Terrible service by management. My husband and I got sat at a 1/2 table/booth. We requested a booth. Our waitress finally came to our table, after 10min. and when we asked to be moved to a full booth, she said that "no one works there." I proceeded to look around and saw people, and said " I see a few people working here." She then said we would have to wait 20min, until another server was clocked in to serve us. I then asked to speak to the manager. The waitress came back and said to us, " the manager is too busy to come over." .... "Too busy," really? The waitress then came back and sweetly asked for our drink order and reintroduced herself, I'm sure in attempts, to salvage her prior rude behavior. Then after 15 min the manager came. We then asked if we could sit in the section I wanted and the manager repeated again to us " you have to wait until another server clocks in." I then asked why 3 parties got sat, in the section we wanted. He said " you didn't ask for that section." (I had been asking the whole time) He then, smugly, let us move. I've worked in the restaurant industry for 5 plus years and have never treated any guest with such demeanor. Not only were we told repeated excuses, for something as easy as moving a table, the manager tried to correct me in my request saying "you didn't ask for that section."   People go to Vegas for many different reasons. I'm pretty sure getting a simple burger should not be so complicated.

VlOzcSn36laXFA-c2geXPw.text: Had the Slider Sampler which is really good at the time but pretty forgettable. Well except for the mushroom one. That was really good. And the blue cheese. That's pretty good too. This order is good for two people already.  We had nachos too. Huge!!! This would be good for 1.5 people...  Chicken Tenders were really good and the fries that came with it were ok. Large enough for 1.5 persons.  Yup, we ordered enough food for 5 people but there were only 3 of us. Yikes.  The line to get in wasn't too bad. There were a lot of vacant tables.  There were big screens everywhere playing football. My husband was having a great time.  There was an employee (bus-lady? drinks runner?)  that was very dismissive to a family that just walked in and were just seated at a table next to us. Causing them to walk out. Too bad the waitress got the brunt of the blame

IFeehQ7kwRGE3f1fXsK_EA.text: Our waiter here was super nice. The hostesses were as well. There was football and I loved being in Paris Las Vegas. We ordered 2 appetizers; buffalo chicken dip & wings. When they arrived, the wings were sitting in oil & the duo had a thick layer of oil on the top. Mixing the dip did nothing for it & we each barely had 1 wing before we decided that eating any more would make us sick. I ended up taking the bread and pretzels from the buffalo chicken dip & using the Dijon mustard on the table to dip it in. Certainly would not recommend those 2 dips

zFVY5vVU4Ld9QK-R-4C1qA.text: I popped in here for lunch. There was a 45 minute wait, but since I was by myself, I was able to grab a seat at the bar instead, fortunately.  The service was a little slow, but they were pretty busy, so it wasn't a big deal to me.  I went with the L'americain burger. It comes with American cheese, onion rings, and mushrooms. The burger was really good and it's a pretty big burger, too so very filling.  She asked what kind of fried I wanted, so I assumed those were included in the price, but when I got the check, it turned out they were an extra $5, so just be aware of that. They were very good fries though.  It was a little pricey for what it is, but I guess that's the norm on the strip.  Overall, I was happy with my choice, although I would rather have gone next door to Planet Hollywood to try Gordon Ramsay's burger place, but I didn't have time.

Ez1hKwnOypWXO22AXdN-ow.text: Went there after purchasing a Groupon deal. This place is tucked inside Paris...in the shopping center. Went around 11 am for lunch and place was half full.  Ordered the lamb burger and seasoned fries. You get to pick your own choice of cheese,toppings and condiments. The lamb burger was huge and very very delicious  I had them make it well done and it was perfectly done....very juicy and tasty. The fries was very tasty too along with the spicy ketchup. The food was so much that I couldn't finish it and had to doggy bag it. Can't wait to go back and eat here again.

ECWS-sWnnVigaFZfHJGI8w.text: Excellent Cobb salad and my friend said the Paris burger was the best burger she ever had.  Service was excellent and the $20 burger / beer combo is hard to beat on the strip.   We also had onion rings and the chicken kabobs.  All delicious.  Definitely better than expected.  We will be back!

4HF22lKovKMBmMojJpJ4YA.text: This was our first time trying Burger Brasserie and it won't be the last. I enjoy a solid hamburger and Burger Brasserie definitely delivered. The food was hot and fresh, the fries were really good. The waiter saw that my cousin had a bacon shirt on and was kind enough to bring out a few extra bacon strips before we even ordered. Touches like that are hard to fine.   I recommend Burger Brasserie for anyone looking for a good solid meal and good atmosphere.

CxHH4vOb78fR8-PcKd97tQ.text: Ordered the Jalapeno burger !! It was amazing! I recommend !!! It was truly a great burger all the ingredients combined together with the nacho cheese and guacamole and chilies it was mouthwatering.  My foodie partner had French toast sliders they weren't no where near good as my burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UXzfZ0N5z_gHGgChU9a3JA.text: Wait time was short. Limited menu, but the options are good for adults. Great Lamb burger!

c-3b2C4gR9gE-h2LcZ5RAA.text: Not very good, ordered French toast sliders from the special menus and it was the worst French toast ever. Drinks were good thank god! Will not be back.

WGT7Mh_WQ3kYclvuws25GA.text: Near the opulent Convention Center of the Paris hotel, this makes an excellent meeting place for attendees. I was able to easily conduct business at the bar, meet clients (old and new), and entertain them and myself with Pinot Grigio and excellent apps.  The Lobster Deviled Eggs are highly recommended: Not too filling but deliciously decadent.

qg_uFYbacqr1sGeX0uQSNQ.text: Christina the server is a credit to this business.  The food is great, prices reasonable (for Vegas), but her service is above and beyond.  Make sure you tip her well!!

iaWP04Zzyt-yTVx-tMrVkg.text: Awesome burgers in the Paris hotel! Great spot to watch sports as well. We are heading back to Vegas next week and will hit this spot on night one!

sZmqxOj9shDnx2Nx9DxaAw.text: Great place. No real complaints. Food was great very satisfying and tasty. Love the parmesan lemon garlic wings and Blr salad.

MdlX8z-2C2boMglTlUe_4w.text: Sat at the bar. Great experience. Food came out fast and delicious. Attentive staff, bartender. We've been here before. We'll be back again!

vtSZe6Y61rCjayfkOLkFJQ.text: Ok. Ok. Ok. I get it. The strip is hellishly expensive and this place is no exception. But hear me out okay?  My boyfriend and I went here with two other couples on a Saturday evening. Our first pleasant surprise was that the wait time was minimal. Next, was the fact that despite the fact it's in a hotel on the strip, it wasn't horribly noisy like most places. Third, the food was absolutely delicious. If I'm going to get stuck paying strip prices for food, I deserve at the very least to get an amazing burger and that is definitely what I got. Also, the pretzels and milkshakes were awesome too. Overall, I would definitely come back if I found myself in the Paris or one of the neighboring hotels, even if it meant I had to pay strip prices.

eCyA_tUZWYvOHAVhW7DmUQ.text: This restaurant has many issues. First the service is very slow. I was there and the restaurant was nearly empty and yet the service was slow. When I opened my silverware the knife was extremely dirty. Something like that should not happen at such an expensive establishment. Next issue was all the condiments on the table were empty. The restaurant was not crowded so there is no reason why a burger place should be running out of such basics. The worst part was a burger was ordered to be cooked to medium well. When it came out it was rare. When pointed out the waitress argued that we were wrong and it was medium, which is still not what was ordered. Another burger was requested and it came out the exact same, but this time we were told that it was medium well, it was the exact same though. Then we were told we could have it cooked to well done instead if we weren't happy. A burger place should know how to cook burgers and they clearly did not. At the end they didn't have us pay for a burger we didn't eat. But after all that trouble and 1/2 of the people not having a meal to eat we still had to pay for the remaining meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lEpOOZPWVKfr2l4NrRTHqg.text: These were exceptional burgers. I had the sliders, sampling the Paris burger and the Bleu burger. Both were very tasty.  Our service was a bit slow but I feel this is not the overall case, just our luck of the draw tonight. I think she might be a little new as she didn't do the upsell and offer desert.

wQ9_Ks19DipKFCAxVFsGLA.text: Its a MUST, as a picky burger lover I can say this is absolutely the best burger you can find on planet earth

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American burger with caramelized onion

mJrtYZUf1s2xdLOb2RcPJw.text: Before heading in to sit down make sure they aren't understaffed.   The poor waitress we had was with about 10 tables on our side.  No one helped her. She was all over the place trying to keep her sanity. The drinks too a bit. Then food came out and my order wasn't even what I had ordered.  When they brought the correct order out it was delicious. Just everyone had finished eating. I'm not sure I would stop back and eat there again.

UT-E1AIIswFpCbpBba3Fhg.text: First time visiting, got seated fairly quickly. Very cool interior, hostess and waiter were very nice. Had a pretty lengthy wait for my burger and wife's French dip. We also ordered waffle fries but we're given the regular French fries. Didn't want to wait any longer so I didn't say anything. The food was pretty good, not spectacular. It was really loud inside, could have just been one large group causing a bulk of the noise, not the restaurant's fault, just an observation. The service was great.

Oq5my01nalyW72om_WqTQw.text: Had a decent lunch at Burger Brasserie on a Thursday.  We arrived around noon and it was not crowded, but certainly busy.  We sat right down and were given the trivia question of the day.  Apparently if you get the question right (which we did) you get 10% off your final bill.  I don't know if they offer you the 10% off if you get it wrong as a nice gesture, but it was a nice little start to the meal.  Our question was about Super Bowl I, and we knew it without using our phones.  No idea if they allow internet-related help in answering the question.  Our server had too many tables, basically half the restaurant, but she did well.  She hustled for refills and beers for us, and we received our food in a fairly reasonable amount of time.  Additionally, she got us the bill and processed the payment quickly.  So, no issues with the service.  To eat, I went with the sliders, which are smaller versions of the cheeseburger (cheese, tomato, pickles), the blue burger (blue cheese, bacon, and garlic aioli) and the Paris burger (blue cheese, grilled onions, and bacon).  Our table also split an order of fries and an order of onion rings, which was enough for 3 people.  The food arrived after about 12 or so minutes.  It was hot and clearly had just been made.  The burgers are small, even for sliders.  And, the meat was thinner than I was expecting.  But, it was cooked properly to medium rare.  The cheeseburger was pretty basic.  My favorite was the blue, but it and the Paris burger were pretty close.  Both had strong tastes of blue cheese and bacon, which is typically a good thing.  I didn't get much of the garlic aioli on the blue burger.  But, I liked them, probably just due to the blue cheese and bacon.  The sides were also fresh, in fact the onion rings were too hot when we first got them.  They are dusted in Cheeto dust and served with what I would describe as a hot Cheeto ranch sauce.  The Cheeto dust was unnecessary but the sauce was really good.  Surprisingly good.  We all liked it and dipped both the onion rings and fries in it.  The server noticed we were running low and offered to bring us more.  Very interesting sauce, and one we all liked.  The fries were standard thin french fries, served with spiced ketchup.  It's not spicy, but it definitely doesn't taste like standard ketchup.  Again, I liked it.  Bruger Basserie does sauces very well in my limited experience.  I can see watching a game here, it is definitely a sports bar type joint.  As far as the burgers go, there are plenty of places on the Strip to get better burgers.  But, I've also had worse on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slider meal, $13.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the daily sports trivia question right, get 10% off the bill.

yZVwFg38RRRVXipgiE25ZQ.text: Our last day here & before we realized time was short.   We were craving a good burger, & like most consumers a bit not clear whether this would be a hit or miss.  At this time, we had checked out of hotel, so we had luggage in tow.  We decided we would eat one last good meal.   So here we are, this location is right next door to Ballys.  This restaurant had nice ramps, luggage & ADA convenience.  This place had a lot of TV's so the spouse was sold already.    I had the make your own burger, Kobe meat with with Tillamook cheese.  If you love cheddar, you would love Tillamook.  This place offers many options & varieties when it comes to burgers.  I can't see no mistakes here.  The burger was made medium rare- oh my! The buns were available in different ways, onion, wheat etc.  The restaurant lightly toasts the bun & provides many, various toppings. I was NOT disappointed.   Oh yes, the fries portion was substantial enough for 2 people & seasoned just right!  The hubby lol reformed beef water, had a Philly Cheese steak, with onion Soup. I  think he stopped eating only to breathe.   Hubby was very pleased with his big A$$ sandwich.      If you are staying @ Ballys, make sure to get s coupon 20% off during lunch hours.  Also, make sure to present players card for points.   We would definitely eat here again!

ru-HwmKgnHI58PiJhcRipw.text: Ok burger place.   Nothing was WOW.   The burger was good.  The fries were good.  The service slow slow slow.   I was surprised how slow it was considering it was a Thursday afternoon.     In the area there are other burger places that I would spend my money in.

c1b1qA2yRr1dQdP1NE9bAg.text: All-around great dining experience at this restaurant on Christmas Eve lunch time. My folks and I were trying to find a comfortable restaurant that was reasonably priced and had good comfort food, without much delay for table.   The service was friendly and spectacular, the vibe was busy but quiet enough to have conversation, and the food was great. I went for the $19.99 Burger with the choice of beer and fries or onion rings. The onion rings were spectacular, but as this is a burger themed restaurant, I would have to say they knocked it out of the park. One of my all-time favorite burgers, perfectly cooked and so flavorful. My folks really enjoyed their meal as well, everyone happy.  Highly recommend this establishment, which is just off the Bally's Casino floor maybe 50 feet into the hallway on the way to Paris. Go grab a burger today, you will love it.

rPWn4t5JautLYwyVsWUABA.text: You'll find a nice atmosphere here. Lots of televisions and a decent sized sandwich menu. But it's really overpriced even by current Vegas standards. Really, $16 for a basic sandwich and another $7 for fries??? Give me a break. And then you top it off with crappy service and I'll definitely find other options.

UYRlQS9RsNOAz4-IfNgVSQ.text: So gross! Everything seemed to be frozen packaged food. Their Ketchup was disgusting and I love ketchup. The buns fell apart, the 'veggie' Pattie was literally crushed mushrooms somehow held together with paste. Never again!

TqEmL8sJ8cLsYQ4VOuFKGA.text: This place is a joke. My boyfriend and I came here to try their burgers. Failed!!!  First of all the host was ok. Our server was terrible. For Christ sake the server sucks and the service was very effin terrible. I would never come here ever. The freaking burger is damn expensive and doesn't even tasted good.  The sauce was great tho and that's about it. The freaking server takes forever to check up on us and refill our drinks. Wow! Great job for the service.  Overall experienced was 1star. First impression counts and this place doesn't have that. Terrible terrible. Stay away from this place.

5HkOAqIFiJtoaGI86a6_0w.text: This was our first stop when we got off the plane and to the hotel. It was pretty early and there weren't a lot of people inside so we were seated immediately. Our server, Billy, was super nice and attentive. We ordered drinks, burgers, and two types of fries (regular & sweet potato). The first drink came out really quickly but it took a lot longer for the other two. The drinks were pretty good. My only complaint here is that my Caipirinha had a little bit too much sugar. The burgers and fries came out almost simultaneously, as they should. Both of the fries were good, I think the sweet potato ones (w/ mayo-based sauce) were my favorite. I got the Champagne Turkey Burger and it was pretty good but I wish I had asked for no bacon. Don't get me wrong, I love bacon, but I don't think it belongs on a turkey burger. (Especially because most people order a turkey burger as a healthier alternative.) What matters most, though, is that we all left full and satisfied with our lunch. Shout out to Billy for taking us from hangry to happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champagne burger

3xzbyTuxxYz8l_LTbSqSBA.text: Honestly, I'm surprised this place isn't rated higher! I really enjoyed this place. It has a great feel to it. I wouldn't have picked this place if it wasn't for the coupon I got. Paris has such nice bakeries and cafes, and this place gets kind of lost in that scene.   Anyway, they weren't that many people there. Our waitress gave us waters pretty quickly and introduced herself. She did a pretty good job overall.  As for the food, my friends and I all got burgers. I got the L'American burger with avocado, my friend got the L'Italian burger and my other friend got the Kobe burger. We all got it medium cooked. It was perfect for two of us, but my friend who ordered the Kobe beef said it was a bit rarer than he liked it to be. We all enjoyed our burgers. They don't look filling, but oh my, they are. NOTE: Fries don't come with the burger, they cost an extra $2 (it sucks I know).  Two of us ordered dessert. I ended up getting the Chocolate Tiramisu and my friend ordered the Dessert Sliders. The tiramisu was fantastic. It came in a cup, which was kind of weird. You had to dig deep in order to get all the flavors and layers. It was a HUGE portion, so watch out! The sliders were very interesting. It was something I've never seen before. They looked like mini burgers, but they were really raspberry, mango and cheesecake gelatin shaped into tomatoes, cheese and a patty. It was surprisingly pretty good.  Overall, had a great experience here and would come back again.

-uOfSy9aElB1KMl9Z0RpuA.text: I hear this place rocked, on par with Mandalay's Burger Bar - but different! So I had to give it a try, because Burger Bar is awesome!  They have a Burger, Fries and Drink combo - Sweet!  Note: If you show your players card, you get  $1 off , WOW a whole dollar. I love how the entire menu has a special blue column for "Players card" pricing and everything is just $1 less then the original price. They should just put a note at the bottom of the menu instead of repeating every price.   Burger: I opted for the Lamb Burger. Cooked perfectly, it was delicious. I ony made it through half, it was so big. I wish it tasted like lamb instead of beef. The lamb flavor was so distinct, it was easy to miss.  Sweet Potato Fries: PERFECT!  Milkshake: Banana, Mmm! Best ever! It looks small but this sucker's huge!  I would definitely return but this place would not be the first place I visit. More of a I have extra time and already went to all my fav's, now what? Place.

fgkYNYWC_OzfDlMTt_EVqw.text: Good, large burger (got Paris one) Avg. fries Awesome milkshake!  Got $30 groupon and really enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Milkshake

QHsmXRcULjyeGb0HlQ14hA.text: Came here once before over a year ago for work but only had their shrimp salad which was good. This time I came here with my 3 siblings and bf for Restaurant Week!  For our first course we had stuffed potato skins and wow that was full of flavor!   Second course we all ordered the beef burger BUT its not just any burger. It's a beef burger with 2 grilled cheese sandwiches as the bun. Needless to say, wholly shit it was big! We all ended up removing one grilled cheese bun and using the other one as our bun. I liked the wafffles fries a lot more than the regular fries.   Third course was cheesecake with blueberry and lemon. That was the first time I've had cheesecake that was not so sweet. My sisters and I packed ours for home as we were stuffed and gave it to our parents (and my dad REALLY loved the cheesecake since he is not a sweets person). I shared a plate with the bf and my sisters took my brother's cheesecake.   I don't remember much about the service, the waitresses was nice is all I remembered, lol. Must be food coma!  I would definitely come here again esp for those stuffed potato skins!

xBwqUsfyJEfrHZS31Pb9fQ.text: It was almost 9PM when we went in for dinner and we were all hungry and jetlagged. We were seated right away but it took a while for a waiter come to order drinks. The waiter was friendly and patient when we asked about the burgers and toppings since it was our first time there. I ordered "le classique and pomme frites", which was a regular beef burger with fries. The burger was amazing; the meat was cooked perfectly and the toppings were fresh and tasty. The fries, on the other hand, were not so hot because they were way too hard and crunchy. Don't order the French onion soup because it is VERY VERY salty!!   I don't think I will be coming back unless I'm craving a burger because well, there are just so many other great restaurants on the Strip to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular burger with skinny fries

AIfZRf5gj6Azjf5O3bcTqQ.text: I like the unique flavors here. For a gourmet burger place, there's lots of quirky sides that shine. Cheetoh-dusted onion rings, poutine, and Mac and cheeseburger bites that are to die for. Yes, you read that right. They one upped mac and cheese bites and added delicious ground beef. I'm a fan of their waffle fries, but you can order regular fries or sweet potato. I decided to go with a traditional Kobe beef burger with crispy onions, while my girlfriend tried the lamb with avocado and bacon. Both were excellent and cooked to perfection. The cherry on top of all of this amazing food was the Oreo shake we ordered. I am not big on shakes, but this is hands down the best milkshake I will probably ever have. It was spiked, though you couldn't tell. It was smooth, creamy, and I couldn't get enough. The presentation of the food is also really fun. Cones for fries, and the burgers come with toothpicks in the center with BB initials. Little touches like this are sure to be appreciated by those who pay attention to detail.  The service is a tiny bit slow, and the burgers do take a bit to cook. The waitresses dress in very showy outfits, so it's not the best restaurant for kids. There are bright red corsets, fishnets, and clevage involved. From the outside you can already tell it's a sports bar. It's not really French themed at all, except for a french word thrown in the title. This restaurant definitely caters to men. There are games on the flat screens and a hearty drink menu. It's best to go during Happy Hour to take full advantage of their selection. The price is moderate for a Vegas restaurant, especially one located inside a casino. We paid $40 in all for the appetizer, drinks, and two entrees with fries. I wish the fries came with your burger, since you're paying $9-15 for just a singular burger. Not cheap, but certainly could have cost more since it's Vegas. Well done, Burger Brasserie! (Get it?)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe burger
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb burger with bacon

utbZ0PPNOvSGoZXjYKgZyg.text: It's hard to give this place a rating because our experience varied so much after a single meal.  The restaurant is large and well decorated. The staff is friendly enough, but the service is slow.  We started with the potato skins, which were OK. It's bar food, so it isn't fantastic, but the skins were thick and well cooked. The accompanying BBQ sauce and ranch tasted like something you'd buy from a grocery store; it wouldn't surprise me if they didn't make it in house. The guacamole that came with it was pretty good.  We split a Kobe burger with caramelized onions and waffle fries. The patty was excellent, the toppings were fresh, and I thought the bun was really good. It's one of the best burgers I've had. The waffle fries were thick, but they tasted like they were frozen beforehand.  I want to give this place a higher rating, but I'd have to try more and the service would have to be better. I wouldn't mind going back but I wouldn't make a special trip of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato skins

rXBQbyy7Q3RSmHcldN8GUw.text: This pace is a shadow of what it used to be. Service is slow, food came out on a hot plate and was still cold. Lame

2J5gkA2uFdmV5zgEoqZMDw.text: To round off the shitty burger experiences In Vegas:La Burger Brasserie at the Paris. We asked to see the menu first and the host assured us the food was made in house, so we got a seat. We got a cute but small booth and the waiter, a crazy stoner, was a bit too eager to accomodate. I ordered and asked again if the burger was made in house and he said sorry no, they get them frozen. WTF??? No seriously, WTF??? Again, charging $14 for a burger, no sides and my veggie burger would have been a damn frozen boca, even the waiter agreed its better to get them at the grocery store and slap em in the pan yourself. With that another restaurant we walked out of that day.

G2002TTFDuDr1ubqiaeklQ.text: food was sooo soo good...paris burger.com...caba rita delish!!

cU9Okg7lmoXgLdROcySKdw.text: Fun sports bar type atmosphere.  The burgers are all al la carte which was great for us as we were not hungry enough for a large burger (they are good sized) and fries.  Service was great but I wished the burgers had been a little better.  Asked for a medium temperature burger but basically got well done.

jOEyEEmavZthg4yGE6zr_w.text: I decided to give Le Burger Brasserie a try since I've already been to other popular burger spots of the Strip, Burger Bar and BLT Burger. And no, I didn't try the $777 Burger with or without the bottle of Dom. What I like about staying at the Harrah's properties is how they give you discount coupons to restaurants from each property. They gave me a $5 off coupon for Le Burger Brasserie, so that instantly swayed me to go here for a burger. I liked how they were open at 10:30am on Sunday for NFL Football (yelp.com/user_local_phot...). All the waiters and waitress were sporting NFL team jerseys. The atmosphere was fun and how great is it to be watching NFL Football with crazy fans while enjoying a good burger. It's a great combination! I ordered the Le Kobe Burger with a Fried Egg for my topping (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) because who doesn't like Fried Eggs on their Burgers? Along with some Skinny Fries. Had my burger cooked medium rare, though it was more medium well. But it was ok since it was the morning that I arrived in Vegas and I was super hungry that I wanted to just devour something. The Kobe Burger was ok, but since they overcooked it to medium well, it wasn't as good as the one I had over at Burger Bar. Still good nonetheless and the Fries were very crispy and seasoned well. Fun dining experience and maybe down the road I'll try their $777 Burger, without the bottle of Dom of course. 4 Stars!
