photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Kobe Burger w/ Fried Egg and Skinny Frittes
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NFL Football at the bar.

dFdrUs4TiuCf5WtCk0AYNg.text: Even if the food would've been MIND-BLOWING, it'd still only get as high as 3 stars. Why one star?   The service: The service was completely subpar for such a seemingly swanky place. They got it wrong from the start. Our order came out in what can only be described as clearly over the average wait for a meal-close to 20 min. BUT WAIT, there's more... that simply alone wouldn't warrant a single, lonesome star.   During our meal, our server didn't come by til the end only to refill our drinks; didn't engage us, didn't ask if we needed anything-granted we didn't actually need anything, but it still woulda been nice to know she's on top of things.   Finally after our meal-which I'll write about in a sec-it was time for dessert. I would've asked our server for a dessert menu but she was MIA and after sitting there for 10 minutes with empty plates someone else comes to collect them. So I ask HIM for a dessert menu and he has this "deer in headlights" look. Lol. He just says, "Ok" and walks away never to be seen or heard from again. But our waitress did come by eventually, NOT with a dessert menu but with the damn bill. WTF happened to the menu? Lol. Sadly, it took another 20 minutes from the time she brought the bill to us getting up after paying.   Now the food:  I myself ordered the Campagne turkey burger. It was pretty good, but turkey was a bit dry. It was definitely lacking something though. BTW, don't expect fries or ANY side to come with that burger though. You'll have to cough up $7 for fries-which would be fine if they were fantastic fries!!! But they were just "eh". And as for condiments or dipping sauces? They don't have much and what the do have is "fancied up" superfluously.   All-in-all, as a local, I can't actually recommend this place and I don't see myself coming back.

7qveznnyLbrdKttpmaSfRQ.text: The food was delicious. Fast service and clean place. If your looking for a quite place this is not the pub for you It was extremely loud which i dont mind

Qyfd08I5PmPvT9c0qSbZnQ.text: Fantastic, our server Ashley was great. We will definitely come back. We had the French Dip, French Onion Burger and the Blue Cheese Burger with two virgin milkshakes (captain crunch and peanut butter chocolate)

jN0inhp8860_DsD-FCaPkg.text: Above-average burger, below-average service.  This joint is right on the border between Paris and Bally's. It looks nice and inviting. You might wait a little while to be acknowledged. You might wait even longer after you're done for someone to let you pay for your meal. You might wait a bit for a drink.  The burger is decent; better than many. They claim to be able to make burgers medium-rare, but mine arrived medium both times. Still, even medium, it was a good burger. It's a few dollars overpriced.  The fries are soft and unremarkable. You can replace them with some onion rings, which are good, but they are eight dollars and you get five of them.  Overall, you'll feel like you paid too much for what you got.  Bottom line: if you're in Paris or Bally's, you'll find a decent burger here. But it's not worth traveling for.

vE7skzmSoegAyNrhBxtATA.text: Our server Genevieve was absolutely amazing! Our waters were always full and she took care of us and explained everything on the menu.  My burger was amazing - Paris burger and I substituted a fried egg for the caramelized onions. The Brie was outstanding on my burger. Huge portions. My mom got the French dip and was impressed!  Definitely stop and eat here!

992yV9hzNMquEE1fQVatqg.text: The food gets 4 stars.  The service gets 0 stars.  We ordered and did not see our waiter at all after that. To get our drinks refilled we had to stop another waiter.  When it was time to go, we waited 15 minutes for our checks. He finally came and gave us our checks, However, he did not return to take our payment.....  We ended up having to go to the bar and pay.   If you don't have enough waiters for tables, do not sit more people down.

HPBdynusMCifhSwwLn7oLQ.text: We found ourselves wondering this end of the strip for some hole in the wall bar and were drawn in here by our thirst, hunger and lack of direction. They also had a happy hour sign out front creating the illusion of a good drink at a reasonable price. Table service was decent, bar service not so much. Drinks were really weak, even when ordering a double and rather slow for a place that was more than half empty.I guess the beer specials were decent and maybe that's what they count on when trying to draw in a specific clientele into this sports bar. If you like the standard 'Coors Light' then I think this is your place. None of us did so I can't speak of the value on the buckets of beer. We had a few drinks, some waffle fries which were the highlight of our visit and hit the road.

LsYeZYC3moJ1AYfnZ_ejHA.text: I got the La Campagne Turkey Burger with turkey bacon, fried egg and white cheddar cheese... the burger was good, but not special. I wouldn't go back just because it is Vegas and there is so much other spectacular things to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. royale with cheese haha nah this is the turkey burger and blue moon combo :)

yACwRpGj9PruC4K_Ht-qIw.text: Overall rating is 4.5 stars out of 5.  This place by far is one of the better restaurants my wife and I visited while in Vegas.   We decided to go to this place for lunch on 05/17/13. Since it was later in the evening and we planned on eating dinner in a few hours we thought we would make it a light lunch so we both decided we would order salads.  Our waitress (Who's name was Zenzen yeah I know) was by far the best server we had. She was cheerful, helpful, and very attentive.  She took our orders which was a chopped salad and a grilled chicken ceasar salad. My wife ordered the chopped salad and I had the grilled chicken ceasar salad.  The meals arrived in a reasonable amount of time and not only did they look good and plentiful but both salads tasted delicious as well. I mean my grilled chicken was grilled to perfection and the salad was dressed with just the right amount of ceasar dressing and cheese. And it also had soft croutons (If any of you are like me when it comes to salads then you know it is hard to restaurants that serve salads with the softer croutons because I can't stand croutons that are hard enough to break or chip your teeth). My wife said her chopped salad was also perfectly dressed and seasoned. It was actually so much that she couldn't even finish it.  Overall this place is a must visit if you are ever in the Bally's hotel. The only reason I didn't give this place a 5 star rating is because I didn't order there specialty which are burgers which I can not vouch for. However, the chopped and grilled chicken ceasar salads are top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This Grilled Chicken Ceasar Salad was scrumptious!

bv3ri9KTFTmwGSwLjN_BgA.text: Absolute worst experience that I have ever had at a restaurant. I am not sure his name, but the bartender was extremely rude and we even had to go grab our own ketchup and mustard. I will never go back to this place, due to the very rude bartender! Awful experience and very expensive, as the fries cost an extra $7 for a small order.

sbbMP4WPWulz7GJiUmTTtA.text: Nice sports bar/restaurant atmosphere. Great and friendly service. Sandwiches are a la carte so sides are at an additional cost. Worth paying extra because the waffle fries and regular fries were tasty. I like that you could customize your burger with type of bun, meat and toppings. Affordable and nice size burgers.

5Jf1HTzO-l3hkS_t6RXdjw.text: Really like this place. TVs everywhere and food taste good. Burger cooked to perfection and their salmon is really tasty. Located between Paris and Bally's, easy access to the strip. Will come back here whenever we visit Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

icXA6eaAzAM33jSBubj9ow.text: Honestly the service was so bad that it made me feel uncomfortable. Came in 10 minutes before closing (and we planned to stay for only 20 mins when other guests were there longer than us). We're paying customers and the fact that the host was very petty and rude as well as the server was extremely disappointing.

pSnCaEtWoBoejctRzfUdsg.text: Pretty good upscale burgers. Very stiff drinks that will get you exactly where you need to be. Kinda pricy (around 13-17 bucks for a burger).

yPVFRvm4Qo77j7dNBHgixA.text: This was my first visit.  The menu seems good(if you can eat dairy).  Sadly I cannot, which our server Kevin was nice enough to help me with.  He was a little short tonight, but overall he seems to know what he is doing.  I brushed it off as an off day for him.  I ordered the chicken tenders and plain fries.  The food came out very hot!!!  Great quality as far as taste and freshness.  If this restaurant was closer to home, I would consider going again.  However, I was bothered by the ambiance.  I understand it is located on the strip, but why is your hostess dressed in fishnet leggings and a corset that looks like it belongs in a strip club?  The other staff are sporting World Cup soccer T-shirt's.  The lights were low, and the scenery feels a bit more upscale...A bit.  So if you can imagine eating fancy sliders and chicken fingers while watching a half naked hostess(who really didn't even fit her clothes)walk around, you can understand why I felt uncomfortable seeing some elderly people trying to enjoy there dinners.  It felt awkward.  Add this to the scenery and it all confuses me.  Great food, typical Vegas style atmosphere.  Why not?

aswWQC6NSUnHNukwgvmIWA.text: Good selection of burgers. I opted for the BBQ burger medium rare and it was pretty close to the desired temperature. It was about 5:40 when I sat down at a high top in the bar area and most of the bar seats were taken with the restaurant was about 1/3 full on a Wednesday.    The bartender came over and greeted me within 2 minutes and I received my drink within 2 minutes of ordering plus my food surprisingly arrived maybe 5-7 minutes after that.   The burger and fries were tasty and the bartender continued to check up on me appropriately throughout the time I was there. Plenty of TV screens which could feature a number of sporting events (tonight was a variety of baseball teams).   Music is playing and there is lively conversation but it's easy to talk and hear the person you are with. Tables and booths are available and afford privacy compared to some restaurants which stack the tables together as close as possible.  Burger $13, fries $6 and happy hour 2-4-1 drink another $6 for the two. While yes you can find occasional am discounts here or there or utilize coupons I consider this a very good deal for the strip. I definitely recommend.

tfCl_Sg5XuxcJxolQXd0Og.text: Well if you don't want service or are not in any rush  this place is for you.   It took over 10mins just for her to come to our table to say she would be right with us.    Once she came over for drinks and I asked if they had a specific vodka she left,  served 5 tables and returned with the answer 10 mins later.    The happy hour is fine its a nice 2 for 1 deal on all drinks 4-7 and 9-close but with the service your lucky to get one drink in an hr.    My husband and I ordered the beet salad and after eating it we realized they forgot to add the goat cheese to our salads.  The salad was good or it was that were were starting from waiting 45mins for food.    You can use your total rewards card here for a discount.  We will not be coming back due to slow service.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet salad and they forgot the cheese

bM8N3CugPlhqPyJxtisAyA.text: What a horrible experience here. Great food by the way, but horrible customer service. So it was 7 of us, and we all got fries with our food but we were not told they were extra. When ordering our burgers, our server Christina asked what kind of fries we'll like with that, Regular or Sweet Potato fries? So we assumed it came with the burgers. So they got us for $42 extra just on fries, they did not tell us fries were extra until we asked about it when we got our receipt. I even spoke with the manager and he didn't offer any sort of accommodation or a refund. Not the right way to do business.

6WSNi_d8f8B-YBd5P0u2fA.text: 3.5 stars  This place was our last stop for dinner before heading back to the airport this past weekend.    When we got there around 6, there was a 25 minute wait but after looking inside, we noticed a lot of open tables.  At least 10-15 tables open.  We waited anyways, then after 15 minutes, we asked how much longer and why there are so many tables.  I guess they were severly understaffed... hmmmmmm.  Anyways, the wait time was pretty accurate and we got sat.  Friendly waitress came over and took our order.  I got the burger/fries combo with the regular beef burger.  You get to choose 1 topping, of course i have to choose bacon.  And waffle fries.  Others in our 4-some got the lamb burger, the kobe burger, and some corn chowder.  Everyone enjoyed their food, service was good.  But the restaurant always had the ~10 tables open and the servers didn't seem thattt busy.. oh well.

nJAYhX3LMv3g6DiqFhMqqw.text: Second time we ate here. Awesome service and a great value for the excellent good they offer. Our burgers and French dip were top shelf. The onion rings were delicious, and there's plenty on the menu for everyone. Defiantly worth a visit!

cwsz6qB8xW2XIoJZkoU8fA.text: This was seriously one of the best burgers my friends and I have had.....at least our first trip =(((  About a year later we came back because we knew the food was bomb. The menu this time around looked a lot different.. not just what was on it but how it was "styled". I'm assuming that pretty much mean't that they were probably under new management or something.   The burgers second time around weren't cooked very well (dry) and pretty bland.  My friend and I both got a lamb burger while the rest got beef but seemed as though we all were pretty much on the same page about the quality (or lack of) especially compared to the first time.  Ugh they were sooooo good before, WHY?! Hopefully we went on an off night but who knows. The service was actually really friendly, so no problem there for us. The food was just disappointing. Will check out BurGR next time instead...  Also! They had a groupon when we went the second time, if you decide to check this place out look on groupon so you can get a discount.

pp76Imn_N9fwUv86aowK4A.text: It is very easy to mail in service at Burger joint especially when it is not particularly busy. However, our server Amanda was highly attentive and genuinely engaged. We got every question answered and had treated us like VIPS.  The food was actually really good, I had the BBQ Chicken Burger and it was very moist with a robust flavor. My father and I shared the Cheetos coated Onion Rings which came recommended by Amanda. They were ofcourse amazing and after the horrible experience we had at Laggasse Stadium the night before I will definitely be recommending this spot for the next sports outting !

jBme9bPcllaZx-tbM0lsqA.text: Ate here and had a very good clam chowder.  Bill came to about $29 total.  Then I get an alert from Visa for a $102.05 from this restaurant.  Checked on-line and found 2 charges, $29 and $102.05.  Had to return to the restaurant to straighten out the extra charge.  Eventually the charge was removed.  Not something you want to waste time on during vacation.  Food was good, but be sure to check your charge card account afterward. While waiting for the manager to fix this, I told others about the problem and to be sure to check their charge account afterward.  Hostess got upset and told me not to talk to others.  Hell, they needed to know too that this restaurant could be billing them an extra $100.   Alex our server also disappeared for extended periods of time.

oKQLZYKsOUW7pPyt8CVWRw.text: Menu looked fantastic, but it wasn't very good. The gravy fries were completely limp & gravy was terrible. Service was pretty slow too. Burgers were better tho.

w5kGX6_834wsaEZ7MBt8rg.text: Burger Brasserie curious.~  I got to try this Burger joint after the recommendation of a Paris employee from the players club as she recommended this place as a sports bar with good food after asking her about different options in the area. This restaurant ended up being the perfect spot for a casual lunch for burgers and more!   Upon entering this is located on the edge before the split between Paris and Bally's. The female servers are dressed up semi scandalous in the lingerie like outfits, but still semi-classy and professional staff. The area we had dined in was the corner which was nice and spacious.   The ambiance is nice and casual at the same time. Pricing here is about average and a good variety to satisfy cravings and cater to burger lovers along with plenty of drink options! =]   FOOD: Lemon Garlic Parmesan Wings, Hot Wings, Paris Burger, Almond Joy Dessert  DRINK:  Cab-arita and Caramel Macchiato Smoothie   The food was plentiful and served fresh! My Paris Burger was excellent with brie cheese, caramelized onion,smoked bacon.. MmMm brie  cheese! Both drinks I had were awesome from my alky and non-alky drink, and the ending with the dessert was a nice close to all the tasty food!   Overall, Burger Brasserie has fab service, a fun ambiance, and most importantly delicious food and drinks. =]

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almond Joy
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel Macchiato Smoothie
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium well done

xD0z0l0vc6iBAChaHmV2vA.text: I went here with my friend on vacation and we had Sienna as a waitress. Not only was the food sub par at best but the server was extremely rude to us. My first (and last) time here.

SJIh8D4cFT-Rq_asYTmdyg.text: We stopped here for our last meal in Vegas, It was a cool morning and the service was incredible.   I remember that the coffee was far too strong, and I said something, it was immediately replaced with what ever drink I wanted. I asked for an latte, which they did without issue. Their brewed coffee, apparently had an issue and no one had spoken up. Because I did, they were able to fix it.   The food was delicious. I had eggs and meat, and the boy had pancakes, which he said were heavenly. I would reccomend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YZQEcEzlSvE7sBvcwFBtvQ.text: Slow Service. Burgers were dry. Tried to pay for ticket, and ended up waiting for 10 mins because they had to wait for manager to split the ticket. We were there for 1 1/2 hours and the place was not packed. Don't understand why the service was slow. Tried to give them the benefit of the doubt, but they failed to impress. Won't be coming back.

h9Tlx-K3FcqSmwm7aYvl2g.text: We went here today and were seated pretty fast. That's the best part about this restaurant. It took our serve 20 mins to acknowledge us. After taking our food and drink orders It took about 20 mins for the drinks to come. After that we were seated at 8:30 we didn't receive food until 9:30. Which is pretty ridiculous. I order steak and It didn't have any flavor. It just tasted like grill no seasoning what so ever. The burger was bland as well. The only thing we did like were the wings. The wings were great. Could've been crispier but they were good. If you want fried wings I would go here other wise just shave your money.

cm8fXM4Lgs-g7uefoZTRdQ.text: Place is a dive. Sat next to the computer where staff puts in orders. They also congregate three at a time and complain about working there. A!so using touch n go language. Our server was Billy and the guy was a hot mess. Not interested in serving us. Never asked if we wanted desert. If you wanna pay 20$ for a mediocre burger then by all means enjoy

VXAA26sqeRgQMcDrIZk1HQ.text: The atmosphere is fine but the food was just okay. We ordered onion rings as an appetizer and nowhere on the menu did it say they came with Cheetos dust on them. GROSS. And this is coming from someone who likes Cheetos. My boyfriend hated them as well so we were pretty irritated that the menu didn't mention it. The fries were delicious but the rest of our meal was nothing to write home about. We will not be returning.

SdISLQnC6Jp1nf-p_ujBcg.text: How do one order a Champagne burger and get it with no Bacon or fried egg? Then it's brought to us on the side. We ordered a complete burger not a half order.

5xwwmsQyTVus-9mM2oT9cQ.text: It's a burger place with a bar. They have a pretty good selection on tap though. The bar food is pretty good. I had a burger...medium. it was spot on. They do have shrimp salad and wings so that everyone is happy.

t8o_aP8V32hug-AYgw6kPw.text: This burger bar is located in between the Paris and Ballys.  It was pretty empty at 830 on a Wednesday so I ordered to go.  Food came out in 15 min and was hot. The original cheeseburger was OK.  Meat wasn't anything special, but the secret sauce is good.  It just wasn't memorable. I also tried the Flamin' Hot Cheeto onion rings.  I guess you could taste the seasoning, but the onion rings were large and spongy.  They needed to be cooked more, but also probably taste better when eaten in the restaurant.  You only get like 8 for an $8 order.  For $23 this is OK - but there are way better options around

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not a big crowd at 830 on a Wednesday
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger - kind of ordinary
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flamin Hot Cheeto Onion Rings - don&#39;t get for takeout

XHpY_Fao55twpXBnZGfuAg.text: First time eating here... great salad..  great burger and super great service by our waitress Chelsea.. thanku .. i quiet enjoyed it..

Yf9H-kF7FaHPy8wb8HHCdg.text: My friends and I were just looking for a quick place to grab some food and the hostess caught our attention and showed us the menu. I was intrigued by their prime rib dip, which was actually pretty amazing. I requested for no horse radish though, because I'm not particularly a fan of that taste.  My friends got all different burgers, and they seemed to enjoy it. The burgers were a decent size and weren't slider sized at all. The bun to meat ratio was good.  Service was really friendly. They refilled our drinks pretty quickly and more than half of the time, I didn't even notice that they were refilling the drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HkGN1_eTGubBAeYbD7lF1w.text: We had a party of 10 and they had us wait 15 minutes for a table which was perfectly fine. Once we were sat no one even acknowledged us. We looked around and waited some more. After 20 minutes of nothing i got up and asked the baryender if he could help me find a server to help us. He replied "I'm just the bartender, I don't deal with that side". I then asked him if he could get a supervisor for us and maybe they could help. He said ok and walked away. We sat for another 10 minutes and no one ever came. We got up and left. So disappointed. For our first time at Paris this was not how we wanted to be treated or experience. Our kids were so hungry and tired from our long drive to Las Vegas and to have to deal with that was horrible. Steer clear of the Burger Brasserie. It's not worth the wait.

IvzJCjyTWKbqISI8LiS-pQ.text: First time here; ordered NY steak, perfectly medium and dee-lish! Ambient is relaxed and not noisy at all your typical sports bar ! My b/f had the Italian burger and says it was yummy. My dish came with fries a 2 onion rings, his waffle fries! Price reasonably for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full bar

1LJqKgj9H5OnYvg6DWibRg.text: This is a really busy place because it is located inside the Paris Hotel and Casino (in the walk way near Bally's Hotel and Casino).  We were able to get seated quickly but had a long wait to get our order and be served.  The staff doesn't have time to be nice as they are just trying to keep up with their tables.  We did not try the hamburgers on this trip but had previously and they are okay.  On this trip, we had a beer and several appetizers.  The beer choices are great and the number of TVs is really nice.  The sliders were good but all the other appetizers are just okay.  We are not sure if we will return. The price vs. value makes it difficult.  There are so many options in Las Vegas.

j6_V2AgLeo0OEuI9xbCSRg.text: If I could give 0 stars I would. The most unpleasant experience I've had at a restaurant in perhaps my entire life.  We came in and the hostess told us it was a 10 minute wait or the bar had seats. After opting for the bar we over hear the bartender loudly telling her "to put us on the waitlist. There is no way he will serve us." We looked around and it wasn't busy so I have no idea why he was so hostile. After waiting more than 10 minutes he comes over and says "fine, let's get it over with". Not only that but he took more than 10 more minutes to get us out beers from the tap that was literally between us and him.  As the meal continued he complained at a yelling level of volume about the game that was on. Also accused the patrons of not caring about his hometown team and generally made everyone uncomfortable.  That night my roommate and I both got food poisoning. That was the only meal we shared that day so one and one equals this restaurant is nasty. When my food arrived it did smell a bit off but I just chalked it up to my nose being a little off due to winter. Big mistake!

zBc4BCOoJirVyPtSLmXWOQ.text: Atmosphere is nice. Food was good. Only problem was we were told we could split an order of fries between 3 people, and when the checks arrived we were told it couldn't be split.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California chicken burger, sweet potato fries, and bloody mary

AdAYubpj41P34dSCQnKDvA.text: It's not a bad place for a decent burger, I got the lamb one medium, a bit overcooked and a slight gamey flavor.  Had the mango smoothie which included mango puree with apple juice.  Very disappointing, had chunks of ice in the smoothie and was not blended properly.  This is $9 too, Jamba Juice could do a better job for less than half the price.  Total bill came out to $23, ouch.  Their service needs work, tried to call them for a take out order, no answer.  When I came, there were two hostesses talking with each other and not doing much.  Could they answer the phone, perhaps?  That could have saved some time instead of waiting for my order.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avoid the mango smoothie got chunks of ice... Unacceptable for $9!

Ge2B0FIiiUXPlj_0yELUAg.text: We had a F&B credit from Bally's so we decided to try this place out. The place was practically empty and we were told it would be a 10 minutes for a table. It turned out to be almost 15 minutes. Out of all of the empty seats in the restaurant the hostess tried to seat us at a table right in front of the kitchen. It was extremely loud and I had to ask for another table. We waited forever for the waiter to come by and at least bring us water. The waiter finally came over to tell us he would be with us shortly. We waited another 5-7 minutes for him to come back. He could have at least brought us water while we waited. We hurried up and placed an order so he wouldn't disappear again. I'm very shocked that the burgers aren't served with a side. Really? A side of fires should be included with a $15-$20 burger. The fries are $8 extra. My husband had a regular cheeseburger and said it was good. We shared an order of pretzels and they were okay. Not a fan of the dipping sauces. There are plenty of other food options in Bally's/Paris to choose from. I won't be

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzel appetizer
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger

rBcKNGgvYQlfPo1Es_CEWQ.text: Surprisingly delicious cheeseburger and French fries. My friend and I both went with the burger, fries, and draft beer deal for $20. The spicy ketchup is an interesting twist for the fries.   I wish my burger came with pickles and also was surprised by the quickness to provide the check by the waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger

vlT8aYLvXoO_lslQrl2V3A.text: I give this place 5 stars for the quality of food and great value in an expensive place like Vegas.  I have been here twice in the few months.  My favorite is the promenade chicken burgers: shallots, bacon and brie on ground chicken.  The onion rings and waffle fries are also great.  Both are perfectly crispy and well seasoned.  2 burgers and an order of fries to share will cost around $25 for a filling and tasty meal. The joint is great for watching sports or just catching a bite.

a1ipfHidT3vrMkD_3YM5JA.text: Kind of an odd place but atleast the food and service was good. At first I also thought this was some sort of wanna be fancy burger joint but its actually real laid back (no reservations needed on a saturday night I went).   I really wanna give my review 4 stars BUT the burgers don't come with any fries?!?! I knew this before hand since I looked the menu online but whats up with that? I know this is Vegas and money talks but come on now! Besides that though, the burger was good. I had the classic on parmesan, crack! Fries were good also, well for the 5 extra dollars I had to pay I atleast made them good. So food wise it was on point, the waitress was really nice also. I just can't get over those damn fries lol.  Oh yeah they got a lot of eye candy here! Everything from the waitress to the hostess.

g5xpcMUuToTnZjK2nYPUaA.text: My wife and I had dinner here while staying at Paris and really enjoyed it.  I had the lamb burger and my wife the veggie burger, both to die for.  The veggie had a portabello larger than the bun.  The sweet potato fries were very good.  We enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was very good.

UYXIqUW803e6pu6tMzcOxg.text: Terrible service.  First, I had ordered sweet potato fries with my burger and my friend had ordered waffle fries.  When delivered, the fries were reversed.  Second, I had ordered my burger without onions, and it came with onions.  Instead of replacing all the garnishes, they just removed the onions which had already permeated through to the garnishes, and so I could taste onions with every bite of the burger.  Third, the cheese on my friend's burger was cold.  He asked them to take it back and melt it, and they said that they couldn't do that.  Fourth, our other friend had ordered his burger with wholewheat bun but was given a honey oat bun and, when asked, was told that it was wholewheat.  Fifth, my first friend had to ask for his milkshake three times before he got it!  Burger was nothing special, sweet potato fries were undercooked (Carls Jr has better sweet potato fries).  I'll never go there again and hope that others read this review and go elsewhere for a burger.

hmgl_wLNxAbB9a1aGn7qog.text: They have really good frites/fries here. I think they give you a selection of three sizes which I liked. I also split the Kobe beef burger with a friend and it was tasty and filling. Service was very attentive and we went in the late afternoon so it was quiet and not as busy.

xnJhR9qtY1Lp7LDt-80x5Q.text: Burgers were very good. Lots of toppings, homemade buns. Decent beer selection. Bartender Daylan was great. Would recommend.

ASLESRUjJKY4N1Fb5GAUIA.text: My and wife and I are vegetarians, which makes for difficult eating on the Strip. Le Burger attracted us with the veg burger menu. We liked the selection process; bun type, toppings, etc. However, we were disappointed when the burgers arrived. They were remarkably greasy. The patties almost seemed deep-fried and the buns were oily. My wife ate 1/4 of her burger and I about 1/2 of mine. We rushed over to the gelato kiosk to rid our mouths of the greasy aftertaste. Beers were good and the staff friendly. Shame about the food quality.

XMCxkroZEx4iQWJ-M9a4Ww.text: We came here on Halloween, first time and due to seeing all of the TV's everywhere we really wanted to watch a football game. The hostess was kind enough, none of them are like super friendly or anything, but she did her job. The waitress on the other hand, cute outfit and all, was kind of out of it. She talked us into getting the bucket of beers, I thought the 2-4-1 deal was better, but too late.....Anyways, we ordered wings, hubby and I split a cobb salad and got the fries. Food was meh...The wings, while nice and meaty, HAD NO SAUCE.....We communicated this to our waitress, and instead of investigating this, she basically refused to do anything at all and told us, "just put tobasco, our sauce is basically ketchup anyways." So helpful, NO! We communicated our disappointment with a mediocre tip. Overall, we will go anywhere else but here next time we are hungry and wanting to watch a game.

9bAiuO6LCoQdSWv7n1ZGYA.text: We went here the day before Thanksgiving because my dad, given the choice of any type of food, would always choose a cheeseburger as his first dinner option.  When we arrived, it was pretty empty & we were seated in the bar area, which was fine because we got to take advantage of their 2-for-1 drinks during happy hour.  My burger was good (brie with caramelized onions), but I ordered it to be cooked medium & it was definitely well-done (not even the slightest hint of pink).  The burgers were all supposed to come with lettuce/tomatoes/pickles, but the chef forgot those items on all of our orders.  Service was a bit slow - we arrived at 5pm & didn't leave until 6:40 - barely enough time to make it to our 7pm show when I'd thought we would have had plenty of time to even do a little gambling beforehand.  My dad probably would give the restaurant 4 stars, because his burger was cooked properly.

YXj8QITNLjlXHyG0oM-qjw.text: my server angelique was great and absolutely beautiful... the food was really good too

Tf_1-OwEqTT2zxzPfdqk3w.text: they deliver a solid burger which can be washed down with a beer.  the service is prompt and attentive.  for a vegas sports bar it's pretty decent.  the crowd seems a lot less douchey than the balance of vegas which is actually saying something.  but then again i was there on a tuesday night.

aVBv2-adC_xIZDv_hnsCQg.text: Had a truly excellent cheeseburger here! Low priced compared to all the other sit down restaurants in Paris. The waitress' outfits looked really great on a couple of them, but silly on the rest. I wish I had tried this place earlier in my vacation because I would definitely have come back!

9Ss8qDW5EOQ5GELc-aZliQ.text: Terrible service from bartender and food came out raw!!! The bartender was too busy eating the cherries and olives to care about the customers at the bar. Service is very slow and food was just as bad. Don't waste your time. Many other places to spend your hard earned money then at that resturant.

gDq7s25UDBK0PrAQP7Jubg.text: I visited Le Burger Brasserie during my weekend in Vegas and have to say that I was not that impressed.  First and foremost I was offended by the lack of attention the waitress paid to us.  We waited for 15-20 minutes before she even approached the table.  We each ordered our own custom burgers (two beef, one veggie, and one lamb) and a fry sampler.  30 minutes later our food arrived as did the diet coke my friend had asked for 3 different times.  When I ordered my burger I asked that it be medium rare but when the burger arrived it was half medium rare and half well done.  Considering that I had eaten half the burger I just sucked it up and ate the rest.  I was afraid that if I said anything I would have to wait another 30-40 minutes before the food came out.  The waitress neglected to tell me that the kitchen was out of the roll I ordered until she brought me my burger (it would have been nice to choose a bun that went better with my topping choices). All in all the food was ok but the service was awful.  My suggestion is to find a better place to spend your money and your time.

DoupunPnvl9yDvPduqe1aw.text: I came here with a friend at about 1  on 11.13.13 and we both got the same thing. Exept for fries and burger toppings. It was a bit cold inside but it had a very romantic setting which was fine haha. Me: Kobe burger with american cheese and bacon,med rare; HOLY SHIT! This is for real the BEST burger I've EVER had in my life. The pickles on the side where even amazing haha. It was cooked perfectly.  Steak fries; They where good none of them where hard or rawish, but I do wish I got the thin fries but that's okay :).  Her Kobe burger with american cheese and mushrooms, rare; She ranted and raved about her burger as well so we both got a  very good burger. (she was nice enough to give me her pickles ) ^.^  Thin fries; She said they where super cripsy but in a very good way, she gave me a few and they where cooked nicely.   Over all this was an expensive mean about 50 dollars for both of us, but its so worth it. Its not like a every day thing.

-jyh_CnQhYlwQCCBwgcYdw.text: This is my go-to casual place for burgers and watching sports in vegas. Buffalo chicken dip... muah! Ok beer selection, not great, but I can come here w the kids and they don't complain.  Total rewards is honored here as well.

PO-qe9kZoQZO7qF91sBSmA.text: The peanut butter and chocolate shake is so heavenly! We ordered the shaft blue burger and BLT sandwich and all was delicious. Chelsea was our server and she was so attentive and did a great job!

wShhBYOsU9AaymCXBIhj_g.text: PSA: I don't eat red meat, so take this review for what you will.  I was recently in Sin City for work and we had our department dinner at Burger Brasserie. We were a large group, so I feel slightly bad for giving criticism, but the service was painfully slow. Some of my coworkers were on their second drink while others hadn't even gotten their first, many of the food orders took a long time (possibly misplaced?), and our server never asked if we wanted additional drinks.  Beyond the service, I found the food to be just blah. Once again, read someone else's review regarding their burgers, but as for their appetizer platter, french fries, shrimp Caesar salad, and tomato bisque soup, I was unimpressed. The appetizers were average (yet obviously cost double since it's Vegas) and my "tomato bisque soup" had to have been marinara sauce. My coworker even said it tasted like the same sauce she got with her fries. The only positive note for the food was that their shrimp was surprisingly delicious.  I don't often give negative reviews, but I just can't get on board with Burger Brasserie.

iDgQ_FtDAJXzm4pnc5yVcg.text: Nice, upgraded sports bar ambiance. Waitresses in corset tops and hot pants plus the plethora of screens plaint all the current games are easy pleasers for the men.   Get the fries - the poutine style ones were decent.  No gravy but distinct shreds of meat. Skip the wings - the meat smelled funny and they just didn't taste good.  My turkey campagne burger with the egg, white cheddar and bacon sounded delicious and should have been delicious but was oddly tasteless. My friend's salmon burger was salty.  The burgers and sandwiches  do not come with sides so a little pricey for what it is.   Probably would be ok for happy hour.

Za5SFeBCeQf8pedFV6HNGg.text: This place is located in the Paris and has good food, however, I do lot feel the quality reflects the price. $15 for a burger alone is a bit much when the burgers are not large or amazingly special. They do have a happy hour from 4-7 so I suggest coming during this time to save money on drinks. Beers alone are about $8. I had the blu cheese burger and it was very good. The waitresses are dressed very provocative but I can't say the price is necessarily worth it because I got stuck with a male waiter....I was not pleased. I would take a look around to see who's serving where and request a certain table or go to the bar. Service was good and I did not wait long for anything.

eTT98-I-kA1K5DOmptikTA.text: Food is ok -  Cali Chicken Cheeseburger Burger. Meat was savory. Eat at least once here during my annual convention, and each time have the same experience, empty tables in the place but yet, the folks have to wait outside. Our waiter was a bid nervous,this time, said the right things, and took off too fast. Didn't give me my Rewards credit, brought the wrong order. Ambiance in general is nice. Jason, the GM, is accommodating and very professional. He took a lot of time to clear up a misunderstanding. I'll eat there again next year.

UqkU2xX6c70bJsW-OhW_Ew.text: The service here was incredible. My boyfriend and I are in a budget but we had a coupon so we decided to go check it out. The hostesses could tell we were hesitant as we looked at the menu. There was no pressure to come inside, but they were so kind. They told us we could sit at the bar and decide if we wanted to order food. We ended up staying there and having the best wings and the Paris burger. The Nutella milkshake was INCREDIBLE! I think the bartender's name was Karli, she was so sweet to us. I loved the service here. A great experience if you want a nice meal with little to no wait at an affordable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zCWCBTrSyLFtdqByiU-bgQ.text: The restaurant is technically in the Paris casino, but you have to walk all the way to Bally's through their shops (so if you are entering Paris from Bally's, look for it on the right as you enter).  Went on New Years Eve.  Many restaurants were swamped, it was pretty empty.  Sat at the bar, only one other couple there.    Good selection of beers on draft.  Ordered a Lamb Burger, very good burger.  Didn't see the review for waffle fries, but the regular fries were very good.  Not sure the seasoning they use, but definitely has some unique flavor.    A couple of big screen TVs at the bar, so can go in and watch a game, but otherwise not really a sports pub...more of a casual dining experience.  Service was a bit slow, but otherwise I'd go back.

RBtz3A0ohtKFhI8KOYsyIQ.text: My most recent trip to Vegas - we went here 3 times. I am definitely a fan.  Twice we just stopped in for drinks and once we ate dinner here.   I had the French burger with brie. It was delicious. Very juicy. Was a bit sloppy trying to keep it all together, but overall, delicious. The waffle fries - eh - just average. Nothing great to speak of. We had great service with one of the bartenders and not so great with another... but luckily we had the good one twice. That worked out well.   Regarding drinks - the bloody mary mix is good. Not horseradishy.. which is great! Added a splash of tabasco, and it was perfect.  Here's the real kicker - the mimosas. You get a mini-bottle of champagne and orange juice. None of the poured from a large bottle stuff. The whole little bottle. Well worth the $9.   The location is very convenient in the walk through from Bally's to Paris.  Also, they have a huge projection screen tv if you want to catch the game at the bar.

iDu79GVGogzTp6PxOSmpPg.text: Never coming back because the hostess was absolutely rude and management did not handle my complaint appropriately and the wait time for food was unacceptable Food was decent.

zUsRlcme05mS-UYh7qKZhg.text: Came here on a recent trip. Ordered a bacon cheeseburger and the damn thing was huge!! So big I couldn't finish it. I have never said that before about a burger in my life. Ordered the spicy chicken wings and it was not only spicy but delicious. All the workers were so nice and were very helpful. Prices were a little high though. 3 burgers, 1 order of fries, and spicy hot wings for $87! Wow. Might come back if I hit a jackpot!!LOL!!

XeT4wDMuVDxlEgw1Q0gUKw.text: I don't have much to say about this place.  We went here late on a Friday and got average food, slow service, and about a hundred red hatted ladies walking by.  Apparently, there was a convention or something.  I mention this because it was far more entertaining than anything in this restaurant.  Meh.

pw5X4uf8rw7HLrQfc54blg.text: Had paris burger was done just right Brie cheese was done perfect, onions perfect. Great service. Quick and pleasant, drinks great $$$

6LUedZoPP6YZCV74SaTl_w.text: Went here for dinner a few days ago and really enjoyed how they start you off with a "sports question of the day" for a chance at receiving 10% off your bill. I thought it was a nice and unique way to engage interested customers.  Anyway, we had a decent time here but probably would not go back.  I wasn't too fond of the restaurant interior. We were seated at a booth that felt rather grimy and outdated. It is also fairly dark inside and the table setup is sort of crowded. I am not sure exactly - but something about being there was just off and I never felt comfortable during our meal. Aside from that, our waiter was a very nice guy, but overall service was clumsy and scattered.  For dinner we started off with the gravy fries, which were delicious by the way. We followed up with a french dip style sandwich and custom kobe burger. I think we were satisfied with our entrees, but I feel like I could easily find something better elsewhere with a lower price tag.

k25-pJPhct6H96XSjENpGA.text: I find the average rating of this upscale burger establishment both understandable and not understandable, all in the same breath. Minus my initial introduction from a hostess that just did not understand her role as the front person for the business, where the key is being understanding, diplomatic and patient. (Fail, Fail, Fail). My guess without reading all the reviews is a portion of the lower stars were from customers that faced a similar situation to mine, in dealing with her. (No names should be mentioned and won't) The truth is I hope she got canned for her horrible attitude and unprofessional approach to me and my party as it is the proper way to handle these types Once seated inside, peering at the well appointed dining area, grasping the classy menu (yes, even burger joints can have sophisticated menus from structure to content) I was totally at peace and ready to order. The service was excellent, never needing for an item that wasn't available nor offered. As we had a member of our group that was under the weather and spoke no English, I ordered for him a bowl of Chicken Noodle soup with extra French Bread and butter. The butter must have been hand churned as it was better than any I have had to date and the French bread was equally as outstanding, crispy, flaky, doughy served up piping hot. So few places do Mojotios and even less will prepare an wildcard fruit Mojito like strawberry, which our server Kristine assured us was no problem and it was delivered swiftly and the bar alchemist did a splendid job in its creation. If your not into such beverages, you can enjoy a cold Coors Light for the rock bottom price of $8.00. No not for a 12 ouncer but a 24! The Classic (Le Classique) medium rare, with a side of Bearnaise sauce, served on Parmesan bread was a real delight, quality ground beef cooked to perfection, but it paled in comparison to the Saveur Burger which just reached the pinnacle of burger predictability. The Petite cone of French Fries was far from petite as it was ample enough to provide a nice side order for a few patrons to share.  Unfortunately I can not recall the young mans name that was the MOD on the day we sat to eat at Le Burger Brasserie Sports Grille, but I want to take a moment to express my gratitude to him as a True food and beverage professional manager. When I first began this article, I mentioned a very unpleasant situation that was thrust upon me and my guests of not doing of our own, The young Asian gentleman (the MOD-Manager on Duty) listened to my explanation of the unpleasant reception we were greeted with. There was no wavering in his demeanor, he listened intently, sat us immediately and checked in with us after our meal had come to its completion. He saved our dining experience and this review to be sure.

2qlPqNVdNoY3hzGVXVXtPg.text: Never in a million years would I have thought a salad would come with so much bacon. Man was I wrong. The BLT salad was great and add the fact the dress in was a bacon fat vinaigrette. Oh my. Our waitress, Brittney, was rather attentive. I will return.

HwRNR4ULYmiCvvbgzyeT1Q.text: Food was awesome! Burgers are big so splitting is a good idea. Don't miss the onion rings. They have cheese doodle dust on them and the ranch has hot cheetos in it.

GLbYS2MDHMGTnXOHskWNhg.text: Come here every year for the Super Bowl . Make you reservation in advance . Management was appalling . Refused to let out party have our requested server , and four times previously requesting prior to arrival . Upon sitting with my family a large gentleman was sitting in front of me so no big deal I move to the other end of the table. When another obnoxious gentleman was purposely standing in front of me after noticing my shift on the table . I asked management to ask them to have a seat so I can enjoy the game . Not only did the party in front of us was clearly annoyed by asking they purposely made issues . Again I went to management . They told me there is nothing they can do . I am with a family of 15+ !!! We are here having a good time -trying to watch the game . Then they asked if I wanted to move to the bar ALONE  !!!!!  Yes NOT ACCOMMODATING let's move this young lady away from her party of 15 instead of ensuring my comfort and Saftey . Not only did we pay a good amount of money , management could care less about their guests . I have worked in the industry and I am always professional and do everything to accommodate guests . That's just common curtesy . This place was an absolute let down and safe to say not retiring next year or any to follow

HxfZKl_lsiv8vBQNyUyD_g.text: This place SUCKS. Came here on a tuesday evening, said we'd sit at the bar. Took our seats, there was still a bit of a mess in front of us. We waited probably ten minutes, a bar tender was just running around, no method to the madness, kept walking right by us saying nothing. Finally we flagged him down, no hello, welcome, "oh hey, what can I get you" uhhh well menus, what's good here, drink specials, talk to me, or are we at a drive thru right now?   Ordered a whiskey and a beer then looked at the menu, no checking in, had to flag him down to tell him our order "ok what do you want" not scornful, just completely indifferent and uninterested.   Combo burger and fries and cordon bleu, "what combo, we have many" I mean the guy had the personality of a bucket drywall mud but says yeah cordon bleu is popular.   We order and wait, and wait. Two girls sit next to us and order, a couple next to them sits down and orders, we wait.... BOTH of them get their food, nothing for us. I'm like YO, what's going on here?? "Uhhh with what? What do you want?" Our FOOD! "You didn't order yet" ohhhh but we did, remember you said the cordon bleu was popular??? "Oh yeah..., yeah uhhh it didn't go in, you didn't tell me, uhhh" Ok you know what, close us out. "Ok" actually brings the bill and charges me, had to find a manager, he barely cared, "ok I guess we can get your drinks, oh how much was it?" who CARES, you guys SUCK! "Ok yeah I guess we can do that"   ohhhhhh and I was OUT after that, what a JOKE!

dQ-aNbqCOhM8M5NNdeXC1A.text: Always a staple when I stay at Ballys.  Nice atmosphere sports on the TVs.  Ordered a kobi burger as usual and it dudnt disappoint.  Had the fries as a side too much food for me haha but always have had a ..we under meal and experience here. Ate at bar was late bartenders were great friendly and helpful food came very quickly and really enjoyed it. Glad it's still here not cheap eats but good eats to me is far more important . Highly recommended!!

ofQ_g6E9Ej4IOq49HGOX_g.text: I stayed in Ballys and walked by this place several times, always seeing it crowded. On my last day in Vegas, I decided to have lunch here. For starters, if you are a Total reward member present your card to your server. This will allow you to pay less for your meal. We ordered the pretzel appetizer! Delicious .. Is putting it mildly ! For my meal I ordered the salmon sandwich. Soft bun with fresh salmon slices. My other half ordered the Paris burger! This burger is very big and delivers with tasy bacon and garlic mayo aioli. This restaurant specializes in its condiments and fries come with spicy ketchup. This restaurant was amazing and we will be making this a regular stop while in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzels with mustard and cheese dipping sauces .. Ohh so good
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paris burger and salmon sandwich .. Delicious

enmSxRHnnh3FYpTwxvIKjA.text: This was a great place to watch some football and enjoy a great burger. I had the blue burger, and it was so good! I like lots of blue cheese so this was perfect for me. If you don't like heavy cheese, let them know. The patty was a healthy thickness, so make sure you go hungry or share it. Service was great, she kept the drinks flowing.  Great TV action on all sides and good people watching between Ballys and the Paris.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My blue burger...

nqZVCgpQtDhAx4h03p6LeQ.text: I'm a local, came to this place to meet up with friends in town, they only had 4 seats.. mind you tables on either side of them open. We go to the bar and pay for beers and sit with our friends at the table next to them, planned to eat as well. The waitress then comes to tell my boyfriend and myself that if someone comes in, she will need to take our seats... instead of saying, would you guys like a menu? Since we are already paying customers. Instead of harassing us that you may kick us out even though we paid for beers, you ask if we would like to spend more money, it's called CUSTOMER SERVICE. I will not be paying for anything else here. Good job on losing your tip from our friends table as well.  Terrible.

zPaC8K2qUC2q8l7U7WaTiQ.text: This place changed my life!! My husband was at a convention so I had to eat alone for the first time in my life and this place seemed like a pretty safe bet after walking around forever.   My waitress was absolutely AMAZING!! She was a little older than the other ones which was nice because she kinda could tell I was nervous being on my own so she helped me out.   I LOVE me some fries and I love putting gravy on my entire plate so when I saw there were gravy fries on the menu I got myself pretty damn excited!!   They were better than I could have imagined!! They made love to my mouth and it was probably best I was alone so I could have that experience to myself...  My sandwich was wonderful too.  After that I saw that gravy fries were a normal item on menus in Vegas so I continued to order them but no other places compared to these ones.   The reason for the 4 stars is that our group tried going back at night but they stopped serving food later at night and I that was a HUGE disappointment!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gravy fries
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZBXfFUXpOzR6rAKINtkD8g.text: Seriously a Top 5 burger ever with Shafts blue cheese, garlic aioli mayo, onion crusted bun! Get the waffle fries with spicy catsup.  No go on hard-to-perfect sweet potato fries.  Excellent vibe, fast meal prep and hilariously witty server Christina K.     The place is between Bally's and Paris so never crowded but outstanding.  Nice beer selection.

4adHqVLGe2WcoufHciDxYg.text: We ate here last night for dinner and I couldn't have been more disappointed. I had the Paris burger and added avocado. My sister had the Mac and cheese sandwich. The add ons to the burger were okay but the burger itself was so bland and tasteless. When I told the waiter Kevin he argued with me that that's the most popular burger and everyone loved it. My sister was too intimidated to tell him about her sandwich because of the way he treated me. We were then rushed out of the restaurant. Never again!!

m4LZZerspV6RUFg0BkI0Pg.text: In town for a few days...this has by far been the best meal!  Our server, Amanda, hit it out of the park when I hit her with the "suprise me" burger request!  She brought me the "Lamb Burger".  Hands down the best burger I've ever had.  I'm all about "whatever" and this did not disappoint.  If you are in town and want a "suprise me" meal, this is it.  Don't shy away from things you'd like to try...let the server help you out!  "Suprise me" never disappoints!  This palace especially!  LIVE IT!!!  THANK YOU AMANDA!

sl3qGmFS7JSYnV2-Niev0Q.text: For a burger sports bar experience before seeing Jersey Boys, this place was awesome. Kind of commercialized in Vegas standards, there was still a good amount of local flair there. Meaning it seemed like the after work spot for many, and the bartender was hilarious! Lots of namedropping about all of the sports stars he's met, then a couple of guys at the bar were casually sharing that they were working on Mariah's show.  But I digress...The beer was frosty cold and the food was delish!  We ordered a variety off the menu and everyone was happy. Pub grub perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citrus Skewer Special.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o8Q-D9Ussre21gbV_JARTA.text: Not a huge fan of Paris hotel but was pleasantly surprised by this joint. Was going to visit Holsteins but it was lunch time and the blazing heat was too much of a deterrent. Checked out Yelp and found this place.  Burgers were good but I screwed up by ordering them medium well. Was worried the patty was going to be too juicy causing the buns to be soggy but the patty was slightly too dry for my liking, I'm sure medium would have been perfect. All in all the taste was still good enough to warrant a 4 star.  If you're on the fence on which burger to try I would actually recommend the slider cos that's what my friend ordered and he got to try 3 different burgers.  There's quite a few burger places, will try others the next time and see if I'll miss this place enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese dip with chicken
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yJjKJiuW6oozIgcXC37yCw.text: $50 for 2 ok burgers, 1 fry and 1 soda seems a bit ridiculous....even for vegas.  however, meals are expensive so, i get it.  but, combine that with very poor service and i would not recommend this place.

rpE7X2jgoznG4HpHuTqTcw.text: Worst hostess ever! After making our way over to the restaurant at 9:49pm, on a Thursday night, we were told that the kitchen was closed--and she starts rambling about the hours for the weekend!!! I don't want the hours for Friday or Saturday! I want to eat now! The place seemed busy and I saw people walk in and get seated BEFORE us as we approach the hostess stand.  I was shocked because I had researched my food options nearby. They were scheduled to close at 12am--or so I thought.   My man was just as blown as I was when the hostess then said, "kitchen closes at 945". I told her that I had googled the place and it shows they're open til 12midnight. She just stared at me!   Our agenda that evening was to do the Eiffel Tower Experience then eat!  We are from out of town. My stomach is grumbling. I'm hungry. I'm pissed. I'm more hungry than pissed, so I just walk away. Off to give my coins to a place that is open.  Maybe we should have eaten first then gone up in the Eiffel Tower *shrug*

kHStIxbv6_zkQcz2_BbvFQ.text: This place is not a good food joint. The only thing this place has going for itself is the buy one get one drinks during happy hour.   I will say the gravy fries were delicious, but my chicken tenders were really gross, my friend ordered wings and they were flavorless.   The burger my other friend had said it was mediocre, the sweet potato fries were greasy and mushy. my husband and his friend had the short rib sandwich that was just meh.   Honestly you might as well get a sandwich from the grab and go at least they have a date on their product so you know if it's going to be utter crap or not.

sWEBpcaxaNsXmR5WPdPHuA.text: Wanted to check out this burger place inside Paris. The place itself is pretty cool..TVs everywhere and a nice, upscale sports bar type spot. We went for dinner and it was pretty busy but we were seated within 15 min, not long at all. They were short staffed that night but the servers and manager were up front about it and let us know, more so we didn't feel forgotten or ignored.  Nice move! Though they were short our service was still very timely and adequate. Brittney & Alex were great!  Some must trys: Macaroni & cheeseburger bites Oreo Shake (really delicious) Turkery burger with egg Chicken wings Gravy fries (amazing)  Definitely a cool, must try spot

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smores cheesecake dessert
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Burger with fried egg

veARyncLQTyf9_GBmYe7zA.text: Ate here after checking in at Bally's, 10/25/2017.  I'm one of those who generally doesn't complain to the server or a manger if something is not really all that good. I figure if they knew how to do a better job, they would. Having worked in restaurants for 40 years, I know for a fact, they don't take customers' critiques seriously.    This place was so-so at best. Prices were about par for the course for a Vegas casual eatery.   I had the lamb burger. It was more than well-done, which meant it was drier than Red Rock Canyon in August. Neither ketchup nor mustard helped. The onion rings I ordered looked impressive, with huge slices stacked on a spindle. The let-down came when tasting them: extremely soggy(!!) batter and VERY mushy onions. I had 2 of them. Total waste of money.  Waitress was OK...nice enough, but not super attentive.   I definitely don't recommend  this place and would not choose to return.

JMHqntYOVLDvL16n2cqGOQ.text: Got the Paris Burger, was pretty good but quite difficult to eat which is completely understandable considering how big the burger is and if you get lettuce and tomatoes on it, everything becomes slippery, but still delicious. The fries were amazing too. We went around 2pm so not many people inside the restaurant but the service was nice and got the food fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7X42XSRiW2UNVhs-hEIX5g.text: Two years later, and the Burger Brasserie hasn't changed much, other than the burger that was overpriced at $15 is now overpriced at $17.  This is a sports bar that servers uppity burgers. If you're really drunk and rich you can order a $777 burger that comes with a bottle of Dom. The servers all wear low cut outfits. The burgers and fries have snooty ingredients to try to justify the price tag.  The upside is after you drop $65 on dinner for 2 you can earn some Total Rewards points. But there are better meals in Vegas for the price.

Yl1-zN2yGMuLVfkOkSkN4g.text: Great food and service.  The Grilled Chicken Salad is fantastic!  Don't know what they did to the onion rings, but they are now mushy and not nearly as good as they used to be.  The crunch is gone.  For incredible onion rings, try Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany Hotel or The Peppermill on the north end of the Strip.

lntBafy7snrdsEZHjO-UdQ.text: Not a huge fan of the Paris Hotel but as we were cutting through after getting off the tram we realized we hadn't had dinner and it was getting late. Stumbled upon Burger Brasserie and grabbed a table. Service was good and quick.   I ordered the Le Paris burger and it was so good it made me angry! A perfect med-rare as any beef should be prepared. Topped with brie, caramelized onions, smoked bacon on an onion bun. Accompanied by sweet potato fries. So good!   Dang it - makes me want to go back just writing this review. Honestly, the burger was just excellent!

Pdk3n4vwEHLcAsO8ZRp1Eg.text: Easy to get to between Paris and Bally. Limited menu good sliders. Fair service with on tap beer.

s3qeXhvJkPR74qZGC5e2Zg.text: We used a Groupon to dine here. I had been here previously with my mother so knew what I was getting into. The burger was seriously the best any of our group of 4 had ever had! Between the four of us we split one order of onion rings and one order of waffle fries, so know that splitting sides is more than sufficient. Definitely a find for a reasonable place to dine and have a beer while on the strip! I will say the service was beyond slow, I think we waited 45 min for our food due to a "bread" issue per our server, but all that was forgotten once our bellies were filled with our delicious burgers!

t-eXbgS8E8RCRZbxvzpXtw.text: Ate here 2 times on my recent trip to LV.  Chicken sandwich on a yummy bun and french fries....YUM! Service was good, colleague got the onion rings (YUMMY).  Went back another night to order food to go- Swiss cheeseburger on an onion roll (wow it was good) French fries (crispy and delicous).  While I was waiting I had a most delicious drink "French Riviera". It was yummy! So I had another. Very nice!

ApIs66fjo-isgt76OfgWcw.text: I love girls in short shorts =)   Maybe I should try their burgers since it seems to be their specialty. It's just that every time I come here, I'm super tired and lazy to think about eating a burger. I just wanted some finger foods. So call me the appetizer king then since I've probably tried all of them and never been disappointed.   Next time Le Burger Braseerie, I'll try your burger. Especially that Kobe one I was eyeing but just couldn't get myself to order.

qJ5tIJmp2hhrcFV5wxzPIA.text: I have eaten here twice and had very different experiences. The first time I came it was happy hour and this place was bumping. The music was blaring and it was really hard to talk to my friend at the table. The second time I came it was for lunch. The restaurant was quiet and wonderful.   The burgers are good. They are fresh and they give ample portions.  My complaints would be as follows: The burgers are served on tissue paper and a mesh wire basket. For a $10 hamburger served without fries this is pretty ridiculous. Would a plate be too much.  Secondly fries anyone?? $10 and no side? That just can't fly.   For a place with such a great location you would think they wouldn't try and rake you across the knuckles.  Otherwise the selection is great and this is a great oasis to blow some winnings (hopefully).

VhFQRWNFV25ePWiHhT7uWw.text: Other than The Back Abbey in my hometown Claremont, CA., this place had the best gourmet burgers I have enjoyed in quit a while.  It was so good we went back twice.    Le Burger Brasserie has a French theme offers signature gourmet burgers prepared with chicken, salmon, lobster, lamb, vegetable and and beef.  I recommend the Le Paris and the Le Bleu burgers both 100% Black Angus beef.  The Le Paris had Brie cheese, caramelized onions and smoked bacon.  The Le Bleu has Bleu cheese, avocado and smoked bacon.

-ZIHzbgUqz10SGm5CwF9Og.text: Meh. 3 stars because the food at least tasted good. The cost vs what you get for blt sliders is a joke but no different than many places on the strip. My husband enjoyed his burger but the service was terrible. Our server duplicated another table's order so we ended up waiting twice as long. Then he rarely refilled our drinks. To top it off, he split our check wrong so my husband can't get comped for business.

RrAOI6jWcVdZHYaJlzYzsg.text: We were staying at the Paris for a friend's bday weekend.  We walked around the hotel to find somewhere for a quick bite before we got ready for our night out on the town.  We decided on this spot and only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated.  The server was very nice and the burgers were delicious!  All 4 of us really enjoyed our food!  I will definitely return again next time I am in Vegas.

9xVqzdAEbqLhX5Dd5D47QA.text: Great cozy atmosphere perfect for a mid-day lunch. We tried the Lamb burger- huge portion with fries. Decent tasting, wasn't too memorable for me. The Crispy Chicken salad was definitely very good. i'll give it 4 stars. Perfect time as I was craving for fresh crispy vegetables and some good protein.   Also, my bf was glued to all the 10 or more plasma screens showing basketball/football and probably heard half the conversation.  haha not a perfect place for a romantic eatery.

WHFGlfyC8WX963DzH7qJjg.text: This is easily the weirdest place I have ever eaten. It's got the name of an upscale restaurant, with the serving staff that you'd probably expect to find at Planet Hollywood (casino), or maybe a strip club. This isn't to insult the fine ladies, they were very attractive and I do not mean that insultingly. It was just weird.  Weirder still was the interior straight out of a NYC dive bar, with bar staff that were doing crazy tricks a la TGI Fridays, but with the the conversation (IE: good) of a good, well-hidden bar in the aforementioned large apple.   More confusing still was the quality of the burgers, which were, frankly, shockingly good. I wanted more when I was done. Fresh avocado, nicely cooked medium burgers, and great blue cheese. In fact, the whole meal was delicious.  However, this was covered by the malaise of everybody pretending to be excited at the USA playing Brazil in an irrelevant soccer tournament, and the faint sound of bees buzzing that is the sound of a crowd. And, yes, this was really annoying when you're trying to enjoy a meal.   I just don't know what to make of this place, but I'd certainly go back and eat there. It was just a bit dissonant. I don't know, don't look at me. What am I, a bar scientist?

XrToVBOfpJuXmp3GfLtE6Q.text: I really hate to give this place such a terrible rating because the food itself was delicious.  However, the service was absolutely atrocious.  My husband and I waited fifteen minutes to be seated while two other tables who came up after we arrived were seated immediately.  It then took an additional ten minutes to be addressed by the waiter.  Dinner took 30 minutes to arrive and part of my husband's order was missing.  The check took another extended period of time.  All in all we spent well over an hour and a half waiting and very little actually enjoying our meal.  Very disappointed.

JYdlWY2MT4OSpX2YEvxxDA.text: Considering the hype about this place, I will admit that I went into this meal with high expectations.  There are lots of menu options and you can customize your burger experience.  It just didn't live up to all the hype.  Without the hype, this place gets 4 stars, but if you go in hoping for a better-than-average burger you won't be disappointed.

k_BwSwG9ouz_bJ7GgV5Esg.text: We went here after purchasing a Restaurant.com voucher. We were told they recently changed the menu. The menu was not very large and the choices were obscure. If you're adventurous, you may like it. If you just want a burger, not the place for you. There were two of us and we each got a burger. We ordered a side of fries (because nothing comes with the burger), had the buffalo dip as an appetizer, and each got a drink (one margarita and one shake). Our bill was over $80 (each burger was about $15). Wasn't that bad since we had the restaurant.com voucher but wouldn't go again.

PwF8oXaEZxOwgDSw1VSbjw.text: I've been here a few times and I can say that the burgers are pretty tasty.  I really like the buns they use because they have a sweetness to them that compliments the burger really well.  The fries were also really good and have some type of seasoning on them.  I haven't been here recently but I have always enjoyed the food here though it is on the pricier side for burgers.  On the plus side, the women who work there are for the most part, hotter than your average server.  I guess it's a good marketing strategy to sell burgers to their target audience - males, ages 18-34, hahaha.

PLhPs-HotI9faAWFeKtAOg.text: Really nothing to jump up and down about here.  It is typically expensive for a restaurant that is in a major hotel on the strip.  Since it is fairly casual it is very crowded during the dinner rush, and not crowded with the kinds of people that are fun for people watching.  And with the service being pretty slow, you get a lot of time for people watching.  The food was average.  I really didn't see much difference between a burger here and a burger at a TGI Fridays.  Really, the only thing that kept me sane in this restaurant was the large numbers of TVs showing baseball.

zzKLepk7pcpXCxlzOEo5kQ.text: I admit I was a little skeptical in paying that much for a burger, but I came out happy.  The one thing that caught my attention was that I choose foie gras as one of my toppings I could put in my burger.  Very yummy.  I also added some prosciutto to.  Besides the burger, we ordered the 3 french fries sampler, which was shoestring, steak, and waffle fries.  All three had a ranch seasoning to it.  My favorite was the steak fries!  But yeah, food came out great.  And man was our waitress in shape and very friendly.  Definitely coming back!

av31aTZZ_JMQDFHK-rOPVA.text: I had the lamb burger with feta and guacamole.  It also came with olives, but I am not a fan of olives, so out they went.  The waffle fries were also quite good, not greasy but a nice crunch to them.  We popped in for lunch, so it wasn't too busy but it looked like they had a great bar and would be a good place to hang out, catch a game and enjoy a burger and a beer or three.

APlfUlpooEHGuexX6tiQ2g.text: Basically a burger joint with a Hooters-like atmosphere in Paris Hotel / Casino.. The gals wear scantily clad outfits (hot pants and tight bustier tops) serving burgers and fries with plenty of add-ons. My fave was plain burger cooked medium with a fried egg, cheddar, and carmelized onions with thin-cut fries. Not too shabby with great beer. Oh, did i mention they have a 120oz beer? Overall they had 4 stars for burger, but the service was slow.

mv5Q2RbO8fqUDRknY9YzeA.text: Our burgers were good. I was really pleased with the flavor. We also order the onion tower. It took a while for our feed even though it was fairly empty. The tower was a little cold. If you are staying at bally's they give you a coupon book and one of the coupons is to get 5 dollars off.

Yi8SbnW2x2GS8cy_dfdy1Q.text: I've only had one item from here, but it was by far the best burger I have ever tasted.  Though it cost a merely $77, it was well worth it and I can't wait to go back!  Kobe beef, brie (brie makes everything better), prosciutto, and aged balsamic made up this out of this world burger.  Oh, and they top it with a lobster tail!  You have to try this burger, especially after you hit the jack pot.

pvByV7J7kofbd0lki6Jf7w.text: Milkshake was AWESOME!  I got the Espresso Milkshake and it came in a big glass with a mountain of whip cream.  Enough for more than 2 people to share.    I also had the Le Italian burger (arugala, mozzerella, and pancetta) and waffle fries which were good...but the milkshake was the best thing there.    Service was a little slow...or maybe we were just anxious to gamble.  Prices are "reasonable" Vegas prices, just win your money back after the lunch.  Good place to stop for a casual (non-buffet) meal in Vegas.

UTq_x-GwHhjjhnIaqbo4cQ.text: We had an awesome lunch here while recently visiting Vegas. This restaurant is located right where Paris and Bally's connect. I was a little annoyed that we had a 10 minute wait when the place was nearly empty (it was past prime lunch hours), but the service and food were very quick, which made up for it.   Our burgers were cooked perfectly medium on soft, homemade buttery buns, and I topped mine with caramelized onions & provolone cheese. Amazing! We split a basket of shoestring fries and waffle fries. The shoestring were better because the waffle fries weren't crispy enough. I'm totally regretting not trying the onion rings, which looked really good. I also saw a table next to us order huge salads, which looked delicious.   The burgers do not come with fries, but you can order a combo or baskets to split. You save about $1 on each item with your player's card. There are plenty of TVs around the restaurant for sports lovers.

TshXK0XjiB6rKKc24BhZ-Q.text: I would say that the median rating for this restaurant of 3.5 at the time of this posting is spot on.  The restaurant is located in the Paris Hotel on the walkway towards Bally's.  The cuisine is good and tasty.  The restaurant has a great variety of hamburgers with Kobe and lamb also on the menu and a variety of toppings.  If you enjoy a gourmet style burger, this place is the place for you.    The service is mediocre at best.  I wanted patiently for about 15 minutes for a table for two.  Although I hate waiting, it is a part of life and you live with it.  Once we were at the table it took another fifteen or twenty minutes to order.  Minutes later we got our beverages.  The food took another half an hour to receive.    I understand that good food takes time.  Note: a hamburger in a restaurant does not need that much time unless the establishment runs out of food.  Ridiculous.  The waitress was not attentive.  We did have a coupon for $5 or $10 which softens the blow.  I would recommend the food if you have patience and time to kill.  If not, there are plenty of other restaurants available nearby.

ebBBEh6kmsYEbStsIxn1qA.text: We had a party of 7 and were told we needed to have at least 5 people there to be seated. Once our party arrived we were told we would be seated in a couple of minutes. After about 25 minutes we checked in with hostess and she told us we would be seated next, even the manager came over and told us we were next. As a large table opened up we assumed it was ours. We were then told a diamond club member came in and would be taking the next table. After an hour and a half we decided to eat elsewhere. When we spoke to the manager that we were unhappy he said "ok" and just walked away.

i_Ni0E-kaAfG2MT2Afm_7A.text: The mint milkshake had no alcohol in it and they wouldn't honor the $7 total rewards price on their menu.
