They all seem to know that $8 is the price and admitted the menu is wrong.  I would have given the extra dollar as a tip.  But I did not detect ANY alcohol in the drink.  Two strikes and your out in my book.  I'll go get a great alcoholic drink over at Serendipity next time.

ezUv8gwiTz0HwL2HPf1-iA.text: Either attempt to achieve your potential or drastically lower you prices.  My "Kobe" patty was the exact same to my friends non-Kobe next to me and my rare was a medium rare at best closer to medium really. There was a substantial gas odor to the taste of the burger.  The cheese had not been melted on the burger and was still solid.  The bacon looked like pre-made stuff you buy at Costco or McDonalds.  I understand the surcharge price gouge for "Vegas" but even with that I was handed a 10 buck burger not a 22 buck burger.  I ate the rest of the patty only just out of fear that if it was Kobe such that such a meticulously breed beef was not wasted due to the preparation, otherwise I wouldn't have as a third bite.

WjbjqDLo4I3vkVMiWCvxuA.text: Very overpriced and not that great of food. The service was awful. The waitress acted like we were a burden for her to actually have to work. The manager just stood around talking about how he sports bets and how much he wins. I don't think I'll eat here again.

H_49GML-RCzvPEdFTZ3YGA.text: Good burgers, fries and onion rings. I opted for the sliders which I always enjoy, the bread was especially good this time (brown and buttered). Ambience is a little dark and getting a little run down. Service is fast and friendly.

k3F5UCfHNAEWmQ-TxP4mwQ.text: Very pricey (though not so much by Vegas standards), but very good chicken burger.  Good service (from Nicolette), and nice atmosphere.  The fries are 'deep-fried', crispy and spicy, which I don't like -- but that's just personal preference.    If I was in the area again and couldn't think of a better option, it would be a fine backup place.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Burger with Provolone

zJMMZhHIZm81luQ-tgNeaQ.text: If you're looking for a relatively inexpensive place to eat on The Strip with great food [and don't mind sports] then this is the place to have a bite.  My husband and I ate here on Labor Day for dinner and it wasn't very busy.  I actually expected it to have some sort of dress code since it looked like a decent place but they asked if we wanted to sit so we sat! (we were wearing gym shoes).  Also, to my surprise, the waitresses were wearing bustiers which didn't bother me--'tis Vegas after all!   I had a mustard/ketchup incident when I was younger so I always check my seat before I sit down.  There were some crumbs that stuck to my thighs D: but I find that restaurants usually don't clean the seats that often. As usual, we had no idea what to get to drink so we ordered water when are chipper waitress introduced herself.  When she came back with our waters, we put in our drinks--I got the strawberry mint lemonade (very very very delicious) and my husband got a miller since the coors tap was out.  We also put in the pretzels at the same. Pretzels came (they were alright--just pretzels!), and we decided to share the Italian burger (has motz cheese, arugula, and pancetta).  Since I mentioned that we were sharing the burger, they cut it for us and served on a separate plate.  Saved me sooo much time cutting it myself ;) We also ordered a double of fries which was waaaay too many fries. They were so crunchy that I had left over bits in my shirt :D Probably what I sat in earlier!  Our waitress did forget our drinks but they still tasted pretty darn good when we reminded her.  All in all, a good experience, good service, and great food. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a different Vegas environment.

Eou5yBPbv2vPtt_LZtUikA.text: I had the Paris Kobe Burger! It was mouth watering. You can choose what kind of meat you'd like in you burger, definitely get the Kobe! Although, my friend said the lamb was also delicious but I had to get the Kobe. It was a quick burger and dirty martini. Great place to stop before heading to the casino! Definitely somewhere I'll go to next year

MkvnogyOOYn3HXhJY5JoIw.text: Yay Amanda! She was such a good waitress. There were six of us and we all had a good time here. Amanda took care of us and was on top of everything from the start. We all enjoyed our food and actually spoke about it the next day, on how good it actually was. The sucky thing about this place is the fact that your burgers do not come with fries. You have to buy them separate and share with your group. But it was not too bad....we made the best of it.   Just a pleasant experience. Would come here again for sure.

WV7nPINQJAzaAYKKaA3yBA.text: Not sure I'll be seeking out Le Burger Brasserie on my next trip to Vegas.  I always seek out Le Burger every time I'm in Vegas.  So far I've eaten there six times since 2011.  This visit I knew something was wrong, the place was not packed as when I ate here in Feb 2014.  Was greeted, seated right away and helped by a nice waitress named Victoria.  She took my order and after 10 minutes out food came out hot and yummy.  I had the build your own burger it was fairly good, however the bun was dry and beef patty smaller than in past visits.  To go with my burger I ordered onion rings for $7.00 only got 6 rings?  Wow.  Before we would get 10 to12 rings stacked high.  My bill came and the waitress forgot to deduct my TR (total rewards discount), I wasn't going to fuss with $2.00, however she asked for my rewards card when I sat down and took it. Oh well,  too many changes to the menu, food quality, and overall experience....I'll never go back!  Try Burgr or Bobby's Burger Palace....

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build your own burger $16/$15 (Total Rewards - discounts food $1 less)  Note: Weekend menu prices are higher!
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion ring &#34;tower?&#34; See previous pictures and compare for yourself.... $8/$7 (Total Rewards - discounts food $1 less)

YUbzskVr_0K5c5MkxBEWGg.text: Pleasantly surprised.  Not a burger fan, so have never went here.  Bought a groupon since we were staying at Paris.    Used the groupon for some apps for a light dinner/snack.  We loved, loved, loved the buffalo chicken dip served with a hot pretzel basket.  I make this at home minus the pretzels.  For those who want it hotter a few shakes of tabasco kicked it up, but it had lots bleu cheese in it.  yum!   Also ordered chicken wings (yes, we love chicken, not burgers) and they were served with a nice side of veggies...drizzled in oil and parsleys maybe.  Raw carrot, celery and zucchini (for a little something extra).  Also ordered the mac n cheese hamburger bites.  Again, good.  I would pass, but the others loved them.    The only thing we didn't care for were the onion rings.  They were doughy and bland.  Extremely so.    We also had a pink sauce and an orange sauce for dipping, both excellent.  They were not stingy on the dippies, the portions of veggies or the portions of pretzels.  Often you run out of delivery vehicles and accompaniments.  Not so.    Waitress was great.  Manager checked on table.  A little pricey and burgers were a la carte, so it made a meal twenty bucks each for burgers....but since we decided to use our groupon for a snack meal it worked out great for staying on strip and needing a small bite.  Oh, this food was for four women and we couldn't finish it.  Portions were generous.

BnlamzVzLLE4TgYojp0Uhg.text: Complementary meals. I love the Lamb Burger Saveur. The mushrooms were flavorful. It was delicious. Our server Nicolette was such a sweetheart. Definitely a place to just come eat. We came during happy hour which is a BOGO deal, we were just so messed up from drinking early in the morning that we didn't participate in this BOGO deal. Lol..

vDFyiTeS06Pv-xgEAepBkw.text: This is my favorite burger place in Vegas.  My favorite burger is the lamb burger.  Its so delicious with the melting feta cheese.  All their burgers are great,  everyone I bring here is very impressed.  Try to catch a groupon special.  Their signature drinks are also very good.  Consider this Paris's prime sports bar.

KA3t94_rDeo448m6vFvlnA.text: We both had a burger, mine being Blu Cheese and it was excellent. We shared sweet potato and regular fries.they were also very good. Service was very good. We hit happy hour and had the Cadillac Margarita, Sarah thought it was a little strong, I thought it was good. Good choice and we would come back

AM0YcNRoy2mdUtQapdkP4Q.text: My husband and I went to have dinner here last night. We asked for a booth first and we got seated at a table. Then we waited for it and when we got seated we realized that the AC is right above the booth blowing freezing cold air so we ended up moving back to a table. That is a great start already. We got 2 long drinks and I wanted it easy on ice and it was still full with it just like my water. I dont think the server listened at all. Details does matter to people. I liked my blue cheese burger but my husbands kobe burger was supposed to be medium and it was barely cooked. It was red as a lobster in the middle.Very disappointing. He was not happy with this $22 burger. Luckily we had a groupon for $40  but let me tell you that this dinner was $75. Rundown 2 coctails 2 burgers with 1 side. Bottom line still Not worth it.

ySHcsMjjxt3K5szcmomNyQ.text: The burgers were pretty good, but the service was lousy. 15 minute wait despite being half empty.  Took about 30 minutes to actually get our food.  Too expensive for bad service like that.

h_5yIJKHW4nKZsD7SjkLZw.text: Wonderful experience at this Parisian sports bar inside the Paris casino. The burgers were fun and creative and still remained excellent eating. I had the cheeseburger , yes that's its name nothing fancy just A Cheeseburger. It was made with velvetta that gave it an interesting flavor and a pickle that reminded me of grandmother's homemade bread and butter pickles. Condiments are provided on the table such as ketchup and spicy brown mustard but trust me they need nothing else. Mine came a perfect medium on a toasted fresh made bun. She had a Cheeseburger but changed her cheese to a smoked cheddar. I sampled hers and found it delicious as well. Again condiments would have just brought this dish down. On this visit we went with french fries that came with a very interesting in house made condiment that was akin to a wasabi ketchup. The staff was attentive without being overly friendly. Drinks stayed filled and checked on us frequently without being annoying. We found this wonderful place by a groupon offer which left us paying half price. Our first visit was so good we returned 2 days later. This time I had the chicken sandwich and she added bacon to a cheeseburger and switched to velvetta. Our side item choice this time was onion rings which are great but made even better because they are made with Cheeto powder in the batter! Absolutely delighted with this fun choice. Our server Amanda was a bit more friendly on this visit and the service was even better. I only give it 4 because without the groupon offer it would have been a bit pricey for burgers and fries, but we enjoyed it so much I will return each time we come to Vegas even if I have to pay full price. They had very tasty sounding milkshakes that all contained alcohol sadly we were too stuffed to try them but rest assured they will be top of our list on the next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thats right there are funyons on my chicken sandwich!

XOTWRmI8-fJrJJFwH3TJbQ.text: We had our wedding reception/dinner here and it was great! Yes a game was going on but that didn't bother us and several people wanted to watch it. The food was good. We had a 2 tiered cheesecake and it was beautiful...and tasted great too!

c2rQU7EbTu-4laC-lsBBcg.text: Carnivore's delight!  I decided to check out Le Burger since I've been to the one in Mandalay Bay. And it was just as good.   I'm not one to ruin a perfectly prepared burger. So I got a very simple burger with American cheese, mushrooms and onions.  MEDIUM RARE of course! And it was cooked perfect.  The only thing I didn't care for was the lack of toppings or the option to "build your own burger". Other than that, it was delish.  Service here is where they can really improve on. It took quite awhile for the bartender to acknowledge me, longer to get a beer, and even longer to ask if I was going to eat or not! And there was only one othe person at the bar eating at the time. And the dining room was fairly empty.  I'll be back.

_omqmYyJ1KErIgpyUftgvg.text: I went back again and this place it's still great. The best hamburgers in Las Vegas for a reasonable price

DZvIFys_n1nrMd-hvflmpw.text: The food was very good- although we had just arrived after being in the car for 9 hours so anything better than gas station chips and soda would have been wonderful.  Throughout the restaurant there are many HUGE flatscreens and projection TVs that are great for watching sports- although they didn't have an NHL channel and we couldn't watch the game.  Two of my friends ordered a huge beer tower which was great fun for all.

Hgn-eZNKgoi0ING1U7DrnQ.text: Its good. The burgers are large and gourmet inspired (not accusing them of being gourmet, just inspired). Its a little pricey, but after 9 its bogo drinks. They give you four choices of fries, fat, skinny, waffle and sweet. The buns are rich. Its a little walk from everything but the Ballys gaming floor (not a complaint, just wear good walkin shoes(or boots that are made for walkin)). Any burger you can get in le poulet, le boeuf,  Le saumon, les legumes. Try it if you cant think of anything else to do on a date. At least you can go for a stroll in the fake streets of Paris.

H3nTVcRN0qOEYk3uY9l2Jg.text: She got wings she got a halo It seems to me so unnatural Cos that's one thing that I just don't know What seems to be so incredible...at Le Burger Brasserie! - Akon (angel)  Located close to the connector between the entrance of bally's and paris shops, is this cool sports bar. It looks upscale but the prices are very reasonable (especially for vegas) and not to mention there's a ton of tv's with a good view from almost every seat in the restaurant. I ordered the classic burger w/ sauteed mushrooms on a toasted sesame bun (they let you choose your bun and toppings) and while the burger was cooked well, the mushrooms were overly salted. It was also somewhat messy to eat, probably should've used a knife/fork now that i think about it lol. The waffle fries (which you have to order separately) were really tasty though so thumbs up for that. I did however enjoy the exciting football game that was on (although disappointed that the seahawks won). One other thing that i would like to mention is that although the menu has alot of french names for their food, it doesn't seem like this restaurant is french inspired at all...more like an american sports bar with a french theme.  Food: 3.5 stars --- Service: 4 stars --- Atmosphere: 5 stars --- Price(value): 4 stars

_9jjaoer24fND5tS1WnD3A.text: My first time here was pretty awesome.  The awesomeness may have been enhanced from the many vodka drinks consumed prior to my arrival, but hey, either way we had a great time!  They have happy hour twice a day (4-7 and reverse).  We didn't make it there for happy hour, but I'm still a fan!  Located in the walkway between Paris and Bally's, just outside the Bally's Casino floor.  Cute girls standing outside, good energy and bar atmosphere inside. Our server was nice, nothing too memorable, but like I said we had enjoyed a few cocktails, and I don't remember pissing her off, so she was great!  We ordered a bucket of 5 beers for $20 and the Paris Burger with waffle fries (frites) to split. The burger was scrumptious with Brie and bacon and the waffle fries had great seasoning!  We were pretty full after that, but there was so much more we wanted to try.  The petit frites and the grande frites, sliders, veggie burger, lamb burger, the 777 burger (if someone else is buying), or maybe even the 100 oz beer tower!    Who knows what we'll try when we go back; but one thing is for sure, we WILL go back!

B-4_YnCmDe5f3BVnpUOE1w.text: Decent food. Average prices for the drinks. Some are a little ridiculous so be warned ($9 for a kamikaze shot, $11 for vodka redbull).   The girls working are all gorgeous, but in turn that also attracts a lot of creepy uncle type guys who sit around the bar being the most awkward possible.   All in all, average places to eat. Paris and Ballys are not my favorite spots for food and drink.

_6nZLd12xGjXxj2VX1Krow.text: So happy hour stuck us at the bar and we were hungrier than two retired seniors ready for their social security check.  I could not judge this place well, I was hungry.  I did not like the attitude of the hostess, they just looked apathetic. I recieve better service from cranky Bruno at the local bar.   Next it took longer than it should to get a drink order and a meal order.  We got our food and vacuumed it all down.  It felt on par with a screwy Fuddruckers (not as good as a normal Fudds).  So what is the theme? I did not feel that there was anything special, other than the two lazy ass chicks in the front. Go somewhere else. If you need a burger and a pretty girl, by a calendar and check out Miccy Dees.

Z4O-dxvznKfIrob17HIzdg.text: I had this on my list of places to try in Vegas because of Man V. Food.  I saw the $777 burger and wanted to try it (without the champagne, which makes it $77).  This has ruined me for other burgers!  It's a kobe beef burger, topped with 100 year old balsamic vinegar, imported brie, imported proscuitto, carmelized onions and a lobster tail.  First of all, this burger is very big.  Two of us shared it and were stuffed.  So when you look at it relative to the price, it's the same as having 2 entrees at a normal restaurant.  Secondly, it was the best burger I have ever had.  The beef was so tender and delicious, it melted in your mouth.  Add in the toppings (including the perfectly cooked lobster tail), and it was heaven!!!!  We actually considered going back for a second one later in the trip just because we knew we could not get one back home.    As far as the other items on the menu, we tried an appetizer combo, which was very good (loved the wings).  We also tried an order of skinny fried, which were OK (I'm not a huge fry person).

X6A_PfHjyDA2FkAa5yhlRQ.text: Overall, meh. Went out to grab what I was hoping would be an excellent burger to kick off a three-day convention slog in Vegas. The Paris burger with caramelized onion and Brie was well-prepared - but I can do better with ingredients from Safeway, and the raved-about waffle fries from other reviews were very obviously straight out of a frozen bag. Pickle was quite good, though. Living in San Francisco has spoiled me. Beers on tap were mostly your standard domestic fare; Bud, Miller Lite, etc. - at least they had Stella and Sam Adams...  Staff was pretty on-the-ball and quite friendly, if I could give them four stars separately, I would.  However, given the chance for a do-over - I'd go back to Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay. Much better beer selection, better ingredients.

OGLFufiBfaGnnq6GdhB3Og.text: Great place to watch Monday Night Football on the strip! Not to mention the gorgeous and attentive bartender and two for one drinks at Happy Hour. What could be better?? Well.... how about a delicious burger with brie, a thick slab of bacon and those ohhh so good caramelized onions. Big enough to split if your hubby can stop drooling over the awesome bartender;)

b2Yoo92bXw01eOdb47hJdg.text: Great burger place in the Paris with friendly service and a good bar.  Kudos for much more than a beef patty option, and home made buns.  Now I will say we stopped in mid afternoon, long after the lunch rush and before the happy hour crunch so service was great and the food hot.  We substituted the type of cheese on the burgers without any problems.  My ice tea was continuously refilled and the fries were hot and fresh.  The waitress chatted amicably.  We had been here before and found it to be consistent with previous visits.  I would recommend Le Berger if you want a casual meal in the Paris hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1000 words

ASe0YZUAK98rGybgwvtnDw.text: Stopped in on a whim and had a Peanut Butter & Banana Shake, along with a Brie Cheese and Bacon Burger. Best burger I ever had. They server 3 different style of fries. You can get a sampler platter if you can't decide. If you get to the Paris or Bally's (this place is in between the two) you should stop in

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brie Cheese &amp; Bacon Burger
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut Butter &amp; Banana Shake
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

93kULC6JRYJDAsMhJcLK7w.text: Convenient if you are staying at Paris or Bally's (it is in between).  $11 burgers don't come with fries so it is a bit spendy. That said, they have a large assortment of burgers, beef, chicken, lamb, salmon, veggie and tons of toppings.  I had the veggie burger topped with spinach and brie. I added a side of fried for $3.99.  Good, friendly service. Bar is convenient for dining alone.

EeOJRFnnK6i33PAGBtq_aA.text: We had lunch here before a trade show and it was better than I expected.  They offer all kinds of burgers (wagyu, veggie, turkey, etc...) and some other sandwich options.  I had the veggie w/swiss and shrooms, my husband had a french dip cheese steak, both were pretty good and arrived hot.  The fries are coated, which I don't particularly like- but people do.  Our drinks were always refilled, but the service was a little slow- friendly but slow.

eQqg2ZuqR0_FZ1GYzHDv1A.text: The food is not 5 star gourmet but this establishment is.  Prices are very good for vegas and its location is prime between ballys/paris in the cool mall thing they have.  We got a sampler of appetizers and a mix of burgers, all the burgers were well cooked, theres good variety in the buns and toppings available and they also have lamb, turkey and veggie burgers as well.  Service was spot on.  They also have 100oz beer towers, if you purchase one you get to spin a wheel they have to win a price. We got 50$ off our bill!   Great place for a cheaper less casual vegas meal than many of the other options around.

LGzrzysdXLLs7hk1016f1A.text: Le Burger Brasserie is a nice little place to grab a quick snack, nice dinner, or just drinks. Two times daily they have happy hour where you get 2-4-1 beer and well drinks, 4-7 and 9 - close I believe are the times. Happy hour is available at the bar only, not the restaurant.   The Burgers look delicious although I have not tried them yet. The frites are to die for, you have a choice of petit, grande, or waffle, or get the sampler with your choice of any two or any three.   There are several screens located around the restaurant and at the bar, inluding one large screen at the bar, for your sports viewing pleasure.   The women in this joint all wear red corsettes and black short shorts. One of the waitresses, LaLa, really took me by surprise when I came in two days or so from my last visit and new my order. It was only the second time I have seen her, so kudos to her. The staff here are all friendly. If you find yourself  in the mood for burgers and booze, and a little sports, then check out Le Burger Brasseri.

PtbGSeYcuRb_fRi5JLIoUw.text: This is a great spot to enjoy a good game and a great burger!!!   The prices are a bit steep, but this isn't old Vegas anymore!!! Build your burger from the bun, to the meat, to the toppings.   Though there are other food options, you would be amiss to eat anything other than a burger. If you have happen to hit the jackpot, order the 777 burger. For $777.00 you can enjoy a Kobe beef burger, topped with Fois Gras, a Maine lobster tail, and a 100 year aged Balsamic vinegar, alongside a bottle of Dom Perignon Rose (you can order the burger a la carte also, nut why would you want to?).

liObZqldE8Nne42cUZutVw.text: The food was delicious here.  What made this experience amazing was the service!  Leo had a genuine smile and was very knowledgeable with the menu. He addressed any concerns I hadand made sure our food came out on a reasonable time!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We got the choose two, fries combo.  Sweet Potato and petit.  They were both delicious!
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Lamb burger (saveur) was delicious! Also, I had an amazing server named Leo. He was genuine and have us great service!

tiZS9gonTC9CPdp8U0448Q.text: Sadly, I have to rate 3 Stars because the service was so incredibly poor.  The food was 5 Stars but poor service can kill the best food anytime.  Saturday night.  Seated right in front of the wide screen TV.  Nice.  Our server was kind of slow in greeting us but nevertheless I didn't mind because I wanted time to review the menu.  We ordered two burgers, fries, cole slaw and diet cokes.  We waited more than 40 minutes to get anything.  In fact, I thought our waiter went home.  Ironically the table next to us had a waitress who was very attentive and made many many passes.  Right before we were about to get up and ask for a manager, our waiter came by and said "Oh the kitchen has been running through all the larger parties orders but YOURS is next for sure".  I can deal with 12 bucks for a burger a la carte but it needs to come with better service than your average Dennys.  Not sure about a return visit.  Maybe we just got a lazy server by bad luck of the draw.

qOHW5_7cvWEgWEsYLtwsaA.text: Really one of the best Burger Joints on the Strip. Not pretentious; just good food, large portions, and great service. Our Server, Genevieve, was fantastic. She knew exactly how to handle a finicky eater and did so with grace and humor. So, too, the Hostess who checked us in (didn't get her name, but she is preggers), made accommodations for our scooter-rider. An excellent meal (BTW the steak was super flavorful) in a lively environment.

UjjcuuOBbPldCNqynj0hug.text: WORST SERVICE EVER I haven't tried their food since our waitress never acknowledge us. We were walking by and the nice hostess showed us the menu and when I asked about any Vegan options, she said they have the Impossible burger which is Vegan. We sat down at a table near the bar area but no one approached us. We told one of the of the waitresses that we are ready whenever she is, but she said someone would be right with us. No one came. No one even seems to mind that we are there. After 10 minutes we got tired of waiting so we left and went to Wahlburgers which was only 10 mins walk and was awesome! I highly recommend to just take your money and your appetite to a different burger restaurant. For what you pay here (24$ for a burger) you can find better options.

Xs-5jMp9rB7ndg0Pei-G4A.text: Hmmmmm... Welll.... Each burger is $20, just for the burger.  They are good, but $20 good? Nope.  Add another $7 for fries.  Our waitress was a bit of an asshole.  She was short and snobby.  There were a total of maybe 5 tables seated and she was very put out by serving us. A friend asked for a straw, she replied very rudely: we don't have straws!  The table next to us had straws...  May they brought their own?.... I get that companies are eliminating them, I have stainless steel ones, but don't be a dick.

XyQ92LIjtuBE4QKg4W88tw.text: Walked in and I wasn't expecting much but to my surprise it was reasonably good test, liked the salad as well.

xvhFlhG6JH00Mzy7jNlMvA.text: I stumbled upon this place while looking for a place to eat. We were so hungry. We were a group of five. We checked the menu out and they had a bit of everything, which is what I love. Choices. I ordered their Clam Chowder soup....wow! Wow! I think this was definitely the best clam chowder soup I've had in my life. Honestly. We also ordered chicken wings, their burger (which looked so tasty and juicy) and a couple of other items. I can't remember all of them. Service was amazing! She was so friendly and talkative. Made us feel very comfortable. The food and prices are great. I will definitely be back here once I'm in Vegas again. Thank you so much!!!

2D0jWZ8xpq-TMGJ632eUyw.text: I have been here a few times and I've never been disappointed. It's a great burger place with several flatscreens to catch a game. The seating is comfortable and the ambiance is fun! Our hostess on our last visit was friendly and seated us immediately. If you come at a busy time, you may have to wait. It's situated between the Paris Casino Hotel and Bally's Casino so you can valet park at either place.   We all ordered burgers...I ordered one with caramelized onions, Brie cheese and bacon. It is delicious! It was juicy and cooked medium rare the way I like it. We shared fries and have had onion rings in the past. They are both very good. We ordered our fries extra crispy and that's the way they were, nice and hot! They also have grilled chicken and salads if you decide you do not want a burger.   The place is clean and the service is good but can be slow at times. The cost is reasonable for a place on the strip. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paris burger. ..bacon, caramelized onions and brie cheese
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Protein burger
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried onion rings

cbVEYTN02W5u81UguAAYYw.text: Meh! I've had better at an upscale burger joint.  We came in on a Sun afternoon & were seated right away. It's a really nice setting & they show the game on big screens!   We ordered hot wings, onion rings, fries, & a salmon sandwich. All were ala cart items, ok, and pricey. Yes this is Vegas & we don't' mind dining or spending the money. It did not have that wow factor & the sandwich gave me the shits right after!!!   And what ruined it for us was our server Christina who kept calling us & her other customers--"Doll", "Sweetie", "Loves", "Honey", "Hun", "Babe" (eye roll)-- I just don't know you like that....save the 'Flo' bit for Denny's!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ffxAhmpm1IfIIMDl4AEdYA.text: I've honestly never felt the need to ever rate a restaurant as 1 star, but this place definitely took the prize for one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to in my life.  The only friendly person was the host who had a friendly greeting and seated us immediately. The prices are relatively appropriate (about $14+ for a burger w/ no sides, $8 appetizers) to the high cost of eating in Las Vegas but it was kind of a bummer that they did not offer combo meals during our visit. There was a table of 8-10 businessmen sitting across from my table and the server in our section was busily helping them. After about 10 minutes after being seated, the waiter came over, took our order, and just zoomed off to help the businessmen group again. We had to flag down another person to ask for waters and our food came after 15 minutes.  I ordered the Italian burger which was mediocre with a medium patty. The flavor was not bad but the patty was on the dry side and the bun was not buttered or prepared in any way at all. The girlfriend ordered the buffalo chicken fries, which was essentially old fries with diced Tyson buffalo chicken tenders bathed in buffalo sauce and crumbled bleu cheese. It looked like a stoners creation and we only managed to take a couple bites before calling it quits. The onion rings are actually AMAZING. They look and tasted freshly battered, fried golden brown, came in a large portion, and well worth the 8 bucks. Apparently it's inconsistent though because other reviews had subpar onion rings.  The biggest issue at this establishment is the service. Sitting across the group of businessmen I can see our waiter going above and beyond with his service by making small talk with the group members, constantly checking if they need refills, and finally bringing out complimentary mini ice cream shakes to the whole group to finish their meal. The same waiter never brought us out waters, never came around to check on our food after it was brought out, and also charged us extra on our receipt so we had to wait another 10 minutes to get it fixed (because he was nowhere to be found).  The restaurant itself is open late and doesn't look too bad from the inside or the outside. However, don't be fooled because the food lacks quality and unless you come in a large group you won't receive any service. I much rather have dinner from a vending machine because it'll be faster, cheaper, and probably just as good tasting.

q4urwiNV-gA9lHWovhJTGQ.text: This is a great place for hot dogs if your in the mood for rich filled hot dogs.  Excellent flavor and creative ideas. I thought it was very rich. Great flavors. I had the south western with corn. My wife had the hot dog with fries. They were great with no complaints. The only thing I would ask Dirt Dog is to put a fresh cucumber, pickle and tomatoes on the side. It helps with the richness of the hot dog. A good Chicago dog would be a great choice on the menu. Great place to eat.  Pricy but good

OH7s4y8AihDAvqKoBnU2mg.text: Service isn't very good. They are friendly when they come to the table, but dont show up very often. It took a half hour before we got drinks. Our food was longer. Pretzels were good, lamb burger was really good. Don't go near buffalo chicken fries. The sauce is very bad, and our chicken was off. When we brought it to the manager's attention he at least took it off the bill. We currently have been sitting here at least 15 minutes after our food was finished, and have not seen the waitress again. I would not recommend or come back. If you do come get a burger to go and call it a day.

et60UrE-gMv8bPfedLOrGg.text: I got the sliders and they were terrible! They are super small to beggin with bread is dry and saggy at the same time. Meat nothing special. It tasted like a cheap microweavable frozen sliders. Service was slow and waitress was very depressed and miserable. Two stars because seating was nice and good place to watch sports but there are better places for that around.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This should be called Super Mini Sliders
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

pLTbZBZsEw6yR2D652DPtw.text: After a day of solo shopping I went here for a late lunch. Restaurant was more than 3/4's empty. I was seated by a young woman at a table against the wall in the back behind the servers ' station where all three servers on the floor kept their backs to me. As I was seated behind their station they also had their backsides approximately a foot and a half from my face. After waiting ten minutes I left. I told the woman who seated me why I was leaving and asked if she would have wanted that rear end view while eating lunch. She was like, so what, I could have moved you. I said yes, but you  told me to sit there and there was no service where I could have asked to be moved. She was disinterested in the conversation. This is not the kind of negative service one would expect from a restaurant in Bally's. Two thumbs down for rude and disrespectful service.

IIF00HTWSMxd0rfjE87rwA.text: Came here to try the food out and because we had credit to use.  The food is not bad and the portions are kind of generous.  I gave this place a 4 star because the burger and fries were delicious.  However, I kind of wished the burgers and fries were more or less a combo instead of separate.  We ordered a Mango Smoothie, it was more on the icy side.  Service is a little bad as well.  After the first 5 minutes or so with our food, our waitress almost never came by our table, even when we were in front of food servicing area...

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Burst Smoothie.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Burger.

RfxQ_K7DypclBUBxMmriag.text: I was originally going to put 5 stars because our server Alex was great everything about him was awesome.  But as we were leaving the restaurant tonight 10/5/18 I had said have a good night to the girls in the front and one of the servers responded with "fuck off" she had her hair up in a low bun and was really rude

uQ0U4IXmShAt-JlaTSlBGA.text: So this is kinda a tricky rating.  Burgers-5 stars Wings 5 stars Onion rings-5 stars Shakes based on a sample 5 stars. Everything else 3 stars.  Since they have burger in their name and Alex gave us 5 star service, I couldn't give anything less.  I thought the burgers were better than Ramsay's burger joint and would recommend this place for burgers, wings, and beer.

6DyZhRzTYKUmEUTxpN8YrA.text: The Cobb salad had a twist:  a lightly battered and fried avocado, which I really enjoyed. The skin on some the sun dried marinated tomatoes was too tough to eat. The blue cheese dressing was tangy rather than sweet and I like that. It's a sport themed place despite the name, so the TVs were on and the music was blaring. The service was good. I would eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb Salad

x68hGGP6CYmfPCRUhnjSeA.text: In Vegas and wanted to eat at a burger joint. Had a 20% off coupon since we were staying at Bally's. Stopped by and had two burgers and some Sweet potato fries. The chicken burger was amazing and the sweet potato fries were even better. We will definitely go back the next time we are in Vegas.

R2_PO2TNVSj5eK9OYisBpw.text: Stopped in to grab some fries to take back to the room. They were delightful and the portion was huge.

z0sWf_v_HH6VqtoM7ch5Dg.text: My friend and I went to dinner tonight and we didn't have a good experience. The wait was around 15 minutes when we were told 5 and the restaurant was not busy. We waited another 15 minutes for water and 25 minutes for our food, then my friends order was incorrect. The waitress didn't apologize for it and then her Prime Dip was bland. My Paris burger was good and seasoned well. We wouldn't return to this restaurant.

oeMTPL5doZFi2-Rzjk1OrQ.text: World class prime rib dip sandwich and good gourmet burgers...  The prime rib dip was to die for! Came back for it twice. Ask for some mayo and horseradish on the side. The bun is so wonderful, crunchy and soft inside. Definitely homemade. The prime rib is tender and you can bite through it like butter. The dip is perfect, flavorful without being too salty.  Had a great burger here too. Grilled onions, baked Brie cheese, arugula, baby bib lettuce and tomatoes. Tasty homemade bun with a corn meal dusting. Meat patty was appropriately sized.   Service from Karli was friendly and efficient, really sweet person. She's easy on the eyes too. Sit on the entrance side of the bar, as this is currently her area.  They offer a reasonable selection of beverages if you choose to imbibe. Otherwise pint sized glasses of cold water with plenty of ice.   Great plenty of flatscreens if you want to catch a game while you eat.

ZaZhpFm99QAR59uBHjI5SA.text: This place is the BOMB!!!  I love burgers but not a big fan of Turkey burgers.  YOU HAVE TO ORDER CHAMPAGNE BURGER!  I come here just for this burger.  The turkey patty doesn't taste anything like turkey and the flavor is nothing I have ever tasted.  YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champagne Burger

zn1Y804lQCSz8tbwfuEWPA.text: This place is AMAZING!!! With all the focus on Celebrity Chefs in Las Vegas, it's nice to find a hidden gem for those of us who just want an Awesome Burger! The staff is over-the-top friendly and the food is truly succulent! If you find yourself in Sin City, I HIGHLY suggest trying this place out! You will be pleasantly surprised!

iq6CUk6my1QYz2fO9ruPig.text: Truly a delicious burger. Got the bleu cheese burger as a recommendation from our waitress, Nicolette, and it did not disappoint.   Bun was soft, buttery, and dusted in cornmeal for texture. The beef was perfectly cooked to order, medium with a bit of pink. The party was soft and juicy with plenty of flavor. The burger was covered with a generous helping of fresh medium bleu cheese which stayed well placed on the patty down to the last bite.  My friend got the Pork no-bone sandwich. Basically shredded pork stringy off the rack of ribs, glued together with light and very slightly spicy BBQ sauce, then lightly breaded (with Panko..?) and quick fried. Served on a toasted long bun. Absolutely delicious. Just like a rack of ribs without the mess.  Actually a better burger than Slaters 50/50! And it takes a lot to say that. (For me anyway)

3HjJZfFeaI9HQxQtacZFcg.text: Went here to avoid the breakfast lines at the buffet. Am I glad we did that. The burgers were amazing. The fries were awesome and the service was incredible. I had the slider platter and it was one of the better burgers I have had on the strip.

k7j45kc8FsyxSI30qjyW9g.text: My family and I were in Vegas for a wedding recently and we stopped by here for lunch.  We were staying at Bally's, so this restaurant was close.  Our party of four was seated without a wait.  They had a special burger (choice of cheese, choice of fries and choice of beer) for somewhere around 19.99.  Three of our party (including me) got the burger special.  I ordered a medium burger with cheddar cheese, regular fries and a root beer.  I was supposed to get a beer with my meal but it was too early in the day for me to have a beer.  The waitress agreed to let my sub. root beer for beer.  Our food came out hot and within a reasonable amount of time.    No complaints.  The burger was juicy and flavorful.  The fries were good.  I really enjoyed the root beer since it has been awhile since I had one  My daughter and son-in-law enjoyed their burger special also,  They had theirs the proper way, with a beer.  My wife had the chipotle chicken skewers.  She enjoyed her selection.  I stole a bite.  I have to agree that the chicken was good.    Our waitress was friendly, fast and efficient.  I enjoyed the meal and can appreciate the fact that they serve burgers that are a step above but I also think the price is also a step above.  Good quality food in a relaxing environment but a bit pricey for burgers.

LHI9KPjCNLePR4o3L5fHHA.text: We had the hot dog sliders. Mini dogs wrapped in bacon with spicy mustard. Really good. We had the open faced roast beef on dark rye with horseradish, tomato, and cheddar. We also had the Paris burger with bacon, brie, and caramelized onions. Both were delicious.

jpKgOz6rlMWul13aEb0NIA.text: Maybe we have the urge to try ALL burgers in Las Vegas...  While there are many good burgers, most fall in the OK class. This place is precisely a-ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nIDpLJPBmSJ-PPbYPt-7cA.text: Overcooked.   When you order a burger medium and also upgrade to the Kobe beef, you would expect to get it cooked right. Nope. I got it well done. Sweet potato fries were alright.  The upside was the people with me enjoyed their meal. Beer was good. Good thing you can't mess that up.   Sorry for the bad review but you guys need to be consistent.

srckno0Vdz68p4rLX73N-Q.text: **Reviewed by Local Resident since 2006**  I say this because this was an experience like none other. I loved the food here it was absolutely unbelievable. I had the burger upgraded to Kobe beef ($5 extra) and it was spectacular! I don't know how to describe the taste of Kobe beef in my mouth but it was something very unique to my taste buds as I have never tasted Kobe beef before. YUM!  So, we shared the Kobe beef burger with Tilamook cheddar, caramelized onions and mushrooms and also waffle fries on the side. We also had an appetizer, the chili Thai wings that were really tasty, not spicy at all...more sweet.   If there was anything that I didn't like about the place was that it was super noisy and the tables were a little too close to each other, where you could hear other peoples conversations...Overall it was a very good experience, the food was great the service was too.

lHzPmmWBeq__d2aMjL2Asg.text: Came here to watch some Monday night football.  It's nice because they have lots of TVs and a huge projector.  They also play game audio.  Over four hours of football, we ordered the Kobe burger, onion ring tower, pick 3 fries, French fantasy martinis, Midnite in Paris, and the beignets.  The food was pretty much bar food that was trying to be fancy.  The burgers were pretty decent and the fried stuff was delicious.  I really liked the criss cut sweet potato fries.  The martinis were delicious and strong.  The beignets were meh.    Overall, a fun time was had by all, but I wouldn't go out of my way to return.

TWsPOVpanumI7mVh5faljw.text: Stumbled in here on a Saturday night and got a table quickly . Food was better than Yelp would suggest. Wings were crispy and delicious, burgers were cooked medium rare as asked. Great bar food.

nvCI1DmVfdieoJdizg9xwg.text: Good burger but the super slow service was not worth it. Long wait to order, took 20 minutes to refill a soda. Beer is not cold enough, even asking for a new beer as a replacement did not help. Waitress seemed overwhelmed and it wasn't busy.

BNfoN4nS1EnS0rX0jr-3ww.text: The appetizers were very good, but the service was absolutely terrible. The waitress knocked over my drink, which shattered on the table. She replaced it, but no one came to clean up the glass. It just sat on the table. A different waitress brought out our food. She dropped a deviled egg, thought we didn't notice, so she didn't say anything. When we asked her to bring us one to replace the one she dropped (there were only four) she acted offended. We finally got our food. No one got the French fries they ordered and the waitress was snotty when we asked about them. They finally came when we were done eating. We waited 10 minutes for a drink. Finally we asked to talk to the manager. Who was an asshole to us. He asked what we were trying to negotiate. We said we just wanted him to know how terrible our service had been. Not a good experience.

8nOfe_jm2GhsjYHU-gqMHQ.text: Love this burger place in Vegas. I've been here several times and the food and service have been good and consistent. Fries are great. Burgers are amazing. A thumbs down, however, to the sliders (just go for the burger instead. It will be cooked better and will be more food for same price) and two thumbs down for chicken tenders (they aren't bad, but they are the same mass produced chicken tenders that you get at schools and at the zoo. Really?  They could do better.). Overall though, I'll be back again and again for a great burger.

a6AY7h0ecTJMPx4Jdx3ezQ.text: Purchased a Groupon for this restaurant. Nothing classy, but not bad. Didn't really feel a French vibe but it was a burger joint so it was a good try. The food on the other hand was excellent! I ordered "le bleu" burger and my wife just a regular burger with American cheese. Mine was delicious! It's made with bleu cheese, avocado, and smoked applewood bacon on a your choice of bun. The meat of the burger itself was very tender and juicy! I don't believe it was Kobe beef either(they have "le kobe" burger). Whatever type of beef it was, it was PRIMO! Our waitress was very helpful and always made sure our drinks were full. All in all, a pleasurable dining experience and would recommend Le Burger Brassier to any gourmet burger lover! Just wish there was more of a beer variety, but I think McDonalds should have a beer variety lol

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife&#39;s &#34;le beouf&#34;. A cheeseburger with American cheese and thin cut fries.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Le Bleu&#34; Burger from Le Burger Brassier with thick cut fries.

50pCH3mm_uHSto7y1gp4nw.text: Food was OK but service was horrible. We went there with a group of five after a day working a trade show. We were tired, hungry and did not want to be there all night since we had an early flight the next morning. It took forever to order our food, and then when we finally did, many of the items came out wrong. Was very difficult to get drink refills, knives and forks or napkins.  They have a very good menu and lots of potential but they need a strong general manager who can hire better people and hold them accountable.

ybob4ltW50o3M0tE0FY0Pw.text: Was in Vegas over the summer and saw this place as I walked by several times heading different places. Decided to stop in and give it a try. Decent atmosphere. Wasn't super busy most of the time. Wait staff was nice and we had an enjoyable meal.   I got the "Your Burger" with Gruyere and bacon, with waffle fries. I enjoyed the spicy ketchup.  Everything was cooked well and had good taste.  I would eat here again.

eNybRCNRN9GWjyB4bBNddQ.text: My husband & I went around 4:00 on Friday & sat at the bar. The bartender was quick & accommodating. We ordered a bacon blue burger cooked medium & blue burger with lettuce, tomato, & spicy mustard cooked well. Didn't take long at all to get them & the bartender gave us some complimentary fries. Both burgers were cooked exactly how they should be and were very good except for the buns. We got cornmeal crusted buns that were just odd....crunchy on the outside. Glad the fries were free because they were a little soggy.

VpFWZED7l7k4CROa945DnQ.text: Upon my return to Vegas, the burger brasserie became my frequent haunt, whether it was for happy hour or a quick bite between classes at a conference I was attending!  The service was as before, friendly & efficient, got to explore the menu some more & all round its darn good (I still stand by the fact the waffle fries are da bomb), they make a mean milkshake... It will bring boys to your yard... Damn right!  Happy hour equates to 2 drinks for $10 & the bar staff are on point, in particular Daylen, he's got great banter & may wow you with some fun bar tricks, overall though he ensured my visits to BB were not disappointing!!!  Totally recommend this place :)

3dzaMxyaD25TA7USOMM2Tw.text: Expensive average food. Not worth it when there are so many other options in the area.   Don't get the chicken strips. You will find better and cheaper at the market!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuck

d01vpHglHVJO38DttdK3-g.text: Came in January for CES, Had split a French dip on recommendation from a co-worker and also had waffle pommes fries, it was both okay, bread was good - crispy on outside just the way i like it, think i'll be back as I wanna try a burger!!! 3 stars only b/c it was just okay, nothing special for what u pay, I'll update my review when I come back and have a burger!

3pGA9YGsDLRQ7HJLw5cwcQ.text: Great service and vibe.  Got the blue cheese burger with kobe beef. I had heard the best things about this place but I was not impressed.  It was good but it wasn't what I expected with all its high reviews. Onion rings were very good with "cheetos" seasoning.  Maybe I'll try this place again and order a classic cheeseburger.

r1VWWnnLnOXQ7Gl4eXehRw.text: Loved it! Ate at bar and service was great. Burgers were juicy, ingredients tasted fresh & flavorful, and they were cooked perfectly to temperature-- yum!!

CXuFfFM0n-NgwTcuwHg54Q.text: Worst meal I've had in Vegas! It's like an upscale Hooters, waitesses are dressed in tight clothing and they can't pronounce their soup of the day. I get this is a guy place with sports playing on tv, plenty of girls walking around in skimpy outfits but the food is just disappointing.   Paris has always been one of my favorite hotels in Vegas. It's classy and fun. However, because this sports burger joint is inside paris, every item on the menu starts with "Le". It gets to the point where it just sound silly.  Le classique burger is a Carls jr. grade burger and their fries are super over-fried and dry...probably was fried in the morning.   I'm not trying to hate on a men's joint....if this is a Hooters, then make it a Hooters, don't put a "Le" in front of it and charge $13 for $3 quality burger.   Also, we had to wait 20mins when 2/3 of the restaurant was empty.

gZhR2Jr-RBYRjX4X629Kig.text: This place is awesome!!  Annie Rockwell at Bally's Tennis club recommended that we try this place- bless her!  We had two GREAT lunches here.  Some of the best French fries I've ever had- and I am a French fry freak!  Great chopped salad also.  We had the blue burger & the Brie- both fantastic!  If you like good burgers and fries this is the place to go.

YQxYzPXYMrK6Uhk7I5yIKw.text: Split a build-a-burger, waffle fries and had a couple of beers at this a la carte sports burger bar with my hubby after a loooong walk down the strip.  Burger was really good and totally hit the spot.  Liked the sport question at seating with a chance to get 10% off (we failed! It was Drew Bledsoe - who knew?).  A bit pricey for what we had, but I'd eat here again.

U29nFPIrFnm9TN0CnOkf3w.text: Good food. Good service. Overall surprisingly good experience. Burger and pastrami sandwich were better than what we had at Burgr at Planet Hollywood after a 3 hour wait.

WyqdqaoyQM4_RYbdVBp49Q.text: Something about the word "Frites" intrigues my db and I for some strange reason.  We can't help but think anything with "Frites" must be better.  In fact, while we were in Vegas for 2.5 days and we had Frites at least 3 times...(mind you, we only had 5 meals in vegas)  Anyways, we wanted something simple and I haven't had a burger in ages. Looked like a fancy place from far, but from looking at the menu, it  was reasonable and they served FRITES. Too bad you have to order it in addition to your burger - so less one star for that.  Our server wasn't the most friendliest and most attentive. He wasn't mean or anything, just a little stale.  In fact, I was a little jealous of the tables around us because their waiter was so friendly and personable. I remember thinking "I wish we had him."  I've had better burgers elsewhere like Armadillo Willys (at half price burger Saturdays) or Red Robin.  Frites were ok, may be a little too crunchy  all shoe string like for my taste.  I kinda like soft hot centers.  Not sure I'll be running back to this place.  It sure was convenient though cuz my feet were killing me from wearing high heels the night before and we were staying at Ballys.

lHhJcQZqdGeuna8jpAoLWQ.text: Like other reviewers have mentioned, try not to go on a Sunday if you have a groupon. This particular waitress didn't honor it and my friends who had the groupon didn't want to keep pushing it. Anyway, I had the veggie burger (wasn't really feeling in the meat mode) and it was pretty good. However would I pay $12 for that plus $5 for waffle fries again? Probably not. We just came here for my friends groupon and because they wanted to watch some games.

yztZncq4eNfdmTbdG8haKA.text: Our friend that we visited in Vegas wanted to ear here because he was staying in Paris and was at the Happy Hour there earlier. I wasn't too impressed we got there at 640 but wasn't able to order off the happy hour menu and then when we did order I really wasn't too impressed with the food. The service was great though.   I ordered the turkey burger sliders which intrigued me because I have never heard of them the description in the menu made them sound so tasty. Then I got them and they were so dry and had no taste I didn't even finish eating all of them. They came with 3. I don't think I will head back to this spot unless I am sure to get a spot in the Happy Hour area because the regular seating is overpriced as well.

hY-yTmlm_tiJpaox72foFA.text: A positive experience all around. The hostess was gracious. Our server, Angela, was prompt and attentive. Our burgers were delicious and prepared perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_K3r0SeVHQsu1udVIP22cw.text: Food was good. Servings were huge. Think about sharing. I went for dinner. Would not recommend it for that. It is more of a breakfast or lunch place.

WLDxerZY-OOU9kopISeHPA.text: I roll in here at 8:15pm on a Monday night and head to the bar so I can watch a game on the only TV that's showing it.  I sit there for about 10 minutes and no one comes over to me.  I goto the bartender and ask for a menu.  What does he say?  "The kitchen is closed."  Really?  And your hours say you're open until midnight?  WTF?

MAX3-89AFJXdZV6Ml9Ew0A.text: Had read they had one of the best burgers in Las Vegas, so decided to check them out. A rough start - no one helped me at the bar, so I went out to the hostess stand to be seated in the dining room. Nice, comfortable booths and TVs are pretty much viewable from any seat, if you want to watch sporting events. Another rough start with the server as it took five minutes to get my club soda. Those service issues aside, they make a really good burger - I had the Paris Burger, which was topped with bacon, carmelized onions and Gruyere. Their fries are also pretty good. Downside is, their "cone" basket of fries is an extra $7 - it doesn't even come with the $14 burger! So all in you can expect to drop $30 per person for burger, fries and soda. Granted it's on the Strip, so that's sort of to be expected. I'll probably pass on going back - just too many good burgers around, and for a lot less money.

DxUqwld-lFigRLxnQcUS5w.text: You know what makes a good hamburger?  Lamb.  Yep, they have a great lamb burger, topped with sauteed mushrooms and mozzarella, and served up on a fresh-baked sesame seed bun.  Get it cooked medium, which makes for a juicy finger-licking experience.  Their fries aren't bad, but the portions are big enough for two to share.  Prices are Vegas-Strip-Reasonable, which means about $20 for a burger, fries, and a draft beer.

1GPjCMbjVImSc0jRo3QOGg.text: We were looking for a good burger place to go to in Vegas. I came across this place on Yelp and it had fairly good reviews.    I ordered the hot wings as an app and was very impressed with them. I haven't had great wings in a long time and they were cooked perfectly and were quite large.  I have never had a Lamb burger so I wanted to try it. I must say it was probably the best burger I ever had in my life. It was really that good!!!! I was really amazed of the tenderness and taste, with virtually no game taste. My buddy ordered the Kobe burger with waffle fries. The burgers were cooked very well and the price was just right, about $20 per person. In Vegas for what we ordered, that is a definite win.   The only thing that I was disappointed with was the service. It literally took 10-15 minutes for someone to come to our table and get our orders. There weren't that many patrons in the restaurant so it was quite upsetting to me.   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone but keep in mind that the service is really not at all great so be prepared to sit a long time.

YjL-SbnifEVEoz5B6i7UXQ.text: I wouldn't give four stars for the simple fact that the guy in the background was served before me, even though I arrived 15 minutes before he did.  Combine that with the fact that they almost messed up the temperature of my artisan burger, I should only give them 2.5 stars.  The "skippy" who "85'd" my burger dropped a tray full of draft beers about 5 minutes later, so I had the last laugh. Skip eating here simply for the fact that you have to order fries separately from the burger.  Are they really going out of business? Maybe, but I just changed the review to two stars.  I run at least two miles a day.  They just charged me triple what I should have paid, should be zero stars.  It's always good to know that my insights are center-mass and dead-on accurate!  Thx!  Also, there's a big difference between pig Latin and au francais.  In reading subsequent reviews, I guess that if you throw dog food on the floor, people will lick it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef burger with gruyere cheese, caramelized onions,  avocado,  and garlic aioli.   Onion rings dusted with cheese.

sOBf3DxQyPrzC4iOTuVKXA.text: Came here starving, left beyond satisfied. One of the best burger places in Vegas besides Gordon Ramsay burger which is my favorite. My servers name was Chelsea and she was mad cool and a hottie fo sho. Awesome place and the mojitos are bomb.

oHcFXn0ML3_Lmhkx6oaHPQ.text: The gravy fries are mind blowing.  Get them!  The burgers are fantastic and the shirt rib dip was beyond amazing.  Our server Was great too!

vXe2LGb243z_QtehcpJJ9g.text: Good burger, good price, but in a tough market.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le bleu  burger. Plenty of burger, andwas 12 bucks. If you&#39;re European, consider splitting for one for the family.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le bleu  burger. Plenty of burger, andwas 12 bucks. If you&#39;re European, consider splitting for one for the family.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Paris burger. Very delicious and a huge burger for the hungry!

fnECKyNlUX0C9g4Y5a1iAw.text: Can we say TOURIST TRAP?  Ordered the fois gras burger.  The fois gras I don't even think was aunthentic. It was too tough I think to be authentic.  As tough, as say grissel in a cheap steak. The burger itself? On par with Jack in the Box.   The fries were some of the worst we've ever had.   The service wasn't very good either. We weren't given refills in a timely manner, and had to ask.    The other person in my party didn't like her food either, but I can't remember what it was.. But we both agreed this is probably one of the worst places to go in Vegas..  This is what happens when greedy casino execs try to put together a restaurant too quick.  Judging from the ratings, I'm glad some others agree.

hJc-3eMExqtA5vfZltS4tQ.text: An expensive sports bar that serves food. Crowded when I was there, had to sit at the bar. Service wasn't good (had to ask for silver and napkin), food wasn't good, way overpriced (OK, it's Vegas, but $15 for a mediocre hamburger?) Why eat there?

trHgEcx-fEDhFei2UmPgew.text: The food was great the atmosphere sucked. I got a turkey burger and my boyfriend got a lamb burger which looked awesome. Prices were reasonable. Both burgers were 12.50. I really did not like the atmosphere. I know it says sports bar but this is like not what I expected. The staff is all female except the manager and bartender. They're wearing tiny booty shorts and a red corset thing with their black bra showing. I'm not a prude but I want people handling my food to be fully clothed. It's also reallllly loud so don't expect to have a deep conversation.

EQXSURmIBjt0Su0WQroqRg.text: Located inside Paris Hotel and Casino....slightly upscale sports bar. Food is pretty good, nice selection of gourmet burgers, plus some other standard fare. Good selection of beers to go well with your burger choices. We ended up here while visiting my mom in Vegas and looking for a place to watch a Laker's playoff game. We showed up a few mins before game time, told the hostess we wanted a table with a view of the Laker game. They were more than accommodating. Our server was amazing, she was there if we needed her, but was not on top of us to rush us alone. One of the amazing things is after we finished eating, she told us we can take our time, enjoy the game and leave when ever we wanted. We stayed through the entire game. One final note, they have the most beautiful waitresses I've ever seen in a restaurant.

LrquIEmahkbYxPhRXlAxXw.text: This was our fourth time here I believe and still great for a guaranteed good burger with friendly staff and reasonable prices for the strip!

2YSMz4keIc4n0kFh_EyNLA.text: Had the saveur lamb burger, onion rings and a bloody Mary. It was delicious. The bloody Mary was very savory and tasty, definitely unlike any I have ever had.

dsjQMtaxErUbjwP1nvysPA.text: We walked by this place several times thinking it was a fancy restaurant, but it's actually just a casual sports bar & grill.  The burger (with provolone cheese, grilled mushrooms/onions) was good but not anything amazing.  The caramelized onion bun was fresh but a little dry, it needed a little bit of mayo or dressing.     The petite frites (skinny fries) were surprisingly lacking in flavor, it needed more salt or seasoning.     As for the Parisian themed outfits they make the girls wear (white booty shorts, go-go boots), there are a few of the gals sporting muffin tops who really need to order their tops one size larger (sorry, I am just being honest).      A burger, fries, chicken wings and 2 diet cokes was $30 before tip.   We were in and out of there in about 25 minutes flat, so it's a good place to grab a quick bite to eat that is a step up from the hotel cafes.

4k4fLuOPvewvE8VtAe_hQg.text: I had the Le Paris burger and it was pretty damn tasty.  The brie, onions and bacon was a really nice combination.  And the burger was huge.    The service was very friendly and attentive.  I feel bad that they have to wear such ridiculous outfits.  Our waitress was really nice when I ordered a drink not on the menu and made sure it was right.    Definitely great place if you have a burger hankering in Vegas.

XEgUSp2Bt9_CRu0f0yDeww.text: I visited Le Burger Brasserie for the 2nd time on my recent Vegas trip, and upon leaving I began to think of Le Burger how I think of Cold Stone Creamery.  I find Cold Stone's ice cream to be fairly sub-par compared to Ben and Jerry's and even Baskin-Robbins, but it's the endless possibilities and creativeness that make it fun and a tasty treat.  That being said, I certainly don't think that the Brassier burgers are sub-par. The actual patty - I've experienced a turkey and lamb burger - has been good.  Not amazing, but good.  I was hoping for a really game-y experience upon ordering the lamb burger, but it wasn't the lamb experience I was expecting.  The toppings are great - a gourmet variety including brie cheese, harissa hot sauce, buffalo sauce (on a chicken dish), cranberry sauce, caramelized onions, and on and on.  And the bun choices are also fun.  Fries are crispy and salty, just great.    This is not a place I would normally re-visit, as I'm usually attracted to more ethnic restaurants.  However, Le Burger Brasserie is creative enough to keep my interest piqued and comfortable enough during lunch to spend however long I need to devour a tasty burger.

xeLDWumJXoDwKJFe5TA42g.text: Not a bad spot to watch a sporting event and indulge in some major eye candy... the uniforms the waitresses wear are totally degrading, trashy, slutty, skimpy and totally awesome.... But let's get back to the restaurant shall we?    I had the American cheese burger with fries, pretty much the most boring basic burger that you can get here (however, it was delish), they also have lamb, veggie and even chicken burgers I believe.  3 variety of french fries is nice, waffle, steak and standard.   Our real reason we went here was to watch the Lakers v. Nuggets b-ball game.  There's a couple giant screen TVs (over 100 inches) and then the place is surrounded by HD flat screens.  They also serve 100 ounce 30 dollar beers (not sure what flavors) and the bring them out in these really cool bong looking containers, not to mention 4-7 happy hour with 2 for 1s.  The only draw back to that is that you have to go up to bar to be able to get the drink special, kind of lame....  Big, juicy burgers, and a hot-naughty wait staff, lots of TVs, 2 for 1s... if there's a game you're looking for, come and check out this place, it's great for the 'typical guy guy'.

VYdoSp4hIJp285B6HWY1Kw.text: Nothing special, over priced, took 1- 1/2 hours from start to finish.  My bun was dry the top feel off.  The burger fell apart.  My life liked her Philly sandwich.  Two sandwiches, 1 onion ring app., and two ice tea's = $40.00 without Tip!

j1RUxjRFWnc7pf6O5bIXcg.text: We stayed at the Paris and were incredibly hungry upon our arrival, so we stopped here for lunch.  My husband got the Paris burger (caramelized onion, brie), and I got the same but with chicken.  Both were very good, and you have different choices for buns.  It's about $15 for a $10 burger, but I suppose that's to be expected in Vegas?

XD6Ux-ZcC4liH89bbT8KPQ.text: Didn't actually have a burger here, but I did have three other things:  coconut shrimp appetizer - 5 stars caesar salad - 3 stars (some lettuce was brown, and I actually needed to ask for more dressing....it was almost like I just had a plate of lettuce and cheese) bignetes - 3 stars (the description was just so much better than it actually was)

ZKT6snqRpXTNFnNOKWToWA.text: After not eating anything for about 7 hours, I was ready to have my juicy burger.   Ordered the lamb burger, with mozzarella di bufala, and sauteed mushrooms. Should have ordered midium rare cuz it my medium was kinda dry. Good combination but needs a lot of extra seasoning.  The heirloom tomato salad was REALLY BAD....the tomatoes were not ripe enough that they were crunchy...almost not edible.  I appreciate the fact that they make all the buns/bread in house, though not great tasting.  The waitress should consider wearing longer pants if they don't have a decent figure. It's not very appetizing to see so much meat hanging around, bursting out of the tight shorts.

fd7gn0yW3UYinKyg-4uRJg.text: I ate her one night because of a coupon I had from my Harrah's Players Club book. They have a great selection of burgers (lamb, beef, salmon, chicken, and veggie) and an even bigger list of toppings. Of course you can also choose one of the predesigned burgers.   I had an Italian burger with mozzarella, crispy prosciutto, arugala, and tomatoes. It was well cooked as I requested and pretty tasty. The prices aren't bad either. The fries were nice and crispy and they have a selection from shoe string, steak cut, or waffle fries. For two of us (two burgers, a order of fries, two drinks, and dessert) it was less than $40 with tip. I would've been more but the dessert was free.

070qPWgj_zwoV6Ui8dCRxw.text: This place is pretty darn good, and definitely one of the "cheaper" options for dinner at the hotel.  It definitely has a higher class sports bar feel.  We ate here twice in one week while here for a convention, both times we were sat quickly.  One of the things I remembered is our waitress - her name was Lala - she said that was her real name.  She was really nice, but not the most attention, and kind of flightly.  The men at our table really liked the staff here as the girls wear little halter top and white boy shorts.  The food took a while to come out, not sure if it was because of the waitress or if th ekitchen was just slow, as it wasn't super busy either time we went.  But when the burgers came out, boy were they good.  They have a variety of buns you can put it on and a ton of toppings.  The burgers are nice and thick and juicy.  Fries come in cones and are nicely fried and the onion rings are served in a tower.  Definitely come here if you want a decent night out, but are also watching your wallet.

NODccrqYVO-8zkm3vk6HHQ.text: This is a great burger place in Bally's Hotel Casino. A little pricy, but worth it.

2itqOBBdTWf9MXg6qQ_gFg.text: We were in the area and saw a Groupon for this place, so we decided to give it a try. Terrible idea because there are sooo many amazing places to eat in the area- this was just really a waste. We were told there was a wait even though the restaurant was pretty much completely empty. The service was ridiculously slow (again in an almost empty restaurant). We ordered the cheetos onion rings and they were HORRIBLE. The batter wasn't fully cooked and was falling off and there was so much grease on it. Not to mention it was $6 for 5 onion rings that we ended up not eating. The rest of the food was ok but nothing memorable. They were trying a new menu which had no vegetarian options. The ambiance is also really weird- it's like an American sports bar but waitresses are dressed in french-inspired racy costumes. It really crashed with the Parisian theme have a sports/burger joint. Overall, not a great experience.

cn5CeuQaBaAKdn9F07i8Rw.text: We tried this place on a whim as it was our first time staying at Bally's. Glad we did! We had the chicken tender appetizers which were delicious! Huge portion! Then we had the hamburger and philly cheese steak sandwich entrees. Both were really tasty! Our waitress was very good with prompt, friendly, and attentive service. My only problem was that our onion ring tower was served only mildly warm, but I did not want to complain and have them heated up as we were already getting very full! There were many tasty looking choices on the menu, we were sorry we didn't get back this trip. Next time! Highly recommended!

7fP5VByPCMQnHal4r3qRrw.text: We came because of the Groupon deal. I think it is a good decision.  We had a beet and goat cheese salad that is so good that we cannot stop enjoying the dish. It contains regular and golden beet. It is very refreshing as the dressing is light and sweet.  The burger we ordered is the salmon burger. It is a big piece of good salmon. I usually am not so passionate about salmon. But this one make me want to have more. The salmon is fresh and the meat is juicy and soft.   We ended the dinner with a trio sorbet. There are three scoops of sorbet with raspberry, mango and coconut. The sorbet is thick and tasted like fresh fruit. We enjoyed them so much. I was a bit annoyed at the time it took to prepare the dessert dish. We wait additional 20 min just to get the sorbet after the meal.  In all, we like the food very much. Even without the Groupon deal, I think the price range is reasonable with the quality of food you get.  The only reason I cannot give it 5 stars is because of the service. When we came in, we were led to a very small 2 person table with a few shopping bags on hand. We asked for a larger table so we can put things away and eat comfortably. Then we were pointed to a table by the entry door and service station that has a lot of foot traffic and no privacy. So we asked again to be seated more inside as we saw there was an empty booth adjacent to inner wall. The waitress just looked at us and said that it is not cleaned. We were then just said "forget it" and sit uncomfortably on that noisy table. But honestly speaking, why can't she make any effort to accommodate customer's request? How hard would it be to ask someone to clean up the table? There are a lot of ways to better handle the situation than simply decline customer's wish. If not for that Groupon deal and also it is the last day we are in town to be able to use it, we could have missed all the good food and just left.

kcL0UN9yUe12KuAsw-XTIA.text: At first glance from the outside, it looks like a glorified burger joint.  I ordered the salmon burger with onions, and a side of onion rings.   It may be the best salmon sandwich I have ever tasted!  The onion rings were delicious as well.  My associate ordered the chicken burger, and she said it was also incredible.   I also had a French Syrah that was really good.  I will definitely go back to this restaurant when I am in Vegas.

nGEq3zA0AMRC5zngpJD4AQ.text: Went here specifically because I was dying to try a lamb burger.  The combination of flavors was very good (and they were generous with the feta).  However, the grind on the lamb left a little to be desired - I had a few hard bits in the burger.  The fries were crispy and tasty.  The service, however, leaves much to be desired.  They are in no hurry to get your food or your bill to you quickly.  For being billed as a sports bar (there are tvs with sports playing), it doesn't have service like most sports bars.  Plan to have a leisurely meal if you go.    I would go again for a reasonably priced meal on the strip.

rEsqzHuFFkWEbkKlScQKbg.text: Their Novelty Item on the Menu:  Note worthy:    $777  for Kobe Beef and Maine Lobster Burger  How do you charge $777 for a burger!  topped with caramelized onions, imported Brie, crispy prosciutto and 100-year aged balsamic vinegar and served with served with   a bottle of Rose Dom Perignon champagne....and yet strangely I want it....and then think, only fools want this.....  But seriously....back to the food.  Great place for burger...3 choices of fries from pomme frites to steak cut fries...6 different bun choices...it's all about options....and the waitresses where a modern version of the old, "hot dog on stick" outfits.  When in Vegas....cheeze it up....slut it out....drops some dough, overindulge....and slum it with an expensive burger....

mSB6pOr2WlRH384qV1lXEA.text: We needed a quick bite before the Lionel Richie concert (yes, you read right, Lionel Richie) and ducked into this little unassuming gem.  It's tucked away in the passageway between Bally's and Paris.  It's got dark wood decor, a big bar, and a tons of screens, especially a huge one smack in the middle for great sports viewing.  The menu was extensive - beef, lamb, chicken, and salmon.  They even have a $777 option -  Kobe Beef and Maine Lobster Burger, topped with caramelized onions, Brie, prosciutto and 100-year aged balsamic vinegar and served with a bottle of Rose Dom Perignon champagne.  G had the American with onion rings and I had a salmon burger w/ spinach on an oven-roasted tomato bun.  Both our burgers were really really tasty.    And the prices were very agreeable for gourmet burgers.  The waiter was really nice too.  We told him we were in a rush for the concert and he sped it up pronto.

r7RWzUy8zuHlzYkgx241EQ.text: LOVED this place! It's a cozy, quiet oasis in the midst of the chaos that is Las Vegas. Great service, great wine, great prices on the food--which was really tasty (beet salad for $11; awesome cheesecake for $5). Highly recommend it, especially compared to the scores of overpriced restaurants on the strip.

AEfc5HtksyMztNsk5j1IrA.text: I was here last summer and had the "Steak et Fromage", the french take on a philly cheese steak sandwhich. It came with a little side of dipping sauce and the mixture was amazing. I seriously crave it. my mouth is watering just thinking about it...  in fact, I am going to vegas again and this is going to be my birthday meal!

U3eSigWPU4266Q1dixQI_w.text: I will start off buy saying that we did do the $777 burger. It was very good, but I wouldn't order it again. It's so rich and heavy that I felt like I was going to pass out after devouring this monster. The Dom Rose was actually a nice pairing with all of the rich and heavy toppings on the burger. The French Dip Cheesesteak was very impressive. The Au jus served on the side was so awesome, that I asked for second serving, and I pretty much just drank the second cup. It's somewhat pricey, but the overall quality of the food and service was well worth the price, this is Vegas after all!!
