psFqUHXeRTujaHE9PMrnAw.text: Lots of choices for where to eat in Las Vegas.  This is definitely one I would go to again.  Yes, the half naked women was a bonus, but the large selection of beer didn't hurt either!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer - get the big one

6gt6SSq8W_VEWRZD5oquqg.text: This is one of the best burger joints I have set foot in.  Located in the walkway between the Paris and Bally's hotel/casinos, it is very easy to find.  You can order a  burger with a beef, chicken, lamb, turkey, or salmon patty.  They have a full list of toppings and condiments you can add onto your burger.  The list includes regulars such as cheeses, avocado, bacon, and grilled onions to the obscure and unique such as crabmeat, grilled shrimp, and even seared foie gras.  My favorite treat at this restaurant is the selection of 3 different kinds of fries.  You can choose between shoestring, steak, and waffle cut fries or a combination of your choice between the 3.  The salads and desserts are almost an afterthought but they are all excellent.  I recommend the beignets, the French "doughnut" -- deep-fried pastry dough sprinkled with powdered sugar.  I have stopped by Le Burger Brasserie whenever I happen to be in town.

EGusqC1GncesqOJBKlNk9Q.text: This is my first stop when I arrived at Vegas.  The decor and atmosphere was more like a sports bar than anything else.  I ordered a hawaiian chicken burger. It was the most digusting chicken burger I've ever tasted. The chicken tasted very artificial, almost like styrofoam or something. It just didn't taste like chicken at all. Sadly, a McDonald's McChicken taste way better, however, I don't like McChickens.  There were small pieces of bones insinde the chicken, so I ended not finishing my burger. Without a doubt, the chicken patty was frozen stuff from Costco or something.  It was very poor value as the burger cost almost 15 dollars yet it came with no fries or anything else.  Service was friendly and food was delivered to the table quickly, but again, quality was very disappointing.

HQXAfYf6IjDzLI84zS3Wsg.text: Hidden in the shops by the Paris casino, this sports bar has a lot to offer. The drink specials were good, one came with an orchid and tasted great. The burgers here can be personalized to your liking and are not too expensive. One of the better burgers I had in Vegas but not the best .

60A7WNR9PVSoc9phNgpsIQ.text: The kobe beef burger melts in your mouth and is reasonably priced at $21. You MUST try it!  The filet mignon sandwich and french dip were also amazing!  The buns are made in house daily and you can taste the difference.  Although some reviewers say this is not a good place for kids, our teenagers felt welcome and there were TVs everywhere which offered visual distractions for all ages.  Our server, Jose, was attentive and no one blinked an eye when one of our kids spilled her drink TWICE.  We will definitely visit again!

yAxJrqNFFYXXt7hrzmbArQ.text: I like this place for one reason only, and that is their burgers. I don't normally crave a burger unless it happens to be an In N Out cheeseburger, but something about these burgers I absolutely crave.   For starters, you have a variety of options to build your own burger. You can pick what kind of bun you want, what kind of cheese, what toppings, etc. My favorite creation is the blue cheese burger on a roasted tomato bun w/mushrooms, grilled onions, lettuce, tomato, mayo and ketchup (disgusting I know, but so delicious!). Their fries are also really good and the fry sampler is large enough to share with a group.

KITQxbfuE8WEEi1yUSGMEw.text: Walked in, got a seat at the bar, had some water and met the surly bartender, left without ordering. I was too tired to deal with him.

MwP-5b1NxfpFuUoUNOzO4g.text: My boyfriend & I played tourist on the strip for a weekend and liked this restaurant!! We liked the huge big screen TV displaying sports highlights over the bar while we waited for our food. The place is quite noisy but that's to be expected with basketball & football fans at the table next to ours. Our waitress seemed a little out of it, maybe she had alot on her mind... but she wasn't rude and checked on us every now and then. I had the Le Paris burger & my boyfriend had the Kobe beef. We loved our burgers & ate everything on our plates. Very delicious food. Okay atmosphere and mediocre customer service. We might be back.

AwIwTQDuLRlMqMFu1PNUdQ.text: Located in kind of in the walkway between Paris and Bally's, this French Bistro/Burger place sits.  It is kind of a sports bar.  The decor focuses on the color black, and the waitresses have to wear touristy corset getups.  We needed something quick, and this did do the trick.  Service was good, and food came out quick enough.  I wasn't super hungry.  I had the clam chowder and the potato skins.  I've had better, but both dishes weren't horrible.

tYkAJkN2NAq1xGDR-XD_SA.text: Men may be attracted to this place because the waitresses wear this tight lingerie looking outfits with black knee high boots.  I found that the place was as I expected: a place with mediocre food but nice decor, location, and (to men) nice looking uniforms.  I had the clam chowder and it was surprisingly good.  It had lots of clam chunks in it and had just the right texture.  The tower of onion rings were also good.  This place prides itself on its burgers and has a wide selection of types of meat patties you can get (beef, chicken, turkey, veggie, lamb) or the type of bun you get.  Sides are a la carte, so if you want something with your burger, it will cost extra.  Most of the burgers come with one free topping, and extra toppings will also cost extra.    My friend had the California Chicken Burger.  It was dry and it had no flavor.  My other friend had the buffalo wings.  She said they were too salty.

Fj6jiM7lcRNig1vSTvLWwA.text: this has been my place to go EVERY single time i am in vegas. the bartender (not sure if he is there anymore) is why i go there seriously, he is the best bartender i have come across in all my trips to vegas. when im craving that blue cheese burger and a good beer i go here. shout out to D! hope to see you soon!

layajWhGLU22kjy3XJk8iA.text: Ok so...the one thing that stood out here was the $777 kobe beef/main lobster burger with melted brie, caramelized onions, and balsamic vinegar reduction served with a bottle of dom perignon...can you say baller status..and no i did not order that, but i did order this, which as amazingly juicy and yummy...  Original Lamb burger coated with creamy goat cheese spread, grilled and raw onions to give it that bite, mixed greens, smoked bacon, tomatoes served on a toasted sun dried tomatoe ciabatta and dipped in a balsamic vinegaraitte sauce....with pomme frites and a glass of chardonnay....  Yes the burger was amazing- so rich and fatty - just how i like it...  As much as the food was amazing, the service was a little slow surprising being that our weighter was this massively built toned arms and legs woman body builder...im guessing she doesnt eat those burgers....but anyway it was really cold in the restaurant, i mean i know its hot in vegas, but im not trying to live in an iceberg....yet they were accomdating for a huge group...  Would totally go back to try their many selections of burgers and you can add your own sides...you can eat a salmon burger, chicken burger, lamb burger, or a beef burger...definitely satisfied my craving for a good burger...and add whatever you like on it...but if you cant decide, they have a pretty good selection...

X_n3aCV1LomK1_tbL3FPkg.text: Wanted a good "cheap eat" burger and stumbled upon this place.  What more can I ask for?  Sunday night football and a good, solid tasting burger.  The wait was no more than 5 minutes as I initially thought it would be longer because of the evening game.  Nothing special inside, although there is a 15 ft screen on the wall showing the game over the bar.  Otherwise, a typical sports/restaurant bar type place with decent prices I might add.  Typical 1/2 lb beefy burgers are $11-$19 depending on what you get.  I got the Le Paris, but without the brie, since I'm not a fan of it.  I got it with American instead.  The burger itself is very good, juicy, dripping in fat.  On top of that, their beer bucket is $20 for 5 beers, can't beat that in Vegas.  I got the waffle fries, which were seasoned well.

RwQAL2MhcRycujFWJxsg0Q.text: A French name for an exceedingly American restaurant.  Le Burger Brasserie in The Paris Las Vegas features tasty gourmet burgers at decent prices, crunchy Sweet Potato Fries, and a decent selection of Beers which can be consumed from giant towers (not Eiffel ones, but you get the idea). They also feature tons of flat screen TVs for enjoying big games.   While the decor is French-fancy, the atmosphere and food are pure American bar and grill with a slightly elevated twist... which adds up to something pretty fun and great.

_1IylgoHZ_P3SfkUXHPRGQ.text: The food and environment are both really good. What downgrades this beautiful restaurant is how slow it took to get a meal out and not so welcoming service.

JpPQEbtINyEQb59OCC3zeg.text: So I walked around the idea of having a burger for the new year. So I walked into Le Burger Brasserie in Paris.  First thing I started with was the cheeseburger Mac and cheese bites, oh dear god are they good and the dipping sauce was on point.  So guess what I didn't get the burger I ordered dry rub chicken sandwich cuz they Mac bites were so good I didn't want to ruin it. First bite in the chicken was delish I'm glad I ordered it because it was spicy and juicy and just what I wanted. I am hooked I will be returning soon to try one of those burgers.

WXjlf2KEVSLA5B7Zw-LSEw.text: I've been here a few times, seemed like it was better when it first opened and has gone downhill since. Went to lunch the other day, could not have been more disappointed.  I ordered an original lamb burger, which I have enjoyed in the past. This one was served to me with the hard plastic casing from the meat chub still surrounding the patty. INEXCUSABLE!!! The waffle fries we ordered were on the soggy side, and the wings were a lot spicier than the mild we ordered. I am not sure why our visit was this bad, as the restaurant was not overly busy.  I have enjoyed visits for a quick lunch in the past with no problems. This one just ruined all other visits. Although they did take the burger off the bill, a visit from the manager to apologize would have been in order.....will probably NEVER visit this establishment again.

v6oa0k9uZduD4VCjXU70eg.text: I had a Le Paris kobe burger combo( Kobe beef patty, brie cheese, applewood smoke bacon and carmelized onions) was a good burger. Food was pretty good for everyone in my party. Service her was pretty slow even though resturant was less than half full.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate shake
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe burger with Brie , bacon and carmelized onions!!!

DYM_pM6_TG6Duh0FpS27Jw.text: Visited Weds. night for burgers and onion rings.  Our first visit was in 2013 and the onion ring tower was much taller then now so we were a little disappointed. Their rings are now a lot bigger and taste very good, this makes up for short  tower. The burgers cooked med. rare and very tasty. I returned Fri.for lunch and order the BLT, the best BLT I have ever had. The service is very good.  Good prices. Will come back.

gJfKbWfqIlOulK8O6KVGfA.text: Want a burger in vegas? Like looking at boobies? Fugetabodit !!!!  This is literally the only place I'll eat lamb burgers, but everything is A1 top freekin' notch. Your girlfriend/wife gotta have a sense of humor though as the staff is tastefully, scantily clad. Wandering eyes are inevitable. I went three times last week during a convention I had to attend for work, and it was well worth it every time. I'm a picky eater when it comes to burgers, and everything they do is excellent, right down to the bloody marys. In addition to being gorgeous, Karli is quick and polite. She was working the bar every time I came in, thank god. In layman's terms, she is the shit. Tons of big screens throughout if you want to watch a game, and great happy hour specials, including beer buckets. a lot of really comfortable booths that provide more than adequate privacy, should you so desire.   I don't know what they do to the lamb, but the flavor is a lot better than anywhere else I've ever had one. Melt in your mouth goodness, consistently. The steak fries are perfect as well.   Cheers

2r-uNjmSDFnPI11p3qNFgg.text: Came here for lunch while I stayed at Bally's.  Ordered the basic burger but decided to specialize with my own toppings because I didn't see any special burgers that jumped out at me.  Carmelized onions with avocado were my toppings of choice with the tomato bun.  The burger was the bomb!!  I downed it pretty quick.  Well worth the $14 buck I paid for it.  The string fries were great also.  Would come back next time I'm in Vegas.

NYIKZu2CwbmSPHrJyDBmVQ.text: The food is really great for the price. Portions aren't crazy big, but just right. I've been here a few times and every time everything we have ordered was just right. Consistency is so important when I eat somewhere. I always want to know that whatever I'm getting is going to be just as good as the last time. And this place always delivers. The service is good too. Everyone is always really nice and accommodating but not overbearing. The only thing about this place I wish for is more liveliness. It's quiet and its a sports bar/restaurant. It really needs a better location. It's stuck back in a quiet corner of Paris and there isn't enough foot traffic to really fill the place. When I go to a sports bar/restaurant, I like at least a little excitement. Needless to say, there's always a table and service is quick.

jtR6U7JeJXYH2HbwPp4b9Q.text: I had the lamb burger, it was very juicy! But I didn't think it was anything spectacular. I sat at the bar (side bar: when I walked up to the hostess and said it was for one, she asked if I wanted to sit at the bar instead. At the time I did want to sit at the bar, so I take no offense, but solo diners want to sit at tables too!), and the bartender/waitress wasn't the friendliest person ever, but I survived. I'd probably much rather go to BLT at Mirage, or In-N-Out instead.   Also, there was an older (40-50 ish) woman there, who clearly must have kids, because she apologized after every curse word she loudly yelled at the football game on the giant screen.

-tGFIvLADVvgGwEnKnXT6w.text: This place, located closer to Bally's than to Paris, has pretty good burgers. I opted for the Le Bleu (I like bacon and avocado, but asked for it without the namesake cheese) and found it to be very flavorful on the onion bun. At $12 without any side (all sides are a la carte) it was a tad bit pricey but not too bad for Vegas and the ordered toppings were not skimped on, with my burger being topped by a full half of an avocado and three medium thickness cut (the good stuff!) flavorful bacon.  My buddy who was with me had the Salmon burger and said it was pretty good, but complained about the fact we did not go to the buffet, I reminded him the line was nearly an hour long and that changed that.   The servers, though scantily clad, are efficient and courteous. The kitchen seemed to be a little slow, taking about twenty minutes to prepare our food (cooked medium...but slightly overcooked) despite the eatery being pretty empty.  The beer selection is not outrageously priced but nor is it too great of a beer list and the lack of a line was nice. There are televisions throughout the establishment which makes me believe it may get pretty busy during large sporting events with people drinking Miller Lite, of which ads are plastered all over the place.  If you want lunch and don't want to wait in a line to be able to sit down this is a good option to consider, though I still much prefer Houston's California Burger and just about anything at the Counter to this place, this has nudged in to the top five of best burgers i've had...and I've had hundreds.

Bn-oAjgIVeAHFmfkaXIDww.text: I love this place so much I visited it twice the weekend I discovered it and I've been back various times during different trips!  I like the layout of the restaurant and the decor. I like the music they play and the fact that you could watch sports. Even though I like the outfits the staff wears, call me crazy, but the little shorts the females wear could be a tad less short since personally I don't like being eye level with their cellulite thighs and buttcheeks while I'm having a meal. Once again, maybe if I were an "assman" this would have been a non-issue.   The bib lettuce, Gruyere and apple salad is DELICIOUS. It has the most fantastic mustard dressing. A stand out burger for me was the one with caramelized onions, bacon and brie on a caramelized onion bun. I like that you get to build your own burger if you wish and that you have multiple types of buns, toppings and sauces to choose from. My favorite burger here has been the lamb burger! I have also tried the fries, buffalo wings and banana bignets. All top-notch. This is an all around solid establishment!

sFO5hfE1U9ho2WU7G_x7zQ.text: What brought me here? A $5 coupon I received upon check in...food was so good, I forgot to use my coupon! What we ordered: pommes frites au bleu-bleu cheese fries (fries with bleu and brie cheeses, bacon and avocado OMG),  croquet monsieur-ham and cheese dippers (ham and cheese grilled with cheese and tomatoes sauce for dipping) and l'agneau lamb (lamb burger).  This will be a must on my Vegas trips from now on!

O2WQSdVcHH8iEh6D22H5SQ.text: Decided to try it out when I received a BOGO text message offer during my stay in Vegas.  I thought it would be a good deal and I would be able to try out their burgers . . . .  I was wrong!   The offer was limited to the Les Entrees section which was a choice of filet mignon-open faced filet sandwich, supreme de poulet-chicken breast cordon bleu sandwich, steak et fromage-french dip cheesesteak, or the steak frites new york steak.  We decided to have supreme de poulet-chicken breast cordon bleu sandwich and steak et fromage-french dip cheesesteak.  The food was good nothing to rave about but I would have preferred to try the hamburgers; however, my husband suggested we stick to the "deal" we had gone in for since it was a bit pricey.  Rather than leave we decided to stay; food was good, service was quick & employees were attentive, clean restaurant, with lots of TVs.  I did not like the waffle fries, a bit too dry and not much taste.  Would I come back and actually try a burger? ummm..... not sure

2rGpJlrpEGAY_Ti94pZnBw.text: Service was absolutely horrible - waitress extremely rude!  Burger looked nothing like the "special" advertisement posted outside.

cxDYbS2zzU8Gg5-yHcmIHg.text: youtube.com/watch?v=PQkR... Taste is not bad. We ordered Beef burger with sweet potato fries and potato skin. Rating (10 max) Taste: 8 Environment: 7 Service: 7

1M08VzautoE2HDwERlIJyg.text: Umm - we had a quite poor experience here recently. We came in and sat at the bar around 9:40 pm (somehow there wasn't a hostess around to direct us) and the bartender realized we had no clue what was going on so he asked if we wanted some drinks. We asked for cocktail menus as well as food menus and he informed us the kitchen closes at 10pm. We looked through the menus and gave him our drink and food selections and he ensured us he got all the orders in before the kitchen closed. Lets fast forward an hour. The food still hasn't come and now it's around 9:50pm and we ask about our food order. He says "oh, the servers didn't bring you your food?" Umm no. He goes off and says something about it bring their fault and he'll check with the kitchen. He comes back in 2 minutes with a salad that we ordered and said it would be in him. Ok things were looking a little better. We didn't receive the combo appetizer we ordered but hey, at least now we could finally get some food in our stomachs.   Fast forward another round of drinks and we ask for our check - happy hour drink specials are annotated on the check. But so was the salad. What happened to "the salad will be on me?" Then he asks us if we're in Vegas the next day because if we come back, dinner is on him. Ummm if tonight's salad wasn't on you even though you already said it would be, what makes me believe tomorrow night's dinner is going to be on you?   I didn't come to Vegas to be swindled out of money by the bartender - on the casino floors maybe - but definitely not here.   I hope this was just an outlier experience - but I won't be coming back to see if that's the case during this trip.

g55rCUIoSFg3eBkp6H3sFA.text: Gag!   Maggie T. Was so right, this place is awful. The only thing that was digestible was the beer and fries. Ordered a burger that came out COATED in salt. You could actually hear the salt crunch on the first bite. Sent it back immediately after confirming my assessment with the rest of the table. I traded the salt patty for a salad that was equally inedible. No one could finish their meal. Who ever runs this place needs to be sent back to the three dollar burger joint they came from.   Wouldn't be surprised to see customers falling out of their chairs when the sodium content in their blood shoots higher that the Stratosphere.  Seriously never had a worse burger.

wsIRiELd6AnLmkvaBteBLQ.text: The burgers here are subpar and when you factor in the price, the quality just doesn't match the cost.  I had a chicken burger and it was not memorable at all. Kind of bland is the first thought that comes to mind.  For around $20 a pop, I would expect a much tastier gourmet burger here. I'd avoid this place if at all possible.

7H1GBLpPLXvNA_e7oXHGFw.text: Stopped in here for lunch and sat at the bar. I'm not into sports one bit, but if I was, i'm sure I would have enjoyed the gigantic screen at the bar with some football game on, and the dozens of other flat screens throughout the restaurant with various other sports events playing.  But, I was just here for food and drinks. BF had a beer, I had two Malibu & Coke's. They were nice and strong. The bartenders helping us were friendly and attentive.  For lunch we split a Steak et Fromage sandwich. It was a Philly Cheesesteak with roasted red peppers, mushrooms and shallots, and served with au jus sauce. The best of both worlds, I love cheesesteak and I love French Dip.   The sandwich was really good, and quite large, it was a perfect size for both of us to finish without still feeling hungry. And, it was only $14.99 - cheap lunch for two :)  Since we sat at the bar, we didn't get the full menu, but everything on the bar menu seemed good. If you happen to be staying at Paris, or just wandering around as we were, this is a good, reasonably priced place to have lunch.

sqI5ui87XX5fNTU4sydN9g.text: I've been here before and the burgers are the real deal, but last night, I wasn't in the mood for a burger so I had a grilled chicken Caesar salad which was excellent!  However, it was an ordeal to get it.  I sat at the bar and the bartender (who is well known) was just grumpy and inefficient.   He didn't come by our part of the bar for over 20 minutes at one point and everyone was waiting to pay, to order or something.  He has a shtick that he peddles and some people buy it, but you know, I just want to order a drink and a salad.    It shouldn't take 20 minutes and I shouldn't have to listen to how awful people are or how stupid the POS system is.   Listening to other people complain isn't something I like to do.  And when I'm paying for the privilege, I like it even less.  If you can get a hostess to acknowledge you, get a table rather than sit at the bar.

H3ZhtlUW36jnKmXawcBitQ.text: My family and I came here for dinner. The place was not super packed, which was good for us. Definitely, a good place to enjoy a good sports game with flat screen surrounding the entire restaurant. Be prepared to answer a trivia question about sports. If you get the answer right, 10% will be taken off of your bill. I ordered a California Chicken Burger for my entree. I was very happy to receive my burger. When I took my first bite, my taste buds wanted more. Service was great. Only issue was the cheese and avocado sliding off my burger. Next time I will get some of the mini burgers that I saw circulating across the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California Chicken Burger, Burger Brasserie, Paris Las Vegas

97vO-cH0YjXFIypOhCCUAQ.text: What is wrong with me? I decide to eat at a BURGER restaurant and what do I order? A chicken burger. A boring, bland patty of nothingness that tasted no better than something out of my local grocer's freezer aisle. I don't know what possessed me.   They've got a burger for $777 here. I asked the waitress if she's sick of everyone asking about it and she certainly was. It's a ridiculous, pretentious waste of money; something they stuck on the menu to give this spot a bit of notoriety. According to her, they've sold only a couple. Most of that cost comes from the Dom Perignon that accompanies the burger.   Happy hour rules here, though. Two-for-one drinks are the best kind of special. I spent more time drinking than I did eating any of the food they brought out.

tHBj_eoFYIJxtMOWqLRgxA.text: I dined here this weekend and unfortunately I was disappointed mostly by the service that we got by a lady named Christina. She didn't check up on us often nor did she explain the menu throughly. The food wasn't all that great either, not at all. I'd rather go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hUJ-tpabgWdwJG9YT3wqKA.text: The food was good, but the service is so sub par it ruins the dining experience.  We ordered the pretzels, chicken noodle soup, and some sliders.  The soup came out nice and fast and I was told it was very tasty.  After that our sliders came out wrong.  After 45 minutes the sliders finally came back out.  I got a quick "sorry" about the incorrect order initially and then nobody came back to check on us after the fact.  We were there for happy hour as well and were never offered a second drink.  We had to flag someone down.  I'm sorry, but if I am sitting at the bar I don't think it is so hard for the bartender to stop chatting it up with their co-workers and ask if we needed anything, at anytime throughout our meal.  Overall it was a disappointing experience.   With all the good food there is in Vegas this is not somewhere I will be back.  Save your money and your time and go elsewhere where your business and tip are appreciated.

1M1wIUbRWi1WNS3v6XxdfQ.text: The burgers were pretty good. Little over priced for sides. We had excellent service and no waiting. We came later at night. I would recommend this place for a quiet burger and beer with lots of tvs for your viewing. Ask for Nicole if she is working , friendly and on top of things. I'd rate the overall restaurant a 8 out of 10.

jvgbzMOmteDBadgMbe6uQw.text: I've been to LE BURGER BRASSERIE a few times since I stay at the Paris often for work. The burgers are decent, they've got sports on several TVs, and a decent list of craft brews at ok prices for Vegas standards.  The service is rather shaky. Last time there was good and bad. Horrid horrid service, the broad got three of our four beer orders wrong. She lost our credit card for a short while. But she was hot... And I was happy to find a super bomb menu item, the Hot Dog Sliders! Mini dogs on pretzel buns, with bacon, spicy mustard and onion strings... BOMB!!!   I'll continue to hit up Le BB out of convenience and having above average food. 3.5 stars.

wb7D3qxJ8Eg41l9TxQkRnA.text: Burger was great.  The French dip was also very nice.  The service was very attentive.  Love how you can get a beer to go!

pbf0p4F9AYE4SJKneejyEg.text: we were staying at bellagio and wanted to venture out to eat but still an easy walk, so paris it was. burgers sounded good so we gave them a try.  i ordered a build-your-own burger and my hubby ordered a windy dog. our waitress was really friendly and kept checking up on us. the waiting took a bit long for a food, about 40 minutes! we didn't complain or anything but our waitress apologized a couple times for the wait. (i think the wait was for the relish on the dog, which is always fresh).  food finally came and it was good, but the best part? our meal ended up being discounted for the long wait. this place get a star solely on great customer service. i would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. windy dog.

xna8a2BN1WWDi_jwT5lfPw.text: one one the best burgers top  five I would say juicy and full of flavor noting was over powers by another  the pretzel was sooo good super hot out of the oven crunchy and chewy at the same time and the dipping cheese sauce the so yummy and the stone ground mustard was grate too now the server was wonderful being a city of service she was at the top very attentive was always on top of everything over all was a grate exspence

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paris burger

3pIcYwQNXezpvQOwqoNNmQ.text: 4 for service 2 for food.  Came on a Monday night with a groupon and my total rewards card.  If you have the card, you pay the 1.00 cheaper price for each option.    Wasn't in the mood for a veggie burger( don't eat beef) and my girl didn't want to split the chicken burger so we ordered some apps and a salad.   Soft and crisp pretzels with a beer cheese sauce and a beer mustard tator tots with cheese, speck, green onions hot dog sliders chicken cesar salad.  Pretzels 9.00  The pretzels were really disappointing.  They were not soft pretzels, they were pretzel BUNS.  The same freaking buns that the hot dogs sliders were served on.  Oh, I can't forget the 2 pretzel rods that were on the plate( the crisp selection).  Very expensive for a some pretzel rolls and 2 pretzel rods.  The cheese sauce and mustard were very boozy( good if you like beer).  We took the rods with us, tried to eat them the next day by the pool and they were staler than shit.   Tots 9.00 These weren't so much tots as they were leftover mashed potatoes, zushed up with cheese, ham, and green onions. Then, mold them into a large tater tot shape and throw them in the deep fryer.  Did not like these at all.  Salad  Lots of chicken, not that much cheese, croutons, dressing.  Basic, 14.00  Hot dog sliders  Smallish dogs, wrapped in bacon, thrown on a pretzel roll that was slathered in margarine, topped with small fried onions.  I didn't eat these( don't eat beef), my wife said they "ok"  Maybe we should have gotten a burger?  We might have fared better.  They were running a special, a make your own burger, fries or rings and a soda for 25.00.  They only carry pepsi products so that didn't sound good to us.     We had a groupon, 20 for 40.00.  We spent 1 extra dollar, plus tax and a generous tip since service was really good.    That's about all I can say for this place.  I enjoyed my 6.49 cents sandwich from Earl of Sandwich last night a lot better than this meal.

QE9GMSY0ozl9TQTSNdPWiQ.text: I had the Saveur Lamb Burger - - it was average at best and didn't appear to be fresh.  The Peanut Butter and Chocolate milkshake was small and not visually appealing, but tasted great.  Waitress, Olivia, had a very friendly personality and was very prompt and professional.  Based on other reviews, maybe I was there on a bad day.  I was looking forward to having a great burger experience, but left with just an average one.

BnkzcGk93NgOkJwpfeDRbQ.text: Came here for dinner and left disappointed. It was a 15 minute wait to be seated which didn't bother me, but there were plenty of open tables and booths. We ended up being seated right near the entrance in front of the window. After asking to be moved to one of the other open tables we were told it would be a longer wait. WTH??? Our server was great, but running around taking care of too many tables at once, so I guess they were short staffed.   I ordered the "Chopped Salad" priced at $13 and it had chopped romaine and iceberg lettuce, salami, cheese, tomatoes, avocados, cucumbers, celery and croutons. I asked that the red bell pepper and Italian dressing be left out. I wanted just extra blue cheese dressing, but my salad was tossed in the Italian dressing anyway and still had blue cheese dressing on it. I don't have an issue with the cost if the salad since it was a nice portion and had a lot of yummy sounding things in it, but all I tasted was a big pile of chunky bitter blue cheese, celery and really gross Italian dressing. Hubby had an overpriced $22 burger combo and said the burger tased frozen. The peanut butter shake he got I shared with him and that was actually good. I would just skip this place and go down the street to Tacos El Gordo!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Chopped Salad&#34; @ Le Burger Brasserie Sports Grille - 10/25/13

cJF-jKRKmSz0nUOIs7gbig.text: Burger Brasserie is just one of the restaurants at Paris. It sold me with their claim of gourmet burgers and the pictures! They did not disappoint! They had a variety of burgers to choose from or you could create your own. Which I did. I had a kobe beef burger (a $5 upcharge) with brie, gruyere, mozzarella, grilled onions, mushrooms, and a garlic aoli on an artisian bun with Cheetos dusted fries. C'est Magnifique! The burger was medium and juicy and the cheese was melty and spectacular. I was a little underwhelmed by the fries, I expected more from the Cheetos dust. But it was a great experience and next time I hope to try another restaurant at Paris.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My custom brie,gruyere,mozarella burger with grilled onions, mushrooms and cheetos dusted fries
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $777 dollar burger!!!!
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In paris!

x_EWfB6md00ULJ8WauEZcA.text: This place has amazing food. The GRAVY FRIES are the best I've had. Go during happy hour and sit in the bar for the best prices.

yv7dhSNO5ZN156UedCARGg.text: I visited "Burger Brasserie" Labor Day weekend 2017. I was touring the Strip. By the time I began walking the Bally's property, I realized I was hungry--the type of hungry where I wouldn't distinguish between a $20 meal, versus a $40+ meal.   I stumbled upon this restaurant--attracted to a posted "special $19.95 combo": your choice of their standard hamburger or cheeseburger; your choice of fries or onion rings; and a pint of draft beer. I stepped in, curious to see what I might receive.   The restaurant's complete menu, with pricing, is posted on their website. The bottom line is that regardless of the special pricing, the taste, texture and flavor of the cheeseburger and fries was great. The portions were good enough to satisfy my hunger, without leaving me uncomfortably "stuffed".  The staff provided great service. And as I was dining alone at the bar, my bartender/server was a great host-conversationalist in between fulfilling bar orders.  Here's my bottom line: There seems to be a trend in Las Vegas to have burger restaurants affiliated with celebrity chefs. You'll pay a premium for that dining experience--but I don't think you'll necessarily get a better meal, or get better service.

RJFOEu8Sm8fYxWd6WAvM1g.text: Came here for lunch, always seems like a line.  Tables are tight and a little noisy.  The burgers are good but come a la carte.  A little on the expensive side.

co6ghOkBNRGjeDoIu-7Ktg.text: I have seen this place when heading to Ballys from Paris and had it in mind to try for a while. We were enjoying a staycation at Paris and decided to have dinner here. The hostess said it was a 45 minute wait for a booth and a 15 minute wait for a table. There were plenty of open tables and booths so I don't know what the deal was. We waited patiently and after 15 minutes we were seated at a small table right where you walk in. I asked if we could sit at one of the other open spots and was told it would be a wait. I am assuming thet just didn't have enough staff or something.   Our server was great and checked on us often. The $4 charge for a pepsi was a rip though. I ordered a combo meal for $22 that got me any burger, fries, and shake. I chose the Le Paris Burger and it had brie cheese, caramelized onion and applewood smoked bacon. The burger didn't have much flavor and disappointingly seemed to be a frozen patty but the brie cheese and bacon were good. My waffle fries would have been better if they didn't come out cold. My peanut butter shake was the best part of the meal and 5 stars alone. The service and shake were good but for a place with "burger" in their name.....the burger should have been more of the star than the bacon that came on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut butter shake
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of menu
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yeT1EwEXkDlyqdKJ-xbYBQ.text: The meat was perfect...probably the best I have ever eaten. The bun was tasteless but still did not ruin the whole experience. Comments on my end, their house sauce was nothing to remember and their burgers don't come with fries...who should I tell it to and he wont believe me:)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can anyone guess what is missing???

9AemsnaJQR8uhFoeTfwBeg.text: Second time I've tried this place. Still terrible service, slow kitchen, and average food.   So many better choices in Vegas for burgers, brasserie, or just above average service.

b4DhrKPvXbiFD3iyfb78Kw.text: We went here for dinner before a show last night. The food was excellent as was the service. Our waiter was kind and funny.  Two of us had burgers, Champagne turkey burger and a California chicken burger but made with a beef patty. I had a grilled chicken salad.   The drinks were excellent! We had 'Dam' Mules and a margarita.   I will definitely go back, there's so much more I want to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California chicken burger made with a beef patty
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken salad
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champagne turkey burger

3o-gtYMKtxjQ1Pgexsww7Q.text: On a recent trip to Vegas I stumbled across the Burger Brasserie while exploring the Las Vegas strip and the neighboring shops.  As I walked in the place was fairly empty and when I asked for a table was told there would be a short wait.  After about 10 minutes I was called to the front and taken to a seat at the bar.  I explained to the hostess that I would prefer a table even the small two seater and they reluctantly sat me at a small table nearby next to the bar.  My gut was telling me after this to leave but I was extremely hungry and the menu looked appealing so I hesitantly took the seat at the bar.  My server Christina was friendly enough to begin and took my drink order quickly.  It then took about 10 minutes to get my Pepsi and have my order taken.  I placed an order for the Cilantro Lime Chicken Skewers and they took about 20 minutes to come out from the kitchen.  When my food arrived my drink was near empty but was not offered a refill by the server and instead the bartender (I didn't get his name) saw it and asked what I was drinking and quickly brought me another.    My server walked by my table about a dozen times or more but never stopped to see how anything was or ask if I needed anything further.  I was not offered any additional items and even had to track down another server to ask for my bill so I could pay and go.  I was at the table for well over an hour for a single Pepsi and skewers (which had decent flavor but lacked anything to put it over the top).    The pricing was quite reasonable for the food but the flavors were a bit lacking and the service from Christina was as poor as can be for me.  I did notice her larger parties got plenty of attention and service but me being alone seemed to put me in a lower class for service.  I normally tip very well but I was so fed up with this place and the wait that I simply left a $20 on the table and made my way out of the place.  I actually was looking at getting an additional dessert item but was never offered and didn't feel they deserved my business.  Overall the service was a 2 star (the 2nd being the bartender stepping up big time for refills and making sure I was okay when he saw that I was getting frustrated) and the food was actually quite good.  The place may look nice but when you get treated as a second class citizen because you aren't part of a larger party is a bit concerning and I probably would not return in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Lime Skewers
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MQ88O4MJCeHWrml6LtYFgw.text: Nice place to bring the family good food and friendly staff definitely recommend to anyone.

CXbyXg7nLOIfnA__rJdv_g.text: Came here for lunch on a recommendation; and it was wonderful.  From the greeting by the general manager, to our waiter, Kevin, the service was outstanding (very friendly, prompt and attentive).  We split the grilled chicken salad and it was fresh, well dresssed and flavorful with the goat cheese, dried cherries and candied walnuts.  My wife had a Paris burger that was well cooked, juicy and flavorful.  I had the French dip on Kevin's recommendation and it did not disappoint.  The cheese was unobtrusive and the dip was a perfect compliment when soaking the French bread.  Some dips can be too salty, but not this one.  It was perfect.  We split the Almond joy desert and it was just the right size for us.  Very light with good consistency and multiple chocolate tastes.  All in all, one of the best burger places I've found in Vegas.

tpTzGvwZB3C_2xpthLxBUg.text: Put this down as must on your list in Vegas.  $20 for a burger, beer and fries- definitely worth it for Vegas. They are located between Balley's  and Paris in the middle section that connects them and is right before you enter Balley's.  Burger was super moist and tender.  There are a ton of TV's for watching sports and very friendly staff.  I will definitely return on my next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MNiIc62X464K_hMuK_jEPQ.text: After a late check in and some room changes at Bally's. We were not only tired but very hungry. The woman at registration suggested Burger Brassiere. My husband prime rib sliders. They were juicy and delicious according to him and I had a generous and yummy, chicken ceasar salad. Joe, our waiter was courteous, friendly and accommodating. We will be back .

bTlj_KogdiiO2o_ryOp6AA.text: Pros: Yummy Kobe burger ( build your own ). I asked for it to be cooked medium rare and it was cooked perfectly! The buns!!! Not sure what they or how they were made but it was delicious!  Cons: Long wait time to be seated, food came out after 25 minutes after waiting for a server to take my order ( waited for a about 10 minutes).

YA1KQnrYSAytJ6k4l0dAMg.text: Wonderful burger and atmosphere. Conveniently located between Paris and Bally's. Great burgers!

8a9lZT14OS7c8vN8ZQY2LA.text: We visited Burger Brasserie on Friday, November 30th at about 11:30am for lunch.  The place was not very busy that early on; however, we were seated promptly and professionally.  Our server came by soon after we were seated, and she was very nice throughout our entire service.  The manager even stopped by to see how everything was going.  We each ordered a burger and shared a half of each one. We had the regular cheeseburger and a limited time special (I think it was the spicy nacho cheeseburger).   The regular cheeseburger was delicious and cooked to perfection.  The pickles balanced the sandwich out in a very pleasant way.     I love spicy food, and therefore enjoyed the spice on the other burger; however, I think that the spice may actually take away from the delicious flavor of the burger on this selection.  Either way, overall a very good experience.  I would return again.

aJ7U-a4XnEII2hrI-JJQig.text: Great happy hour 2 for 1 drinks...great value and drinks that actually have alcohol in them. Big screen TV for sports and Fantastic and friendly bartenders ..see you next week.

bNWDcLPIVjar49SYsd-jXQ.text: I went this place with my friend who is owner of Korean restaurant in Nashville. He said that oysters were very fresh and other sushi taste were so good. Of course, I enjoyed new style of sushi and rolls.  I can't wait to go there again. I mean so soon.

DYjeCZiwf-xwuJMUVY1XyA.text: Not the best meal.  Definitely edible.  The chicken burger is ground and instead of fried onion rings they add Funyuns.  Also stay away from the chili.

Mq0ASsCOtC_pqgzIg8NEEg.text: Came in for lunch . Tables open but had to wait 20 mins, under staffed. I ordered the build your burger. It was cooked medium as requested. The onion ring sides were great. Fries were shoestring and tasty. Service was pretty good once we sat down.

O05Z5dhCUyYkOXX9f-OElA.text: Our biggest mistake..I guess was not ordering a burger. My chili was not good at all. My daughters Ceasar salad had hardly any dressing and the chicken tasted like it was from a package. My nieces chicken sandwich was not tasty. However, the onion rings and Captain Crunch shake were good.  The service was lacking. I would never eat there again.

hdKgUiFSB1rYrd39FaptxQ.text: Wow great food here Chelsea was are waiter she is awesome ... the in side very nice clean food came fast this is a for sure place to get a great bit to eat I had and I Calion burger and wife had chicken burger and a the 9 green and sweet potato Fry's  all was great thanks Ed  Was still good food

o0l2_4Mv6_zF4ckOLLf0hg.text: With hamburgers the primary attraction youre immediately drawn to the hlossy menu pictures; unless, your waiter is Alex.  After you ask open questions and make your selection, Alex will ask you if you are open to a suggestion? If you are willing and smarter than the 'know all things' customers then Alex will guide you to a better option... mine cost less but I fixed that with a better gratuity.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Servers Alex and Genevieve you can&#39;t wrong with Alex.  He will steer you right.  Trust me.

fYAQ1SYEDX6PgYwh5TmIOQ.text: Sat at the bar for a late dinner. The bartender, while surly, took my order and kept my drink filled through the evening. I had a DIY burger and when it came out, I had no idea how to eat it. It was HUGE. I ended up knife and forking it, and even then I could only eat half! The burger was cooked to a perfect medium and they don't skimp on the toppings. There was a whole avocado and least 4 pieces of crispy bacon. The fries are big enough to share and came out piping hot and crispy. They're served with a slightly spicy, smoky ketchup. Last but not least, if you have any room leftover get the Cap'N Crunch milk shake. It is delicious.

0p53dCZw6kGfFIypHjj14w.text: Just a little wait which wasn't bad. Literally just walked out of this place and couldn't wait to leave feedback. Michelle was our server and she had an attitude problem the entire time. Never asked us how our food was, or how we were doing. We waited roughly 6 minutes to get drinks before she came to our table. In the meantime, two other people walked out because they were not served in time. Appetizers took roughly 20 minutes to come out! Although they did come out hot and were pretty good, this was a little long for wings. Entrees came out two minutes after our appetizer arrived. Hamburgers were ordered medium well and were beyond well-done. Will not eat here again.

FG9rQbBP8Sehk5MNsl5QpA.text: This place is amazing!!! We ordered the Paris burger cooked medium, it was juicy and not too cooked not too bloody, and the bbq chicken burger was incredible as well , when I first took a bite I thought it was beef lol  Will return, DAYLAN at the bar was amazing!!! Great service !!!!! Such a sweet guy and wonderful at his job

k5JF5QDHTqvS2VooruPM4g.text: We needed to grab a quick bite and stopped by in between events at a conference.  I had the pulled pork and my companion had the blt sandwich, we also shared fries. The pulled pork was cafeteria quality.  It was kind of bland, the bun got soggy and the pickles they serve are way too sweet.  My companion thought his sandwich was blah.   The worst part was the service. The waiter was so hyper he made us uncomfortable. He was yelling everything and running around.  It was a strange experience. Plus he never came back to check on us. That's the worst as far as I'm concerned and will affect the tip.

zCTlKR3ViOkClP83qsqvcA.text: This place is right in the middle of Bally's and Paris. We had just flown in and we were all starving and being here for 2 21st birthdays we were also wanted some DRINKS!!!!!   We started out with the fried cheese, and no not just your normal Mozzarella..... 2 pieces of fried Mozzarella, 2 pieces of fried American cheese, AND 2 pieces of fried Pepperjack cheese. And it was SOOOOO GOOD!!!!!!! The American and Pepperjack were different, the only thing I would request is to either make the pieces a little larger or add a few more pieces of cheese, because for the price they charge I don't think the portion is equal to the price.   We all had a few beers and ordered burgers. Their burgers are served on homemade buns with different flavors baked in including: Caramelized Onion, Parmesan, Wheat, and a few others that I know I am forgetting.   I got a burger cooked medium-rare with Cheddar cheese, Caramelized Onions, and Bacon on a Caramelized onion bun. It was cooked perfectly, seasoned well, and tasted absolutely phenomenal. My friend got the Kobe Beef Burger and was actually a little disappointed. It was overcooked and really not the way a Kobe Beef Burger should taste. We also got an order of Pommes Frites for the 4 of us to share. The fries were not too fabulous but they were good.  All in all awesome food. great drinks, good service!!!

sk_OljI8-ngMGwPEt4AHVw.text: Their hamburger and cheesecake are not very impressive ~ but i like their appertizer chicken wing!

RVVAJv6bVUEFut427EGb7Q.text: Amazing burger and fries with brisket!!  Awesome food and terrific Super Bowl buffet!  Thanks to my waitress Angela I always had a frosty beer at hand!

e46EqIV0c-Rl7Op4x5nJig.text: Yum!  Le Burger has great quality appetizers, burgers, salads, sides, and desserts that are relatively reasonably priced considering it being a tourist spot. They had vegetarian options and a great variety of toppings available.  The bread is freshly baked and available in a variety of flavors. The ambiance was very lovely despite it doubling as a sports bar.

h1_3nrhAQpe1ROGykWxy1A.text: Loved it! Tucked into a mall in the Paris hotel, this restaurant slash sports bar is a Gem. Fabulous meal, great cocktail and fun company while sitting at the bar made this a stop worth repeating. I had the Paris burger and was eyeballing my neighbors Arugula Beet Salad (which I tried.....delish!). Yum.

cQ-anlvHZSjneHA6_XZ3xg.text: Came here with a Groupon because I would not come to the Paris otherwise. Never had a good experience here and this place lives up to my expectations.  The service was terrible and the place smelled like vomit. Not worth coming here even with a Groupon.

Iild1L440Rv_qYGTXVEhew.text: Review is for the Happy Hour.  We were walking by and saw the happy hour sign. $3 Skyy cocktails...why yes thank you, I'll take 12! We sat at the bar, watched some football, talked to some cool people, and drank alot of $3 Skyy cocktails. While Skyy is not my usual vodka of choice, the $3 cocktails were cheap and strong...a great combination for a night in Vegas. The bartender was awesome and kept those cheap strong drinks flowing. This is a great spot to watch a game.

SPqYjz0KwW2sYDdscliARw.text: Great hamburger! My husband ordered the combo and was a great deal with a shake, fries and fancy hamburger for $20. I got a simple burger for $12 but shared his fries and shake. The food was really good and the service was excellent. The pricing isn't outrageous for Vegas and the vibe is comfortable but upscale.

votoNpSrrTCXyaYZUn-IpA.text: Excellent food and service, I had the lamb burger and loved it..Best burger I've ever had in Vegas. I will be back on my next trip.

X7nwZ63iWOOqL-xv_drPKQ.text: 3 people. The bill was about $75 bucks. We were never asked about refills. My medium well burger was dry. Not worth the bucks.

CYpcO3muhGh_SjppWInESQ.text: Yes I know! Who goes to a burger place and order salad? Well I do and quite often I get disappointed. Salad is not difficult to make it but it's often under or over dressed to my taste! This place has great salads for the "fit food" enthusiasts!!

RpogiBW-XpbwONpXZYP4dg.text: First off, I only review burgers.  Heard from my friend Yohan that this place had a pretty dang good burger so I went to verify with my non-burger loving mother again.  She ended up getting a salad this time and seemed to enjoy it.  My burger was pretty plain.  No frills.  That being said, the patty was seasoned enough so that it didn't need a lot of help in the condiments department.  That being said, while it was good, I don't think I would crave it unless I already happened to be in the Paris hotel and casino.  WHAT I ORDERED:   Le POULET (salad) - 3/5 pretty tasty, but nothing spectacular  Le CLASSIQUE (burger) - 3/5 solid patty, adding a special sauce might push it to 4/5  Sweet Potato Fries - 4/5 how can you go wrong with these?  STAFF: Exceptional.  Our waitress was attentive and genuinely sweet.  WAIT TIME: No wait time Saturday around 6:30pm  PORTION:  Hearty sized burger.  BANG FOR YOUR BUCK  The portions and quality of burger match the price well.  WOULD I RETURN  Probably not

EKrtu3bZf6wGg1xQizslEQ.text: We were hoping to eat at elsewhere in Paris, but a Saturday around noon is a bad time to go out and eat... We walked passed the line of a hundred people for the buffet, and came across Le Burger Brasserie, which we had tried before and liked. There was no wait (woohoo!), so we chose to dine here.   The environment is cool here because they have like 40,000 TVs with various college football games playing (Saturdays, obviously), so when your group is quiet from being hung over, there is still lots of entertainment.   The burgers generally are pretty good. Le Paris, the burger my BF & I both ordered, was really undercooked, and my BFs was overcooked, so we switched patties to save time. (That True love right there.)   The fries are intense. We had a party of four, so we got all three choices to share, and that was WAY too many fries for us. We ate maybe half. I'd stick with just the waffle fries and skinny fries next time.   Our service was sporadic, and it took a while to get the check.   It's nothing life-changing, but it's a good choice for when you need some food to feed that hangover, and the line for the buffet almost ends in front of this restaurant. I'd come back.

npisnfKcyktbDFapUYUxDw.text: This place is amazing! The lamb burger with mushrooms was absolutely  delicious! The "pomme frites" a.k.a. fries were fresh, crunchy, and perfect.   Since it is hard to find a delicious place for a good price, I would have given this 5-stars. Because the waitress took 5-10 minutes to come to us  after being flagged down (none busy hours), I rate this place 4-stars.

re8tRveXgLq1IYvghjgb1w.text: This gem of a burger lounge is located in the Paris Las Vegas resort. They offer a wide assortment of gourmet burger options, so we tried the the Paris burger with Brie and the French onion burger. Both were delicious.,The sweet potato fries with their special mustard seed ketchup were a great accompaniment. The offer a full bar, and multiple big screens to stay on top of the big game.

MjPGzMas9rIEO5O918SgJA.text: This may be a sports bar but the ambience is much warmer. Food excellent and service friendly and very efficient. Would go back in a heartbeat!

mpWThiYmmfO6MXjlgH87pQ.text: When we were sat at the half booth, the floor under our table was littered with food, and our booth was a combination of wet and sticky (from being quickly wiped down, but not done properly). We ordered a couple of draft beers and two burgers, with two fries and a side of gravy. Our beer was flat, the burgers were okay, and we only received one order of fries (no gravy).  We called over another server (Was ours on break?  We didn't see her for most of our meal) and said that we needed cutlery and another order of fries (and our gravy).  We were told that she would let our server know.  I guess she never did. My husband had to walk around the restaurant and take cutlery off of other tables.  We decided to just eat our food and forgo the other order of fries, and the gravy. Towards the end of our meal, the manager walked by us and gave us a thumbs up from across the restaurant.  I guess this was his way of checking in?  We quickly payed our bill and left as soon as possible.  Upon checking the receipt afterwards, we noticed that we were not granted our total rewards points. We will not be back.  There are many other places to have a good burger in Vegas...do not waste your time here.

3TYf4yiNgQbO9LORb03xgg.text: Great atmosphere, televisions everywhere.  Service was great.  One of the best burgers I have ever had.  I had the bacon guacamole burger, it was awesome!  I am a huge fan if guacamole on burgers, it just adds another dimension of flavor to the burger, and then add the bacon...        W O W!  Can't wait to take my next trip to Las Vegas because I will definitely go there to eat again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SUjcnWp-r7py0jjNiTEu4w.text: It was a delicious burger: the blue cheese burger. I got a milkshake too which was also good. Everything is a la carte so the burger alone was $17. A bit pricy with no sides. But it did get me full so it was a worth it.

3hJTzEPbI5uHZKBJE4NnpQ.text: We came here just in time for the second happy hour 9pm- closing and just in time to order dinner because the kitchen closed at 10pm. I am so glad that we made it there because I was able to experience the best cheeseburger I've had in a very long time. We were able to share a basket of fries which definitely would have been way too much for me to conquer on my lonesome.  We had great service and even though we were a few of the last people there, we did not feel rushed to leave and was able to enjoy our food.

oE8KBWRJtDsHmnAIE1wr7g.text: This place was my Plan B because I originally wanted to try out Gordon Ramsay's Steak Restaurant before the Jersey Boys show; BUT it was fully booked for the rest of the night. I was on a solo business trip, so everything was planned spontaneously.  Burger Brasserie satisfied my craving for beef avec Le Paris Burger: Juicy, medium cooked burger with bacon, brie cheese, and I believe it had some garlic aioli. Also got a side of delicious sweet potato fries, but the burger itself was already enough food for me!   The menu had some other delicious sounding varieties as well. I wouldn't mind coming back here whenever I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sweet potato fries
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Paris Burger! Can&#39;t go wrong with brie cheese and bacon in your burger, mmmmm

-mgD72vZEmnvs9e3NSemPg.text: It is easy to miss this early adopter to the "gourmet" burger craze currently in full swing. Burger Brassiere is located in the walkway that connects the Bally's and Paris hotels. While actually closer in proximity to Bally's, it is in fact part of the Paris property. it is as much a sports bar as anything with a large bar area booth seating throughout the restaurant. You are never out of TV view and there is always a game playing on the flat screens. I like Burger Brasserie for a few reasons, they do have a quality burger and some clever sides at a reasonable price, they have a beverage HH everyday from 4-7, and they offer discounts to total rewards members. The biggest complaint is just the noise level and the fact they can get very busy to the point of it effecting service. Anyhow it is a great place to grab a draft and a burger and enjoy a game. In my opinion it beats the sports book at both Bally's and Paris. I have been several times over the years and it's been a while. My last visit recently was a pleasant reminder that they do a reasonably good job of the sports bar theme with some very nice comfort food. I mixed it up this time and ordered the very rich and decadent French Onion Burger caramelized onions, gruyere gratinee. It comes dry so the condiments are up to you. The burger was cooked perfectly and the bun was pillowy soft. A touch of Dijon Mustard and this puppy rocked. yelp.com/biz_photos/burg... yelp.com/biz_photos/burg... The cheesebuger mac n' cheese bites are sinful to be sure, and a great appetizer to share. They are filling and pack a calorie punch so be prepared. yelp.com/biz_photos/burg... I will definitively go back for a spot to watch that game in an inviting, quality venue like BB every time. Did I mention they are pretty consistent? Well they are and kudos for that, see you again BB.

mhO4Km3RpdyfFck60rfR9g.text: My date and I ate dinner here before going to a show and she really likes it. Burger Brasserie offers a French interpretation of a classic American staple - the hamburger - in a lovely sports bar environment. The restaurant is convenient to both Bally's and Paris because it's located on the promenade connecting the two Las Vegas hotels. The decor and ambiance were excellent.  She enjoyed her cheeseburger, fries and house salad. I avoid cheeseburgers and fries normally and prefer nutritious foods. Therefore, I did not like the burger and fries. The salad was fresh and tasted good. An added benefit was that Total Rewards credits were accepted to pay for the meal.

sAHaHvlAfKdbNwOXK5jNxA.text: Came here on 11/25- Stuck up hostess, average server (not very attentive with refills).  Could have had a better burger at Diner. Atleast the food was served hot. Need to be directed to the restroom, the hostess were all too busy making roll-up and talking to even notice. Didn't know helping a guest is a burden.....We will not be back.

7hZD7FInqRf85amjT2rx-A.text: Amazing burger and friendly staff... definitely will come back again. Especially for the lamb  burger..

w2sKi-9pOFutZGzUx00WCw.text: Cheap food by quality but expensive price; hamburger was ordered medium and we got all them over cooked

czUHlP3QSqodKAU9pLc5Mg.text: I would have given 5 stars but the service was slow, and not to the fault of our waitress, she was literally running while others stood around chatting it up amongst each other. We started off with appetizers with the intent of getting a burger, however the appetizers and beer filled us up so we had to pass on the burger. We had gravy fries....oh my goodness. Delicious tender beef shreds in a brown gravy over fries. I'm going to try to recreate that recipe at home with short ribs in the Crockpot.  We also had the buffalo dip. It was delicious and very rich loaded with chucks of blue cheese. They serve it with pretzel bread, crostini, pretzel sticks, and celery. The food was just fabulous. The waitress was very nice just overworked.

SO-HAob3pV0pOLYCjsSZ_g.text: Ordered a burger fries and beer, and didn't pay the $19.95 got charged $31. When I asked the waitress she said oh you didn't specify, I didn't specify so I had to pay 12 more dollars? #ripoff

rioanYcOhEKjTiKRgIGPCw.text: The first time I experienced this restaurant was during Restaurant Week three years ago.  The food was worth a restaurant revisit so I purchased a Groupon for a revisit.  I revisited months later after the Restaurant Week menu was no longer available and noticed a slight change.  Decided to give this restaurant another try so I purchased another Groupon and after its expiration decided to revisit as the amount paid remains eligible for a credit towards the meal after expiration.  The food looked delicious, but upon taste, it was simply less than mediocre.

wu4pJpZTwoIk2QkanShUYA.text: This was one of the most below average meals i have had.  The onion rings werent fully cooked so eating raw batter isnt pleasant.   The burger was average from what my friend said but the salmon scalopini sandwich was not very good either.  Too many good options in vegas to eat here.

gNajn02imXNkiJgW-Wpc9Q.text: This is the sort of place that you hope will be amazing, but just kinda lets you down. It's just a-ok. If you're looking for a great burger in Vegas, there are far better ones than you'll find here. Everything here is just alright. The ambiance, the service, the burgers, the hot dogs, the fries, the desserts, the cocktails, the beer list - it's all just average and a-ok. For a top chef restaurant in Vegas, you want more. But if you're in the Bally's / Paris hotels and want a burger and beer without leaving the property, this place will work just fine. Nothing is bad. It's just that nothing is amazing either. Hint: Get your order to go and take it to your room (if you're staying at Bally's / Paris and not feeling like going to a better place).

vNYDly_zXGhahb04jtws-A.text: The wings where perfect!! Nice and crispy I got the garlic Parmesan wings. Those I will get again. The lamb burger was good it need a sauce but didn't want to add ketchup or mustard also maybe a feta w herbs would be good.

I6Hr7jv-VfkFxVV-iAhv-g.text: Good spot for a  office party, good service  A good pub type ambience and pub style food French  off course

rfnYZMa9k5eTHUM1jClFuw.text: My friends and i stayed at Paris hotel, we were celebrating an engagement and we all love burgers so we thought this place would be perfect since we didn't have to walk far to get  burger. My sister in law and mom got the CILANTRO LIME SKEWERS, the chicken had zero flavor, it was bland and the only thing that was good was the pico de gallo. i had the ANGUS BEEF SLIDERS, ZERO FLAVOR, the meat was nice and tender but it did not matter since the only thing that had some flavor was the caramelized onions, i even added A1 sauce and it didnt even matter. my best friend had the hot wings, that was the best thing we had at this place, oh and the drinks were really good.

CeXHHx6tiXFUJjw5_bm7_A.text: One of the best burger place ice ever eaten here at Burger Brasserie!! I built my own burger but the ingredients were perfection and the onion rings was nicely battered and the perfect texture! Also the server Angela is a great help with us and my deaf friend! Well professional service! We are making plans to come back here again!! This place deserve a 5 star for Excellent food!!!

sWd_kdvr7_DePxY1KEIzVQ.text: CHRISTINA!! I was hungover as hell when we came in here, and she was such a delight! It was her birthday (she's a leap year baby!) so she was dressed up, which I love to see. Food was perfect for my head and sickly stomach. Had a burger with Gruyere, caramelized onions, and a fried egg...YES. I can say for certain that my experience here would not have been half as good without Christina. She reminds me that there are people out there with impeccable customer service. Give that girl a raise :)

lq-sdZCXh2O1fYep86qetg.text: Walking through Paris shortly after checking in we were  enticed by the 2 for 1 happy hour special.   Two friends ordered Kobe beef burgers and I had a pretzel appetizer. Of course we shared several 23oz beers at the 2 for 1 price.   The food was delicious. The Kobe burgers got rave reviews from my friends, and the pretzels were a nice size snack at a reasonable price.   As is the case with almost every Vegas establishment that isn't $$$$, service was pretty terrible. But we managed and had a good time.   If you came to spend some real money, they have a $777 burger with Kobe beef, Foie Gras, goat cheese, pancetta, lobster, and 100 year aged balsamic. Oh yeah, it also comes with a bottle of Dom perignon champagne. If you order a tower of beer (not A part of the 2 for 1) you get to spin a wheel and can win a 1/2 off entree. If you're feeling lucky in Vegas maybe you can get one of these burgers at half price!

Ig35fElZQ-0doH5Vb4aMqA.text: I was in Vegas last weekend with my cousins. We had a nine o clock show to see Anthony cools. We wanted to grab a quick bite so I brought up this place knowing since I Was a diamond member and would possibly get a table right away or quickly. There was about 7 of us.   When I arrived the lady informed even with my TR status I would be waiting at least 30 minutes. I walked over to the dining area and saw plenty of open areas. I wasn't in the mood to argue so we opted for the food court at the Ballys. Hostess was just plain rude

6bd8LfO7Ef0J--tPAzqvEA.text: Best bleu cheese burger I've ever had. They are always busy when I come in, yet service never fails to be less than great. Decent beer selection. I am always able to get them to set a TV to my sports game of choice. A+.

cA-BUVxiOig6vs6GfKRv3Q.text: There wasn't anything horrible about my experience here, but there wasn't anything great about it either.  I'm just surprised given all the great reviews. I have had much better burgers elsewhere. No reason for me to visit again given all the other dining options.

Tx-SjNM52A2zuR1p4tSylg.text: Home of the 777...$777 Kobe burger. No, I can't afford that even for being the foodie that I am.   Cilantro lime skewers (4/5) pico de gallo accompaniment was out of this world.  Chicken Noodle Soup (3/5)  Tomato Bisque (4/5)   Onion Rings (3.5/5) slightly overdone for my taste by the Cheetos aioli was awesome   Service - 4/5 Food - 4/5 Ambience - 4/5

AZT7AdnQo3CnljjIFN3REg.text: Great place to eat  Good food  I was in Vegas for 3 days  I ate lunch here once, dinner and breakfast  Not to sold on breakfast !! Burgers excellent  The bartender Omar was excellent !! The lady bartender not very nice and acted like she was irritated , never asked how we were doing or if we needed anything...  My spouse left her a tip even though her service was poor oh btw she can't make good mixed drinks !! Mojito horrible !!!! Billy great waiter !!!!

GW_zUQYEhlz9HUovQI0FYQ.text: The Burger Brasserie is an excellent spot for some quick, yet quality bar food. Portions are generous and if you visit early afternoon all apps are half price.   There's one plate that keeps me coming back here each trip to Vegas - scratch pretzels.  You might think "oh sure, pretzels. Nothing special".  Wait till you've tried these delicious lye dipped bread bombs! The unique texture of each is type paired with either beer cheese or whole grain mustard. These are not your standard Snyder's or Rold Gold.   Next time you are combing the halls between Bally's and the Paris stop in for the this underrated signature starter!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot wings, pretzels, fried chicken.

1CqKMFO3Wwbv1MYiYB-6Jw.text: I first went here about 8 years ago. I didn't remember much, just that I liked them. So, when I ca back to Vegas, I wanted to try this image again.   We got the buffalo chicken fries. They were really good. The chicken was juicy. The flavors all worked together. We really liked them.   We also got the American burger and added bbq sauce. We also really liked out burger. It was messy but good.   To me, this place is kind of a gourmet burger joint. It's not like your shake shack or in n out. It has higher end ingredients.   We would definitely come back. Next time I'd like to try their desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken fries.

dpliPNrSgPJrcxc-ukTbMw.text: This restaurant gave me more of a casino cafe feel than an actual restaurant. (if you spend a lot of time in casinos, you'll understand that lol) The waitress took a long time to come take our order and kept forgetting things we asked for and ordered.   I had the Paris burger and waffle fries. The fries were delicious and a small order is enough to share between two people. The burger was a little heavy because of the cheese. They used too much in my opinion which made it greasy.   I tried the chicken fingers and Cheetos onion rings as well. The chicken fingers tasted like frozen food quality but the ranch was yummy. The onion rings were alright. The special Cheetos sauce is super spicy!   Overall, I wouldn't come back here but it was worth a try.

HmnGR7A2SgSEZAVVYVyuTQ.text: Remember the last time I ate a burger on the strip, at Gordon Ramsey burger and was unimpressed?  I'm even less impressed at Burger Brasserie.  The restaurant was pretty empty so we got a booth.  $20 for a burger and it doesn't come with sides.  The server asked what sides we wanted as if it were included though.  I felt that was sort of shady.    I got the prime rib sliders.  Each slider was TINY, as in barely two bites of food.  The beef didn't taste like anything.  The whole presentation was just sad.  Definitely get the burger if you must come here but prepare to be disappointed and pay extra for fries.

K7uCL9pNMLlvAW5LE9t9Ng.text: Great vibe. Staff friendly and experienced. Not like a lot of places here or at Other casinos.

lDWbt2x9-b3ql4jLesAUVA.text: I've past this place about a million times. Actually probably closer to 777 times :)  I was in my hotel room and needed a small meal to hold me over. After deliberating for a little bit, I decided to give BB a try. i had a 20 percent off coupon but it was only good until 4pm. it was around 5pm which meant it was happy hour, i still should get a good deal.  For happy hour there was a few people at the bar and it semmed semi busy. Drinks were 50 percent during happy hour so I ordered a Cab-arita which featured don julio blanco tequila, cointreau,  cabernet sauvignon, fresh-squeezed lime sour.  It was a very refrhesing drink. For my meal I wanted something small so i ordered the Angus Beef Sliders, it was $13 and I choose to have one of each. I felt like Gordon Ramsay sampling the menu :) I had a basic cheeseburger style, Shaft's bleu burger-style and the Paris burger-style.  They really hit the spot, I know another yelper did not these but mine were really good.   The mini bun was toasted, which made the roll buttery crunchy. If that's a word. I love my buns toasted   the meat was cooked just right and the toppings were perfect.   The atmosphere was fun as well with several games on the TVs. The bartender was very nice and attentive as well. I think her name was Karli. For two drinks and my sliders I was out the door for just over $30 and that included the tip.   I will be back.

jU3wr3gty0XgjCQy3XzEpA.text: We were a party of six on a Saturday night, but they seated us fairly quickly. The waiter was friendly and attentive, at least until he got busy with other tables. My wife and I decided to start with the deviled eggs, which were quite good. I ordered the Paris burger, which sounded a bit unusual but not too far from traditional. Big mistake. I don't know if it was the caramelized onions or some kind of sauce, but the sweetness overpowered everything, including the brie, the bacon and especially the meat. If I'm going to spend $13 on a burger I expect to taste beef. Very disappointing. Nobody else in our party reported anything especially bad or especially good. I'd say it was gimmicky and overpriced.

Yr4Im-ACmS6uYwt2rbV5gA.text: This was a working lunch. We sat down and it took about 10 minutes for the menus to be handed to us and then another 10 for our drink order to be taken. We ordered our food at the same time as our drinks. Waitress did not bring water for one person but remembered the other 3 of us. We ordered the Caesar salad, the American burger, the brisket chile and the Paris burger. Chile was brought out cold. I bit into a piece of brisket and it felt frozen, that is how cold the meat was.  The burgers were delicious with the meat being juicy and tender. The caesar salad was very fresh and crisp, perfect on the taste of the dressing. Coffee was brought out to us with creamer. Unfortunately, no spoons were at our table so we had to use a fork. Service was ok. They were busy but that is no excuse for okay service.

zjAAUFMwhpS1OqqQutfEDQ.text: Bun stale. Bartenders bordering on rude. Food mediocre and that is being kind. Go somewhere else to watch the games.

Z0HA5JCN3AmMyXtSwuxIFw.text: I stopped by Burger Brasserie with a group of friends. We were in town for a convention. This place was pretty disappointing. We waited almost 2 hours to be seated due to the kitchen being backed up. When we finally were able to sit down we had to order our food quickly to ensure taht the kitchen wasn't going to close.   Overall the food was mediocre, at best. My party ordered the Chicken Burger, Lamb Burger, Chili Lime Chicken Skewers, the Cobb Salad and the Chicken salad. The burgers were bland and the chicken skewers were tasteless. The most edible food was the salads.   The reason I gave this place 2 stars instead of 1 was because our server was friendly and helpful but she also didn't check on my table. We had to hunt her down whenever we needed something.

aaEQxjVwJv9R8hK5pzK0_Q.text: Horrible, horrible. Everything about this place was awful. First off, the restaurant says its located on Paris, come to find out its actually in ballys. Anyways the decor was so old and cheap and nasty. I just wanted a burger place, but McDonald's is cleaner than this. As a vegetarian I ordered a build your own burger. I asked for wheat bun, our waitress Christina has a hard time doing her job. She never let me spoke. Didn't listen when I did and she was so rude and not very attentive. She was awful, i never met a person that bad at a job. Anyways she ok ok ok me and got my whole order wrong. I asked for a wheat bread and got white, I asked for shoe string fries and got regular, my bf asked for hot wings and got fried drumsticks. I feel like this whole thing could of been avoided if she wasnt our server. Anyways food sucked she promised to charge me for a grilled cheese since I'm not eating meat, her idea not mine. Charged me extra for a burger at the end that was not what i had ordered. Food was oily and nasty my bf got sick from it our whole trip. Thx Christina  .. employee of the year

She was very friendly, prompt and professional.  I highly recommend this place when you are in the area and craving burgers.
