LEVGnmfOWZCsLB8EcIxp1w.text: For years now, I have been a dedicated fan of Burger Bar over at Luxor/Mandalay Bay.  That was the only place I would do burgers in Vegas because they were just so good.  Every time I mentioned Burger Bar though, someone would always ask "Have you been to the burger place at the Paris casino before, it's just as good".   Well, on my most recent trip to Vegas last month, I finally tried that "burger place at Paris".  It's called Le Burger Brasserie and it is very good!  My wife and I stopped in and first noticed that they had a good "bucket of beer" special that consisted of 5 or 6 of the larger aluminum beer bottles in a bucket of ice for a decent price.  We naturally started off with that and then ordered our food.  I ordered the Kobe beef burger and my wife went for the turkey burger.  Similar to Burger Bar, they have many different toppings for the burgers (although I don't think they have quite as many options as Burger Bar).  I went with mushrooms and bacon on my Kobe burger.  We also ordered two different kinds of fries, skinny fries and waffle cut fries.  The food came out quickly and we dug right in.  My Kobe burger was wonderful.  My wife's turkey burger was very good too, but I think Burger Bar has a slight edge in the turkey burger category.  The fries though....these were the best fries I have ever had.  Amazingly good!  They had some type of seasoning on them that faintly reminded me of those Hot Fries snacks you find in the chip aisle at the store.  What a great taste.  We ate every last crumb of the fries.  Overall, we had a fun time and a great casual meal here.  Very good burgers and fries.  As far as the competition goes between Le Burger Brasserie and Burger Bar, I still prefer Burger Bar, but this place is close behind them.

lOcR5Jeh8P7o7IJROp3DTA.text: Prices here aren't THAT bad for a Vegas joint.  Don't let the 777 burger for $777 skeeer you away.  If you like variety, then this is a place to fill up your tank with fried brick-in-your-stomach food.  We got the "Frites" Sampler and Eiffel Tower Onion Rings.  Both soaked with lovely oil and flavor.  I had the classic burger with pesto sauce and it was a great first experience putting pesto on my burger.  A friend of mine got the vegetarian burger and even that looked really appetizing... like some giant omelette burger.  Service was friendly and I'd definitely hit this place up again.  The only thing disappointing for me was that the name of the place didn't hold up to its end of the bargain............

eIU5wbeQSpYxxoatkTZk0g.text: I know that there are many followers of the dark side of the Force that prefer burger barn while in Vegas, but for my bottom jedi dollar, this place is thebest. You get fat burgers, serviced by hotties in short shorts and red corsets. yes, the women are the same body shape as the ladies from Hooters, but after all the eye candy, how is the food? Food is so good, it makes you forget about all the hot women for a minute. The Paris burger is good, with onion, brie all smothered over bacon. Good lord, my arteries were begging for mercy like Tom Arnold on his honeymoon night with Roseanne Barr. The drinks were good and stiff too. Wife had the lamb burger, and it was good. Guys..if you come here with your woman, wear some sunglasses so she wont catch you checking out the hotties, or else your balls might be on the menu as well.

T_9gAnL5VFFLjv-ar6xRhQ.text: To be honest I wasn't expecting much, but it turned out to be very good.  The burger was moist and well-sized.  I had the one with bacon and brie.  Waffle fries and regular fries were awesome.  Did not have the onion rings, but they were stacked high and looked tasty.  Lots of TVs around for good sports viewing too.

oKeuBx9saKpjFRq94lRWlw.text: Meh.  Just so so.  The servers were nice, burgers were alright, skinny fries were good, prices too high for the quality and quantity of food.

fEYB3D1ZiuuJkzP-GfmvSg.text: Great place.  $5 for 16oz Bud Light.  The best burgers in Vegas at very reasonable prices.  Great eye candy servers and even a few of the managers.  Add anything you want on the burger, it's yours.  Always cooked to order and perfect.

8YqZX5tPWlVht_TtbGcRqQ.text: I seriously think the Kobe beef patty in the 777 burger was not freshly prepared.  It was too round and flat to be molded in a chef's hand.

g449fnJPXOas_mRIxrMceQ.text: I loved my Poulet Mignon, but the wait-staff, while friendly, seemed a bit harried, as if there were too few people working. I didn't mind the skimpy outfits - the ladies carried themselves well in them - but I wish they'd gotten my drink refill to me sooner!

ZEKJ49p-5tDDM2F3K_I6yQ.text: I have to give the food 4 stars, but the experience 10 stars, if i could.  we were in Vegas for the first time, wanting a quick burger.  Little did we know that we would stumble upon this place - delicious, reasonably priced food (except the $777 Kobe burger and bottle of Dom).  The loaded waffle fries were delicious, but not as plentiful as i would've hoped.  The sliders were awesome.  but the best part of the meal was our waitress, Bria, and the rest of the staff.  super friendly, chatty, and funny.  and not in the typical Vegas way, where people talk to you because they want higher tips.    stop by for a drink or a bite, it will be worth the $20 tab.

ZizAREpxod4OKEWe_TQeLg.text: The burgers here were good but not stellar. I had a chicken burger with brie, smoked bacon, and shallots, while my friend had the "le classique" beef burger with brie and some other toppings that have slipped my mind. All burgers come served with lettuce, tomato, red onion, a pickle, and your choice of house-baked bun. We also ordered a french fry sampler of skinny and waffle fries. The fries were outstanding--perfectly crispy and seasoned, with no greasy residue. The mistake we made was that we ordered a sampler, when one order of fries is more than enough to feed two people with average appetites. Our server was Nicoletta and she was very friendly and provided excellent service. The price was reasonable, and they have great Happy Hour specials. Would we go here again? There's a slim possibility, but there are so many great burger joints in Las Vegas, this would be on the bottom of our list. In the future, come here for the Happy Hour specials and the french fries. They also have lots of flatscreens, so this would be a good option for those who want to watch the game over a beer.

T8X3RQ3jgYduYul1y4DdKg.text: This night we were on our way to go see Jubilee, so went early and walked around to decide where to eat.  We choose Le Burger - won't be back.  It was happy hour, but our waitress sat us "on the carpet", so not available for happy hour unless we moved.  I could see if she had said only the bar was HH, but the tile floor tables also qualified.  We ordered two Sharps non alcoholic beers and after several minutes, our server returned to our table and said it our drinks would arrive in a few minutes!  what?  My husband asked about the delay and she said they were in the back, so then he wanted to make sure they would be cold and she said they would be super cold, cuz they had been in the back.  We FINALLY get our drinks, and maybe they were cold, but  the mugs were not, so not cold after pouring.....of course, then our food came, which was disappointing only in that we like to enjoy our drink before dinner, not with it.  My husband got the Chicken Cordon Bleu sandwich and he said it was one of the best "burgers" he had ever had.  I got the Shrimp app and the 5 shrimp were big, but back off on the amount of frying time!!  I like my stuff crispy, but these were really overdone and the flavor of the shrimp was gone.  Usually, I order fries to be well done or xrta crispy, but said nothing and thankfully so.  The fries were over done and had that batter stuff on them, which I hate, so the shrimp and the fries tasted the same - like nothing!  I only ate the shrimp, after adding hot sauce to the remoulade that came with them.  It would have been nice to have cocktail sauce, which I thought was in the dish (not ketchup, since that was on the table), but we did not really see our server again til the end.  The restaurant was not busy and there was plenty of staff - which always results in less attentive service.  The bartenders looked like they were having fun at the bar, throwing the bottles around and all that - I wish we would have sat there - it would have been more entertaining.

co5TygH5SoBGCsQF7yk0tg.text: Lots of choices for toppings. $10 burgers does not include fries ... However there are 3 styles for fries: thin cut, thick cut and waffle. Mostly just burgers and (ground) chicken sandwiches. We go every time we are in Vegas. It is located in the indoor passage between the Bally's and Paris casinos (near the big slots at Bally's).

rdXdSS804d_XSyQ_CQByhA.text: I had one of the best burgers of my life here. I had the l'americain burger that comes with a half pound black angus beef patty,American cheese, 3 huge onion rings and mushrooms( I got the burger without mushrooms) you have an option for additional toppings at a fee. I added bacon and a fried egg to my burger. You also have a choice of bun. From sesame seed,wheat and a Parmesan. I took the Parmesan bun and requested a little mayo as the burger does not come with mayo. Man the thing was so big when I tried to take a bite out of it my jaw hurt from trying to take a bite.So I had to kinda press it down more so it wasn't so big. I took the first bite and thought I was in heaven,literally. It was so delicious. Alot of flavor and a very juicy. Not to mention it's generous amount. For a side we got waffle fries and steak fries. Not the best but still very good ! My review is solely based on this burger and it's nice atmosphere. I haven't tried anything else on the menu. All I know is that I will definitely be back for the l'americain just like I had it today on future visits to Vegas !

MOet_dfaJDVYP60ZNLR09Q.text: Its called a sports bar and does have allot of tv's, they just seem a tad small.  This place is located right a the entrance from Paris to Harrahs.   Stopped in for some drinks and a chicken caesars  salad.  The salad was very large and tasted good, the chicken was really good.  Bonus they had a 5-7pm happy hour going on 2 for 1 drinks.   Cool place to hang out, escape the casino and watch tv.  I will try and stop by this place again.

1XcX1UAj6w2qE5Tdg_1Vmg.text: My husband and I went here after Jersey Boys. It was so good! The burgers were huge and the fries were enough for 4 people. We ordered milkshakes too, but by the time we were done with our food we could barely get the milk shakes down. They gave us so much and it was well worth the price. The only thing was it took awhile for us to get our meals after we ordered.

XXjUkXYWiacgg0Z19hDtKA.text: Wanted to go to a place to eat and watch Lakers game so I decided to try this place out. At first I thought it was some fancy French restaurant but after seeing the girls in their tight brassieres and big screen TVs I was sold. I came to realize this place is basically a burger joint. Most of the menu consists of burgers and the type of foods you eat while watching a sports game. One thing that makes this place different is that they have all types of burgers. Beef, chicken, turkey, veggie, salmon, and lamb. Pretty good variety of meats and a lot of sides to choose from too. I never had a lamb burger before and thought I'd give it a shot. It was very delicious. Moist, tender, and full of flavor. I also liked that it wasn't a messy burger like many are and the skinny fries are amazing! Service was great and prices are very reasonable. Definitely a place I'd go to again.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Burger with skinny fries

VndwExmAK0tUJHMDC6ILJw.text: Really 4.5 stars.  We were on our way to Gordon Ramsey's burger place at Planet Hollywood for a late-afternoon meal.  As we walked between Bally's and Paris we came across Le Burger Brasserie.  It was about 3:30pm or so.  We checked the menu and liked what we saw.  We approached the hostess were seated immediately.  There were plenty of tables available.  The waitress came and took our drink order and returned quickly.  We placed our order and within 10-15 minutes we had our food.  I had a burger with Swiss cheese and it was fantastic. My wife had the sliders and they were equally delicious.  We were especially impressed with the fact that both orders were cooked perfectly to our order.  We shared an order of fries and they too were delicious.  Overall a great experience - delicious food, great service, pleasant atmosphere and reasonable (for Vegas Strip Casino restaurants).  I don't know what it would be like during an extremely busy time, but during our off-peak visit it was fabulous.

jw9hVnsBLyA0AkVC6NNP2Q.text: It's a burger place that has quite a few steps on your average fast food burger (of course). It was very, very good simply put. The service was pretty alright. It could have been better since the place wasn't busy at all.

Hw667ZGiX0Vcm61hJBkKiA.text: i found this gem while staying at the flamingo. while staying at different hotels they always give you coupon books to try different food or services from different hotels. so anyways when we moved to paris hotel from flamingo hotel we went down stairs and went to try this place aince we got 5 bucks off for 20 bucks spent. so me and my friends decided to sit down and order and i got the salmon burger with waffle fries. they got the regular beef hamburger with waffles fries and share also.   omg this salmon burger is one of my favor and the best i have tastes the salmon patty is used with real salmon and is made fresh and does taste homemade not some manufacturer made salmon patties. the salmon patty was charbroiled and it was well done and it wasnt dry and it was moist and the bun they served with was hot and crisp. they gave lots of veggies and mayo with it. i always like to include a side of horse radish to give the burger  a kick. also the fries is a hit and miss sometimes the waffle fries can be burnt or sometimes its just crisp good. the first time i had the crisp fries they were absolutely good and was soooo fresh with the ketchup and horse radish mixed together. if u like the blear your sinus do what i dipped my waffle fries in.   even the regular hamburger my friends said it was good. i didnt try it but i saw the oresentation and the smell it does looked good.   the prices of the burger were kinda pricey for 15 and 13 and etra for waffle fries. the price of the burgers are worth it tho becausw you pay for what you get. i definitely  do come bakc when im in vegas because there burgers are delicious.   service here is great and they do give good service. and were honest when i left my wallet and came right back for it they already had it in the back for me to come back and claim it. i almost had a heart attack lol.... but this place does satisfy my hunger buzz and burger cravings.

b0YJFWbothFLyTjpiiZXAA.text: Came last week on Wednesday. Took about 10 mins before someone came to our table but after that the service was great! Kept up on our drinks, & burgers were yummy! Very tasty. I had the le bleu & it had a ton of blue cheese! My bf had the classic n added other toppings , he was satisfied also....    Don't forget the yummy waffle fries! Delicious!!! Big enough to share :)  Would go back

oBgHWSt0JmPy9Vd2zNgHHA.text: We took a table at the bar, and after a long time without service, we decided sitting at the balcony - the barman wasn't bad - although with a very big and unnecessary ego. Surprisingly good burger thou. Altogether - not a bad choice.  P.S.: One of the very best fries I ever had...

m0xRQx-_qvvj5yv_-x6mWA.text: It feels great to write a review about food I have not had to prepare myself!  Training = home cooking....... Finally was able to eat out during a trip to Vegas....although I still have to watch sodium and other stuff, I managed quite well to find foods that fit my nutrition.  I opted for the chicken cordon bleu for the large portion of chicken breast with everything on the side.  Not only was it prepared as asked, it was great!  Large and juicy, ripe avocado, and fresh sides.  Service was pretty good this time around as well.  From 4p -7p is happy hour 2-1 beer, not draft though and my DH enjoyed a round while I had water - boo!

33ca_ia4CQMjBsBBeUCMCw.text: A colleague and I stopped in here after a reception at Bally's next door.  We were up for a small meal, having had light bites at the reception.  We opted to eat at the bar after walking in past the empty podium.  We asked if we could sit anywhere and were told to check in at the podium.  We went back out to the podium and there was now a line and someone taking names.  Perfect.  So we opted for the bar.  We were served by the bartender and occasionally one of the waitresses.  The bartenders wore long pants and button-up short sleeve shirts.  The waitresses wore a belt that looked like shorts and a revealing top with push up bras.  The bartender was not hot.  The waitresses were.  We were sitting next to a couple chowdah heads from Massachusetts.  They had lame swagger and were throwing attitude at the bartender which he was tossing right back.  One of them tried to hit on the waitress, offering up his room number.  She scrawled a quick "0" on a napkin and handed it to him, replying that his number was zero.  I had sliders which were ok, nothing special.  The company and staff were amusing in a very Vegas sort of way.

jR-yUUEWIWoCSXk3lwTC3Q.text: Three stars A-OK.  Extra half-star because good food at decent prices can be hard to find on the Strip.  Extra half-star because they have a long-term Groupon available for half-price, so it came out to a good price for a lot of food.  Things we liked:  The "grilles" portobello/peppers/onions/spinach burger (vegetarian) was __amazing__.  The sweet potato fries were standard but good.  I've definitely had much worse.  One of us got a real beef burger, I don't remember which, but she loved it.  The booths are comfortable and the dark wood look is very nice.  The tiramisu was EXCELLENT.  Nicolette was a super guide - friendly, knowledgeable about the options, warm and patient, even though she had way too many tables to handle, and couldn't be around all the time.  Which leads me to things we liked less:  She did have too many tables, we thought.  At these prices, she must be making a fortune, and I support that because she really seemed to care about serving everyone well.  But it did take a while sometimes, and my coffee was cold and then empty before she came by.  I had to ask her for a refill of it.  They don't have any soy or almond milk for coffee.  That stuff keeps longer than regular milk; I wish they'd think to offer it.  I feel like they can't decide whether they're a sports bar or something a little quieter and classier, more like good ol' Hamburger Hamlet (if you know them).  I found being surrounded by TVs seemed a bit distracting, though I really appreciated that the sound was more or less off.  Aside from the TVs, which were out of the way up high on the wall, it was very nice.  The "le legumes" burger is a few steps above Morningstar.  The toppings made it very tasty, but the patty is kind of an afterthought.  The espresso shake was really light on the espresso.  It looked so good on the menu!  The paper the burgers were served on seems less pretty than the rest of the theme.  Everything else is in dark rich colors but the paper was borrowed from Johnny Rocket's.  I daresay people will love their food more if they step up the paper.  One of our burgers came with no top bun. (?)  Happily, the recipient was planning on skipping the top bun anyway.  If there are psychics in the kitchen, this should go under "things we liked", I suppose.  We never asked for the bun; perhaps the kitchen is still wondering where the extra top bun came from.  The prices are strange, as others have pointed out here.  The main bits are Vegassy medium priced, but all the extras add up and despite our groupon, we ended up spending more than we expected.  On the other hand, the excellent tiramisu was only $5.  That said, if you can get the Groupon, by all means go.  I wish I had another one of those portobello burgers right now.

Hu5en6m8UG9Pyi_z_0qKuw.text: The veggie burger was not all that good, but it did the spot when we got into the hotel late and wanted to grab a bite before going out to the clubs. Pretty expensive for a not very high end meal.

rX7TSBXBZ09JzIIra7f5GA.text: Order wings, and onion rings as an appetizer, I had their chicken noodle soup and there chicken ceased salad and Over all tmi thought the food was pretty much flavorless, except the wings. For desserts we ordered the captain crunch shake and a peanut butter shake and they were delicious!!!

vd1WtB1rF-2lZamxiFmhtA.text: Located in the mall between Paris & Ballys, just right outside the casino entrance to Ballys.   "BEST BURGERS IN VEGAS - BURGER BRASSERIE "  um....not even close.   I think it's supposed to be a restaurant. Or is it a sports bar?  I've still not decided. Decor is lovely, comfortable actually.  Spacious.  Very spacious. Variety of sized tables to meet varying groups of patrons.  Bar itself is large, TVs tuned to every sports network possible.  Compared to the atmosphere the menu is a bit confusing.  Build your own burger, gourmet burgers, sliders, gravy fries, Almond Joy cheesecake and pretzels are a few items on the menu, to include a $777 burger. It does come with a bottle of Dom however....  I came here during the week for dinner.  Lots of empty tables; servers standing around twiddling thumbs, watching tv, talking amongst themselves. Took forever for our bright purple haired server to take our drink order.  There must have been a drought as our water took an eternity to arrive.  We had questions about the menu and were told not only was the menu new, but the food was better because everything was freshly made as opposed to their last menu where everything was frozen.  I opted to build my own burger, nothing fancy.  Requested it be cooked medium well & an hour later it came out rare.  My server argued with me.  Back it went and an hour later my replacement showed up.  Unfortunately it wasn't the burger I built; it was supposed to come with fried onion straws/slivers but instead someone put chopped red onion on it.  Not that it really mattered bc by the time it arrived I was no longer hungry as I filled up on my ok fries during my wait. I had it boxed up & ate part of it for dinner the next night...  I arrived here at 6:30pm & did not leave until after 10pm.  This is how S L O W they were.  Purple haired server rarely checked on us.  We went to the bar to have the bartender replenish our water & beers.  As I mentioned, numerous staff doing nothing; it was THE MANAGER you saw working, busing tables, delivering plates, setting tables & the like.  We did discuss our experience with him & while he did not comp any portion of our bill, he did give us his business card with "2 free entrees next visit" written on the back. We asked if he would have our server bring our check. 30 minutes later it arrived. It took just over an hour to pay it. Unacceptable.  Needless to say we tore up our "2 free entree" pass.  Overall the food was just average. Certainly not good enough to advertise themselves as having the Best Burgers in Vegas. The service was miserable.  I wished we stayed home. Cheers to your visit being better than mine (I hope)!

HXHFNHMB1qVCLCBcy2eu3A.text: Had "The Paris" with brie and bacon and it was incredible.  The service was slow considering the place was empty for lunch, but the cleavage made up for it and then some.

qz5xkCyI7-DDP1VJLSQOuA.text: i can use my total rewards pts to pay for food here? SOLD  great burgers and great staff

vFj2tKDj6Er0xujXfHizXw.text: Food was pretty good but the service was awful. Lots of employees wandering around and seating people but our waiter acted like he was the only one working. Our waiter didn't bring out our food another guy did. Gave us the wrong bill. Too over priced for what you get mostly because of the service.

DeFWRcYEOiBBVFDWFyqJ8A.text: Dropped in by coincidence and enjoyed a nice blue cheese burger. Staff was ok, nothing to complain about. The food was fine as well but i truly dislike that it was not hot. Blue cheese burger lukewarm, huh, would be much better if hot!

TXilfKlbcbKCzOJPgH0KAw.text: There are hundreds of places to eat in Vegas. We decided on this place as it was the closest gourmet burger place to our hotel located in Bally's.  It's basically a sports bar with decent food. The female servers and hostesses are all wearing French bustiers and short shorts with fishnet stockings so it's possible to get your creep on and feel like a perv ogling the staff. The food is good. I had the All American turkey burger that had bacon and a fried egg on it. Yum! My pal had the onion rings that were awesome and staked on a metal stick. Prices are what you expect on the Strip $15-$18 for burgers, sides extra of course. They even feature a $777 Kobe burger with fois gras and likely comes with an Escort to hand feed it to you. Worth a try but it's probably on par with the other 600 gourmet burger joints on the Strip so don't bother if you aren't walking distance from Bally's. It was good but I'm not writing any Haiku's about it either.

IqVOCwad6Y5o4xqicQvevw.text: This was the worst burger-returned my order. Ordered the lamb burger medium rare, what came was a grey dry slab of pressed frozen meat patty. Topped with a thin slab of feta cheese that looked like rubber. Couldn't believe that a place that is supposed to be a 'burger' restaurant would serve a burger that bad! Only good item was the bun, but the bun was so large compared to the burger that it over powered the small thin burger. Was extremely disappointed in all the food ordered-Parmesan lemon wings, hot wings both were made with same base wing (over battered, prob started with same frozen wing product). Sure you can find another place that serves better burgers in Vegas as the bar was set so low here. Only convenient thing was that we were staying in the Paris Las Vegas for a convention and since we were tired from the day, the place was close (located between Paris and Bally's) not overly expensive imposed to most Vegas restaurants, but definitely NOT worth the price!

MVyzA_I3S60gq3jmTbslmA.text: We moved here from a little over six months ago. We've been looking forward to coming to this place for some time, boy were we ever disappointed... it took over ten min just to get our drink order. Another twenty just to put our food order in. After being there for two hours and not eating we had enough.   Slow and bad service. Food came out way to late and when it finally came out it was undercooked and the onion rings were burnt. I will not come back to this place. Don't waste your time or money...

3djwMPnX0ipJUvhW_lz3Pw.text: Food was ok. Wife had messy burger and I had French Dip. Both were stacked high with eat n fixins!!!  Great flavor. Price consistent with food on or near strip.....would go back if hungry for good bar food

29B2aPbJYoUDmPDX20-x1Q.text: A group of us went here to eat some burgers since we heard they had good burgers. The food was good but somewhat oily and dry. I woul of given the restaurant 4 stars if it wasn't for the horrible service provided by Olivia. She had a bad attitude throughout the whole time we were there for no reason at all. We asked for a To Go box and she just threw it on the table, which we thought was so rude. We asked our waters to be filled 3 times before she actually got around to it. The restaurant is expensive, so I expected better service. Overall, it's worth going if you enjoy a good burger. Hopefully, you get a better waitress/waiter.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juicy oily burger

qty1yy7QRO-_g7ndOl8pOg.text: Came here for the first time tonight... Got seated immediately,. The server was a little slow getting to us ... The food was even slower coming out.. Not worth the wait

lstrFh8G_m6958PQE_OOeQ.text: I'm not usually the type that goes for a $10+ burger, but I was wandering around the Strip & casinos with a friend & popped into Burger Brasserie after wandering around inside Bally's (I had no idea that we made it from Bally's into Paris).  We arrived at about 4PM & were promptly seated. After being in & out of the 110+ degree temps outside, we were in desperate need of hydration, so it was extra-annoying that our waiter approached our table a couple minutes after we were seated but then when he was a foot away, he abruptly turned around & headed back into the kitchen for something.     Two very long minutes later, he came to our table.  We were prepared to order drinks & meals, but as soon as he took our drink order, he walked off!  NOT A GREAT START, FOR A PLACE THAT CHARGES ALMOST $20 FOR A BURGER!    It was 'happy hour,' so I think my friend got the best deal -- two cocktails for the price of one, while I stuck to an iced tea.  We each ordered the caramelized onion burger ($17), but mine with the vegetarian patty, & we shared an order of fries ($7).  My burger was very good  though I think it's hard to go-wrong with cheese & caramelized onions on something. Another redeeming factor was that I was going thru my iced teas pretty quickly (I had 5 or 6 during the 75 minutes we were there) & the staff --not always our waiter-- did a great job keeping them refilled -- a lifesaver.  Not any sort of view or much ambience inside the place, so we're paying the high prices due to the location on the Strip (again,no view of anything though)  & *perception* that it's a classy! upscale place.  If I'm back on the Strip with friends looking for an upscale burger place, I'd rather try something new, but wouldn't have any major qualms going back to Burger Brasserie -- if you're going to eat on the Strip, you can't be a cheapskate.

Q2CMUI8M92Laiv7MMIB4_w.text: Went here for happy hour, two for one drinks. $14/ glass so the 2-4-1 made it more affordable. Try the Paris burger. It's the best I've ever had. $13 for the burger alone but it was fulling. Staff was extraordinary. Will recommend and return next Vegas trip

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5E8n_SrgspSDLGGQySpVCQ.text: This place was good, not great. That being said, I did end up going back in the same weekend lol. I think my expectations were too high, I was expecting  one of those gourmet burger places that had really high quality food and that's just not this place.   Unfortunately, the fries and onion rings are a frozen product ;(   The service was average, the girls are busy and working lots of tables so I get it.   The positive? My Le' Paris burger was delicious!! It had Brie cheese, carmelized onions and bacon on it, the combination of those flavors was awesome!!   I would probably go back for a quick bite without a wait.  My opinion is that this is an older Vegas restaurant that used to be poppin' and now it's lost some of that hotness that's so important in this city! I would guess that this gets a makeover into a different restaurant in the near future!   MY GO-TO: Le'Paris Burger!

hNAJ7VUZxlCh2LzLnC3Ytg.text: Kobe beef burger made to order. Outstanding. Took friend who'd never been. He was impressed!!

UHgR0xxA4VX-OGOnZztkBg.text: I must say I was not impressed. I expected more from a restaurant located inside the Paris. The buffalo dip appetizer had no presentation and was over seasoned. The sweet potato fries were cold and undercooked. The waffle fries were hard. The champagne turkey burger patty was very dry. The restaurant had a terrible ambiance. We will definitely not be returning.

_KNSq5eZuWzs7XothWbMqQ.text: Burgers  I have a big weakness for a nice juicy cheeseburger, especially when it has onion rings in it.  After ordering L' American cheeseburger, I quickly noticed that it was the type of sandwich that requires you to have a special hold to the burger.  The kind of hold the demands you to let the sandwich know who runs the show.  Hold it, or be held.  If you show weakness to it, you will fail miserably.  Two hands and a firm grip. each finger evenly spaced on the sides.  Respect it, and it will respect you.    Cheers

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. L&#39; American

e0zEJ_cJi29P9b31BXmJgg.text: I overheard a conversation at the table next to me in which it was made known that this place changed hands about 5 months ago. So check out their menu online, you'll see the Paris burger that's the darling of all these glowing reviews is no more.  Also it's part of Bally's now, not Paris, and it's branded a "sports grille."  This is my first time here so I don't know what it was before.  I had the bleu cheese burger and it was excellent.  My wife ordered the barbecue chicken burger.  The kitchen ran out of barbecue sauce and substituted some barbecue aioli which she didn't like. I didn't think it was cool to do a substitution without checking with us first. Glad she doesn't have an allergy...  The fries were good but at the end of the day they were just fries.  Overall I think that the food is decent here but the value is just so-so.  The service could use a little polish but was OK.

FlfLSR51Wc8CTl9cN17UPw.text: I'm sad that this nice place seems to be going down the drain. BF & I went here for our Groupon deal but the food now are a la carte. They used to have Fries with burgers or any other sandwiches. Now, if you order burger, that's what it's going to be. Would I come here again even if we have a coupon? NO. I will definitely go some place else.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Steak, No fries or sides that comes with it
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is what the Burgers look like now. No Fries or sides.

u18OQEKdQEyc7JtrFAt4jA.text: Service was friendly and attentive and food was not bad at all.  Just pricey for what we got but I suppose when in Vegas . ...  We were wandering around casino hopping and needed a snack to soak up some booze so we stopped in here and had some tasty fried goodness of tater tots which were a mix of potatoes, ham, cheese and chives with a jalapeno ketchup.  Good food and service I would stop in again for a snack.

YqXKClvtHIsr4mmcpHnnTA.text: This is my go-to burger place in Las Vegas.  Prices are reasonable and the food is excellent.    I always get my burger with Cheddar and Grilled Onions...oh so good.  Fries are definitely share-able so no need to get one for yourself.    Anyhow, service is always great, lots of TVs, beer, excellent food.  Not much more to ask for.

yV8xvP90VWDOqO6-Xx0Sbg.text: Everything was so greasy.  Onion rings and French fries too greasy to eat.  Burger so greasy the bun soggy.  Horrible

ss9pPl9rulYaQaerRxNt1Q.text: Le Burger Brasserie clearly benefits from its location -- steps away from the intersection of Bally's and Paris and, more importantly, all the convention halls filled with out-of-towners unwittingly looking for a quick, cheap place to grab a bite. I landed here because of a Groupon. The potato skins were tiny and limp. The Le bleu burger ($13) was decent, but mainly because the cheese and bacon  made up for the dense  and uninspired patty. Places like this don't have to produce a great product because of all the one-and-done customers that routinely fill their space. And, like them I won't be back.

RbEOaTF7IvK2P0JCtyQ4Yw.text: Just finished eating here for the first time!! My boyfriend and friend came to Vegas for first time for Deaf Nation World and we stopped here for lunch. Our server was Angela! She had the best customer service. She was patient and very helpful!! Food was the best I've had on the trip so far! Had their French dip which is to die for!! We will definitely be coming back before our trip is over!! Thank you Angela for your service!

WNrsd-Hx_Qx6Ol_7CVNurg.text: Have to say that every time I go to this restaurant I am very pleased with the outcome.   Great service, great food, great atmosphere. For us, this has become one of those must-eat places when visiting Las Vegas.

hAgLUQG7TiPPDIlr7s957w.text: They changed everything that was good about this place. Expensive and just ok-it was great before the changes. No more choice of bun and several great burgers. I won't be back

Z_AiEzgCVd2wkS3m-j4KaQ.text: Staff was polite, Alex my waiter was well informed of the food and sports. Waffle fries are great with the special ketchup but try dipping a round object in a square hole. Paris burger was not very exciting and it even had bacon on it, so sad.

XSeQBN6IoHZGnb7Q6OHjCQ.text: I always pass by here when walking from Bally's to Paris, so I finally decided to try it out.   Came here during lunch, got seated right away as there wasn't many people.   My boyfriend ordered the burger with blue cheese, and I ordered the burger with grilled onions.  I don't remember the name of the burgers as I didn't take a picture of the menu.  Both burgers were recommended by our waitress.  She offered superb service, so no complaints on that.  We also ordered the onion rings.  They are huge and stacked on top of each other in a tower form.  I think in total there were 5 onion rings, dusted with cheese powder. The onion rings were hot, but didn't have any onion flavour.  Perhaps there was too much batter.   The burgers looked good and had good presentation, but it didn't taste good at all.  Not juicy and dry.  The blue cheese burger was very pungent, so I guess if you love blue cheese, you might like this burger, but it covers all the other taste.   Was really disappointed.  On the plus side because I'm a diamond member, right before we were leaving and paying, the manager came and gave us two sample sizes of vanilla milkshake for being a diamond member.   That was really good and creamy.  Come for the shakes, and nothing else.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complementary vanilla milkshake.  Really yummy.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6EPLuvMqLwLbBM-LWVf0Lg.text: It seems kind of weird that I'm reviewing a burger place without having tried the burger, but I was full and we needed a snack, so there you go.  My dining companion was in the mood for a salad, so we went with the Caesar Salad ("romaine, parmesan cheese, croutons") and mentioned we'd be sharing.  A few minutes later, our waitress brought two separate Caesar Salads on two plates, so we assumed she had somehow misheard and put in two orders. I grumpily ate mine, although it was indeed an above-average Caesar. The dressing was creamy and had a nice acidic bite running through it, while the croutons were fairly flavorful.  When the bill arrived, however, I noticed we were only charged for one salad and our waitress had helpfully divided the order in two. All was forgiven, but I just wish she had mentioned what she had done to allay our considerable confusion and consternation.

4gEmBi6TyQv2oXpSFUndrg.text: Steak was beyond expectations , we got seated pretty quick, and or server Amanda made our first visit pretty easy not the less her customer service was beyond expectations very enthusiastic and quick what more could we ask for after our first visit definitely made this experience a five star THANK YOU AMANDA

m5UpOsAVYlTJ3r4gM_pfmA.text: We sat at the bar.  Fantastic service and really good burger.  Too much to eat as you can't take a doggie bag in Vegas.  We go at least once each visit.

j7LA-GhPvL9QfJU6C2uYLw.text: Been passing by this place all weekend, so I just went to look at the menu and there cute hostess comes up to me with her lil seducing voice and reeled me in. Lol wasn't feeling like eating burgers again but why not. Our waitress was in a super good mood, seemed like the whole staff was really. I got the Paris burger which was ooookaay. The place is not expensive either so not bad for a quick bite, plus the place is pretty nice. BUT Tbh only way I see myself eating here again is if I pass by and get seduced again. Great staff, but food was not good enough to make me come back.

uo0dJTnvGhK5uU0jkPud6w.text: I order the deal of the day which was a regular burger, fries and a beer for $20. The burger was a good size and I was pretty full after eating all my fries and the burger. It was pretty busy in their but our server was constantly checking on us and was quick to get is what we needed.
