veBxSxiUNk7GrBRCrihrbQ.text: Mehhh Everything looks right,... but flavor and texture wasnt on point   The onion rings taste boiled inside, and the burger although medium rare to perfection has a weird texture like wet paper... I don't know if its the beef or their method. Was really looking forward to a great burger. Still 3 stars because service at bar is impeccable

BUHsdHBSw_E0vGzinj7gkw.text: Worst burger I've had in my life. Just because you see a big sign that says burger, beer and fries for 19.95 DO NOT GO IN. Service was horrible, staff rude and the only burger I could order for the special was a burger with velvetta cheese. It was gross. The waffle fries were ok.

-0yHHdLOtdavLejZDbj6Sw.text: Good lunch today, but nothing remarkable. I built my own burger. I did love the onion bun, great choice! Otherwise the burger was just regular, and a bit over-priced considering that. Shakes were interesting and unusual. Service was very friendly and good.

lcnQyWruicfP1fWtbyUOXA.text: Nothing special. The meat is dry and tasteless. The only decent thing was the onion rings. The fries were probably the cheap frozen kind. The service and atmosphere is nice but that's about it. For the price, I expected the burger to be much better. Save your money and go the habit or smashburger.

ryOYLmbWs4rH1TRjK4-q8w.text: I was pleasantly surprised with our dinner experience here. I was expecting just an average burger and fries but they definitely exceeded my expectations. I ordered the French onion burger and a side of waffle fries (sadly the two don't come together and they aren't cheap but they did have waffle fries which was awesome).   The burger itself was very well-prepared. Medium was juicy and pink all the way through, and the Gruyere and onions worked nicely on top. I didn't care for the bun options but went with wheat which was fine. A really nice combination. The waffle fries were fresh, crispy, and lightly seasoned. A single was enough for two people to share but any more than that and I would go with the double.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Onion Burger

9FiI006Qffj6wd7m4LCHRw.text: Was skeptical at first cause to many poultry items to choose from...so I narrowed it down to a Champagne Turkey Burger with Fried Egg and Bacon on it.  How can I say it nicely...that burger was the BOMB!!!  Have to bring my girls here next year for our trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champagne Turkey Burger

ye_y7PC6LVFKtDk3t5eAgw.text: We walked in and sat at one of the two seater bar tables that line the bar. We sat there for 15 minutes, until finally a rude waitress walked by, said "There is no service at those tables. You have to order from the bar.", and continued on. The bar tender never said anything. It is usually standard that bar tables receive service. Will never go back.

sVW2mviFkdW4bdF1rrcUww.text: Short and sweet. Their food wasn't special for the price you pay. Their waitresses suck no customer service friendly at all, at least to the lesbian couple, the couple next to us got twice the attention. The Buss boys did all the work and were nice mannered. My son got his Sierra Mist finished his food and were still waiting on a refill. By the time the waitress came around we were ready for our check. 70 bucks I wouldnt mind spending if i had better waitress than Victoria smile and be nice start a convo, treat customers like family that's what gets people to come back!! I give this place a 3 star needs to improve on customer service. GOOD JOB Buss boys. Sorry but I'm not leaving a tip for that service, next time be nice to everyone you never know who will take the time to yelp.

xKEik6PN-EzWuEqrdaPo7A.text: Quick seating with good wait staff. Food was good however all sides, like fries averaged $8 extra. BLT was 5 star with the most bacon I have ever seen.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R43saROZASRqZRy2v4g1Nw.text: The happy hour prices are great and the food is pretty good but don't expect to be served quickly in the bar.  You often wait 15 mins to be greeted and another 15 mins or more for drinks.  They need more than one waitress in the bar. Especially at happy hour. They aren't particularly friendly either. This place would easily be 4 stars if they stepped up the service.

WmqpiuRm5TCy0puernZbNg.text: Service here was mediocre the waitress was always zipping by uninterested in her job actually seemed somewhat distracted. The burger was mediocre too I can't say I will go back there again. The only reason I went this time was because Bally's gave me a $5 off card. You know everything in Vegas adds up.

Y8m9msxD4KdmuUHkGk96SQ.text: Disgusting French dip and 8 dollars for fries that are basically like average Fast Food French fries.  The Food here was overpriced, my sandwhich was disgusting and didn't come with fries.  The drinks were mediocre and 12 bucks a piece.  I will NEVER return.

hI9TFhEHPznKDBfopkzbCw.text: Burgers are OK, not the best I've ever had but the flavors are there. If I'm paying $14 for a burger I expect it to at least come with a side but fries are extra. It is Vegas after all. The waffle fries are amazing, fresh, crisp and packed with flavor. I just love the cornmeal burger buns here, I think that's what makes the burger. I tried the Paris burger with Brie, grilled onions and bacon. The grilled onions did nothing for me. The bacon was good but it's rare I complain about bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paris burger with waffle fries

PXGcCdcAN93zCPQscd0jPw.text: We ordered the American Burger. It had American cheese, mushrooms and just one onion ring on top of the burger.  NO lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle or even fries were included with the burger. And though it states on menu you have 3 choices of bun type we were not asked. Burger was flavorful but disappointed no lettuce, tomato etc. included. My plate looked very disappointing when served (see photo).  Bloody Mary was boring. It came with just ONE olive and a slice of lime.  So.....2 burgers, one order of fries, one bloody mary and one soft drink total $54.00. Will not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries are not included with burger.
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavorful burger but that&#39;s it! No lettuce, tomato, onion, fries....not even a pickle! BORING!
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boring bloody mary!

aiTT1FkDNNxSJn7vixRk5w.text: Located inside the Paris Hotel and Casino. This is a sports bar, with bar food and brunch items. They have tables, booths and a full bar. The service was great. The food was average. For a sports bar, they have limited televisions. I'd eat here again.

6ggtsIaG0C4MVHIsdLJwaw.text: This was our first stop after my coworkers and I went to when we were done checking in the hotel. It wasn't that busy and we went to the hostess. Thought she was gonna greet us and seat us right away but we greeted her first. That wasn't the end of the world for us. When we sat at the booth/table, the atmosphere was very sports bar, even the menu. Kinda hard to read because the categories were worded like a scoreboard.   The food came out quick as we were pretty starving. I ordered the French Dip sandwich and my coworkers ordered their cheeseburger deal that came with fries and a beer. Her burger was kinda sad, but it was...i guess a deal since it came with beer and fries?  Overall it was alright...

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Dip Sandwich
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Score board menu

BFp7OBxNmmwGT6gX8udWRA.text: I visited this restaurant to use up my food voucher that was given for my stay at the Paris hotel. I walked by this restaurant numerous times since it is in the walkway connecting Paris and Bally's. Every time I walk by, every hostess i've seen standing outside looks very bored and looks like they hate their job. Moreover, the restaurant always look very empty.   Well, I had to use my food voucher anyways so why not give it a try even though I don't have the best first impression.   I ordered a cheeseburger and onion rings.   Service: slow and rude. The restaurant was very empty when I went in the afternoon with only two servers in the entire restaurant. The server was very slow in getting our orders and she seemed like she was in a rush to move onto the next table to serve them.   Food: The burger was bland. It also doesn't come with any sides. For the price, the burger was definitely overpriced since it wasn't tasty and it didn't come with any sides. The onion rings were better than the burger but nothing over the top.   In conclusion, I would suggest staying away form this restaurant. Maybe use the food voucher somewhere else.

PaduYbNKB1yLlWqQ2j4WrQ.text: Went for lunch today, we were sat right away and waited on by Chelsea, she was great, wife and i split an American burger and Prime rib french dip, both were very good, and even the smores cheesecake was great! Will def fine here again

4OTE9a7hRHsNuQAvLa_spQ.text: Salmon sandwich was to die for. My girl had the cob salad which was epic. Staff were super nice. Also very reasonable for an in hotel establishment. Would come back again.

ew_a7cQ80Q-skX6oSwnyBg.text: Best patty  melt EVER!!!! Great staff and stays open after the NFR.  I highly recommend you go there via either Ballys or Paris and order a large beer and Patty Melt. It will melt your heart.

8cT4dirss3M6Y3YcKhbOcw.text: Sat at the bar, probably had some rum and cokes, and the lobster deviled eggs. That's how we do it.

VFd_GANwc3JkIL0gptcDAA.text: Delicious!  The burgers here are great. I ordered one or the make your own. The bun was perfect and toasty. The meat was juicy and had that nice taste that was just beef deliciousness.  The onion rings here are huge!  Staff us great and it's got tons of screens for your football highlights.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GmQHfjI0MLBBDOzj2y6MrA.text: My wife and I were in Vegas on our way to visit family in Cali. We stayed in Bally's for the night. We were looking for a cheaper dinner place as the buffet were too expensive for our taste.   The menu looked good as well as the prices so we walked over and were seated immediately. The server came quickly and took our drink order. We'd figured out what we wanted. And ordered a menu item French Burger, and a Make your own burger. And a side of Onion Rings.   The food came fairly quickly, and was attractively played. The burgers were extremely delicious as were the Onion rings. The beef was some of the best burger meat I've ever had in a restaurant. My wife also thought so.  The portions were large enough we couldn't finish what we'd ordered.  The server paid enough attention without hovering. With our meal, amber Ale beer for me and a milkshake for my wife the bill was $50+ . We'd have spent more elsewhere but still not what we're sure used to paying to eat dinner out. But it is Vegas!!

nL79fGhphRE_UHa6yoLmNw.text: This place is amazing, very fresh food! Burgers were best I've had in while ! And they had a combo for 21 you get a burger fries and a beer ! We had Olivia as our server and she was pretty awesome ! She forget my carmelized onions but burger was still really good!

iQqycVBOQ850gL5U-Wr9bQ.text: Have to say the burgers are delicious and ingredients fresh. Over priced? YES  it it's Vegas in Paris hotel. They didn't take off the correct amount from my check after I handed them my 5 off coupon. Whatever not returning so who cares. Consider that the tip....

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey with bacon and wheat bread. Side of horseradish mayo yummy. 15 bucks well only once

TBsW6SSGEVVH60envFc3OA.text: Totally UNacceptable  - I waited for over 3 minutes for the girl working the front desk to seat me - NO ONE APPEARED - so... I took it upon myself to get a menu and seat myself. I was subsequently IGNORED by ALL staff. I took it upon myself to approach the bar - told them I where I was seated and ordered a water and a salad (which was ok - but JUST ok). TWENTY minutes later the food had not arrived. I asked for the manager who was the FIRST to tell me I had seated myself in a closed section - NO INDICATION of this - and DEBATED the issue with me that I'm here WHERE IS MY FOOD?? He walked away - NEVER checked in again. The food did arrive, but NO check was delivered. I SHOULD have walked out - but - because I'm honest, I sought out the barkeep and paid her. I left NO tip - the damn manager can tip her!! He does NOT belong in the restaurant business and I have NO plans to return to this place. There is NO EXCUSE for treating a customer like this - and I will now make sure that EVERYONE knows what a horses ass the manager of this place is and how he runs it.

Y4QYUtKws9T7nlIVrTBCQQ.text: Had lunch today at Burger Bistro.  2 hamburgers served cold.  They replaced them.  Replacement was ok.  French fries Luke warm also and not great.  We got back to our hotel and watched news where this restaurant was one of the ones on the news for health dept violations!  Generally awful experience.

zy3CKRAOxOejJMGb7beqUw.text: Food & service was great. Our drinks never went dry, waitress was fast and kept asking if we needed anything. Food was so good. I had lemon garlic Parmesan wings as a appetizer and the Paris burger. The flavors were all there... definitely will be coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dmcRzVy6fTLsuGR0IFQMog.text: Burge Brasserie has a large selection of burgers and bar food. The prices range from 15-18 dollars per burger, which is not a great price, but It's probably the standard for the strip. This is a great location to come watch some games, have some beers and have good bar food. We ordered the blue cheese and Paris burger. You have the option to pick from different buns (onion bun, wheat and potatoes)  The patties were perfectly cooked and the quality of the ingredients was better than most. Overall, they were just a bit better than average. I personally enjoyed the blue cheese burger, but only order this if you are a True blue cheese fan as this can be a bit overwhelming. The service was just ok. Overall, not a bad choice for a laid back meal at the strip.

g3vKbu2y1pjwvwNjr8h0mw.text: Slooooooow service!  Overpriced for what you get.  The fries with gravy was really good and that's the reason for the two stars. Don't order the hot dog sliders! Yuk

JpUC5eW5qc2GAk-XoeDv0A.text: What a waste of calories. A boring burger with very little taste and fries that are really not worth the fat. Split sweet potato fries and waffle cut; they were both soggy. My pattie tasted like it could have been frozen. Likely was not, just not very good. Tried to go to Gordon Ramsey Burger and there an hour wait. Walked right into this place and was served quickly. There is a reason it was empty. Don't waste your time unless fast food is your standard for a decent burger.

YDOnhMOSnE21SYJ1tSNU5g.text: Have been walking past Burger Brasserie for sometime and finally decided to check it out.  Stopped in for lunch yesterday around 12ish.  Immediately greeted by the hostess and brought to our booth, and our server came by to take our drink orders shortly after.  I can't remember her name, but she was attentive, and gave us great suggestions and recommendations on the menu.  We ordered 2 burgers and the waffle fries, all very tasty.  While the burgers were good, they were so over powered by cheese.  Now don't get me wrong, I love cheese, but when there is more cheese spilling out of the burger and all over the plate, it's a little much.  My husband had the blue cheese burger, and I could smell the pungentness of the cheese from across the table.  The actual burger itself was good.  The waffle fries get an A++ with the spicy ketchup that they come with.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hHs_QWSZMW933U_xY90Z5w.text: The food was horrible.  The onion rings were re-fried and we asked for another and it was still cold.   The burgers were dry and unseasoned   The waitress was kind but the food was half eaten and left alone.

2TnL6qdfW3hKLFQYn4c7UA.text: Where do I begin. Me in my boyfriend were both so starving after a long drive and walked up to this establishment and we're greeted and welcome and shown to are table right away. Are service was spectacular to say the least and the food was so delicious. Both me and my boyfriend felt welcomed the whole time. Our drinks were always full. My boyfriend has a steak and enjoyed his meal. The prices are perfect for the quality of the food and service. I would definitely come by and dine here again. Or server was named Genevi. Thank you

JoJqPBTnDfpvwhAuisnOEQ.text: Had the bbq chicken sandwich with french fries . Very tasty. A little pricey but hey it Vegas! Staff was really friendly the manager was really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Neat place

3F4KXPaGKta-WwTLUF6STA.text: Nothing too special, just convenient since I was in the area.   Had the Lamburger, fries and a beer, 38 bucks.   Should have went to In and out and the 7 -11.   Would have been better.   Bartender got pissy because he put 4 guys on one bill and we made him separate it.  The food has a lot to be desired, but the waitresses made me add a star...

hTy02UANxrIvX-kTROgsAQ.text: Food is good and service was great. Definitely recommend the burgers although I ordered a side of BBQ sauce to spice it up and it was perfect. The tater tots were also cooked perfectly crispy and I'm definitely a fan of the flaming hot cheeto ranch!

NXgBMroSLP1OJKlWlWm5ww.text: We came here last Friday to grab lunch in between meetings we had.   This place is pretty good. They have a decent size menu and plenty of options if you aren't in the mood for a burger.  We started with "hangover cure" bloody Mary's. They were good, but definitely not the best bloody Mary I've ever had.   We share an appetizer sampler which had chicken wings, mac & cheese balls, and a few other things i can't remember. The chicken wings were great! However I was not expecting the mac & cheese balls to have meat in them. That was a little weird for me.   I ordered the burger with Valveeta on it. and oh my goodness it was tasty! Perfectly cooked Medium well and with an onion bun it was a very simple yet delicious burger.   My friends ordered a french dip and salad to share, and they liked the salad but definitely were not fans of their french dip. I was extremely greasy and the cheese sauce on it was pretty gross. After tasting it I agreed with them.   Our service here was average at best. All the servers were women in corsets and booty shorts so I don't think they hire them based on their resumes.   While we were dining, a woman at the table next to us started choking on her food. Luckily a man at the next table jumped up and sprang into action to give her the Heimlich and help her get the food out of her throat and breathe again. I know most servers aren't required to take any kind of CPR course so I wasn't shocked any of them weren't able to help. Luckily the woman was completely okay once she was able to cough up her food, but I was rather bothered by the fact that management was no where to be seen, and once he did come out he was on his cell phone calling an EMT (as I found out later) The restaurant did guy the man a round of drinks for helping the choking woman so that was awesome. But watching this all first hand the manager seemed pretty useless.

uYpwg7KBlbIN5enNV4H_UQ.text: I sat at the bar and received really good service. Drinks were well prepared.  Burger was good. I ordered mine medium, but it came out well done. It wasn't too dry, but because it was overcooked definitely lost some of its personality.  Toppings were great and the fries were decent.  Overall the meal was pretty good despite overcooking my burger. I ordered the Kobe beef, but since it was overcooked I'd get regular beef next time.  Everything was a little on the pricier side considering the quality, but not bad overall.

c9R89udRPGoXuoBFmSOAqQ.text: we only came to catch a basketball playoff game; good service (though the waitress' outfits are a little demeaning) but very "meh" burgers for that price--to me, $15/burger is not cheap nor reasonable. the bun was soggy and the meat was underseasoned--i never add salt to restaurant food but had to do so here. fries (seasoned waffle & crispy) were good but pricey. with drinks, a tab of $150ish for a family of 5 for mediocre food is an outrage.

t7ILoDe5JS83agaB6HThSw.text: Sat at the bar alone, ordered my first drink of the night which was good, ordered a burger and the waiter responded "with fries?" I said great! Got my food and the waiter never once asked how it was or how I was doing. If he had I would have told him it was not great which is why I only ate a 4th or it and wanted to send it back. The fries were good though so I just figured I'd eat them and move on. That was until I got the check that showed they were charging an additional $8 for the fries on top of the $15 burger that I barely ate. I said something and he just kinda brushed it off like he hadn't been the one to imply they came with the burger or hey!!!! say they are separate when you offer something additional to someone's order! I will not be coming back to this restaurant and I strongly recommend whoever is reading this finds somewhere else to go as well. So so many better places to eat and I walked into that bs

YNWslnqpPaeXMXiydQ6bnQ.text: No line no wait. Very risque uniforms. Service was ok.  But the food was delish. $12 BLT Salad. Every Single Bite had bacon. Overpriced but everything is in Vegas.

XEMXH5xIJqBT8kBrxfrapg.text: I stayed at Bally's and was starving on Saturday night, walked around the Flamingo corridor a little bit, it was a zoo so back to the hotel. Came upon Burger Brasserie and was seated right away around 8:45 on a Saturday, can not believe this place was not packed. Great Service - Nicolette was awesome, she was all over it. Great and I mean Great Shredded Beef Brisket Chili, a Cup is a very large portion as well. Small Wedge Salad was really good. I had the Chicken Burger on a fresh Onion Bun, really good, Ice Tea as well. $33 but worth it so tipped $7 and out the door with a full tummy and a smile on my face. I will go back when I get the chance.

UIyY-5VQeE9LNfSKhrF0-w.text: I had lunch here one day. I wasn't impressed.  The beer selection is standard Harrah's property stuff. They claim it is a sports bar, but it doubt I'd want to come here to watch any sports. The TV ratio is rather lacking.  I had a burger and fries. My main reason for giving the place 2 stars is the burger was average. I expected better. There wasn't anything special. The meat was good, the bun was good, the toppings were fine. I expected a better burger.

rZ7Z2ODzo_KGByi9Ax_XIw.text: Went there on my birthday last year specifically to order their 777 burger which in economic terms is the 1% of burgers. The meal itself costs $777 but that includes a bottle of Dom, without the fancy champaign the burger its $77 I believe. Enough with the repeating 7's the burger comes from the finest cut of Kobe beef, imported brie, caramelized onions, prosciutto, a lobster tail which is all topped off with an aged balsamic vinaigrette that made me fall to the floor. If you want a lengthy detailed description just check out my blog.   After my cousin and I devoured the burgers the Sous-Chef came to our table to thank us. After I told him it was my birthday he told me that he was going to make a custom dessert for the both of us. I accepted and what was brought out cannot be described (look at my blog again for pictures). I am not a fan of sweets but I felt obligated and had absolutely no shame stuffing my mouth.   After we assessed the damage which was very reasonable for what we ate we tried to finish off the drinks we ordered and I could not for the life of me ingest anything else. To this day I cannot say I have felt anymore full than I did that night. Our walk from Paris to the Venetian had to be one of the most grueling experiences of my life. I passed out at 9 pm, woke up at 2 and topped of my birthday celebration. Top notch food, great service and one of my best dining experiences makes me give this place a rare 5 star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 777 Burger. So amazing.

X1oJXyXQkTy9CLrW5XNzUg.text: We stopped in there because of a special they promoted outside the bar.  We had 5 people in my group. The service was fair and they kept screwing up our drink orders. My wife ordered a rum and coke and ended up with diet coke. She has problems with the fake sugars so we complained to the manager who was a professional ass.  Would not give us a credit and was very rude.  We will not be going back there.  You have been warned.

1kw4TInk-xMNizDoyziMXA.text: Great food and service. The chicken skewers were excellent.

SCDtKRU5WEPVya3mOvYyJw.text: When staying at Bally's recently, this was one of the restaurants we tried. It's located along the internal walkway connecting Bally's to Paris. Arrived at 4pm which is a strange between lunch and dinner time, but we flew in from the East coast and were hungry! The hostess and servers were pleasant, but not over-the-top friendly. It wasn't crowded at all, so we were seated immediately. I got the Shaft's Bleu Burger and boyfriend got the California Chicken Burger. The sandwiches don't come with fries, so they have to be ordered separately. We opted to share an order. Fries came out first, followed by the burgers right after. Everything was tasty. My burger had a great flavor balance, with the burger, bacon and cheese tasting great together. The California Chicken sandwich was good too. He asked for a side of pickles, which came out quickly when requested, but wasn't a fan because they were sweet rather than dill. The fries came with a spiced ketchup, but it still tasted like regular ketchup to us, which is fine. No complaints here overall, and we'd consider eating here again if in the area.

EyapndKNhmP6tSvRN7Rr-Q.text: This place would have gotten 3 stars because the front hostesses seem to be very incompetent. However, our waitress made up for it because she was very on top of it. I gave this place 4 stars because the Bleu burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had. I ordered the waffle fries but received regular fries instead, but the waitress gave me the waffle fries that I ordered, which were enjoyable as well. The beer list is pretty good too. I had a good experience here and didn't mind paying $15 for a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bleu burger is so delicious.

RHShMP4c-7zwZ7m95w8bPw.text: I was debating between a 4 and 5 only because of the waiting.. But It was out of their control. I had a delicious build a burger... Beef, jack cheese, avocado and caramelized onions. It was delicious!! I also ordered a side of sweet potatoes fries which were also delicious :)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious sweet potato fries
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Build a burger.. Beef, jack cheese, avocado and caramelized onions

Tt13xQ_byFqrR7toXOe6oQ.text: Good burger joint. The kids had the Paris burger which they loved. Wife had the chicken burger, which was juicy not dry like others. I had the lemon garlic wings which were excellent. Service was also friendly and attentive!

T-wyp_XZNi0GCUofXl0sIA.text: Service kinda sucks, we were waiting in front and the same hostess knew we were waiting. After a family who clearly came after us was seated I went up to ask, and the hostess told me she had called our party 4 times so we were passed. Food took about 40 min even though it wasn't crowded.   Waitress was super sweet though, not her fault.

YjpqNE2_GK0A45NKPguBjQ.text: The food here is delicious . The wings are very flavorful . They are baked first so the meat just falls off the bone . The cheeseburgers are literally the best ever ! No joke . They are made with velveeta cheese, which I was a little skeptical of -but pleasantly surprised with ... Soooo here's the reason for only 3 stars...We went on a Sunday at 9:30 at night and the place looked pretty empty, however, we were told we would have to wait 30-40 minutes when there were clearly several empty tables . We decided to wait . Our waiter was very friendly, but, he was verrrryyy slow with delivery and not very attentive at all . We had to ask several times for for refills of water, drinks, etc . Once we finished our meal we had to wait an additional 25 minutes for our bill . Our waiter had just disappeared and we finally had to signal for the bus boy . Overall, if you have lots of time on your hands ... Def a must eat .. . But if you're on a tight schedule ... DO NOT even attempt .

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cheeseburgers are reallllllllyyy good!

DHFlAPgqDwn_KqWgECjXKw.text: ******* Likes ******* - Salmon and veggie burgers with variety of toppings and buns to choose from; I recommend veggie w/ avocado and pesto on oven-dried tomato bun - Salad with beets, goat cheese, candied pecans, apples...my favorite combo of salad ingredients ! - Accepted multiple coupons for $5 off a burger entree   ******* Gripes ******* - Fennel was a confusing topping--they should clarify that it's fennel fronds, not fennel root - Lamb a bit chewy and lacked moistness  Overall, I probably wouldn't return because there are so many other options in Vegas, but I enjoyed it.

FvB2eVPgBTpjqxo1IGR1QA.text: Found a groupon, so we decided to try it out. Service was fine. Food was good. The Cheetos dusted onion rings were interesting. Good for the price with the Groupon, but with so much in Vegas, not sure we would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dra01R4cr1KP1CYY59aemw.text: I don't really like noisy restaurants, but I bare it at least once to try the food. It's just difficult to talk to someone next to you when you have men screaming and yelling lol.   I did want to try their food for a while now, and I chose the time when the football game was on lol.   I just got a chef salad, and it was a pretty big one. The seats face the TV so you got something to gaze at as you eat.   It is a great place for the sports fans out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1u86P6IrHwFwrEQoiWww1A.text: Basically located at Bally's. Don't go through the main Strip entrance of Paris or you'll have to walk through all them darn shops and other restaurants for a cool mile before you get the place.  Went here for lunch: delicious burger and even better cobb salad. I highly recommend! Look for the Groupon: $15 for $30 worth of food. Yumm!  Good spot for families and casual/chic dining. American food.

ietcRzWgfsZIqruqtUqpTA.text: This was the second time I tried this place. First time was almost a year ago. I sent back both my cocktails as they were not tasty. The bloody mary flavor was way off, and the peach old fashioned was gross. The food was nothing special. Fast forward to this week. I avoided the cocktails and ordered myself a reliable beer. The food this time was my dissapointment. My boyfriend ordered a BLT and that was average. Seriously how could you mess up a BLT? I ordered the Buffalo chicken dip. The best part of this dish was the pretzel pieces. The chicken dip was overly greasy, unflavorfull, and the chicken tasted bad. That is if you could find the very small chicken pieces. I literally spit one bite out in my napkin because the chicken was rubbery, and tasted like it had gone bad. I tried this place twice. I will not be back.

xYxZr58tyGJgjv31xk3fWQ.text: Do not plan an event here. They are not consistent in their prices and change things behind your back you won't be refunded for. Hands down worst service and the food isn't good enough to justify the prices.

hWcmYKczfq937zPUPRwV-w.text: Located in Paris hotel just where it turns in to Bally's casino.  Outstanding burgers and a large paper cone of fries that holds more than you think from looking at it. A lot of TV's and 2 for one drink specials. these are not Mcdonald prices so be prepared to spend $15 + for a burger but these are not McDonalds burgers so enjoy.

KXWbFU0NNn4schfT7St7dw.text: I came across this place while looking for good burger joints in Vegas.  I think this place is pretty bad.  The service was slow and horrendous.  The waiter brought out a bunch of beers and set them off to the side next to our table (i'm assuming they wanted to bring out and serve all the drinks at once).   The problem was that they seemed to have forgotten about the beers and they just sat there for like 15 minutes getting warm.  Trying to get one of the server's attention was also quite the task.    Then the waitress comes and puts down a beer in front of my friend who picks it up to drink...and the waitress proceeds to grab the beer from his hand and says "this one isn't yours!"    What kind of waitress just grabs something out of your hand without saying something first?!  Anyways, the variety of fries they had were pretty good but not amazing.  The burgers were also very lackluster.  If you want a fancy burger stick to Burger Bar or Holsteins

Zy6EsdxL8LjI9aZcR_WijQ.text: Ok so I came here hoping to get the filet mignon burger that I got 9 months ago. I ordered a Groupon the filet mignon w as still on the groupon site .When I got here no steak burgers at all very very very very disappointed I love my filet mignon did have to settle for Kobe beef, being a travel agent I asked for a small consultation, Free fries. Keep you posted

6a3fIQo1JHUYk127n8guxw.text: Kind of my go to for Las Vegas . They are always on Groupon and so for the quality of the food and good price it's one of our favorites. New Menu ,but burgers are still very good . Drinks are cold . Nice decor and will keep going .

xQhMhpzL9TMgGzMwL1Y-ig.text: My husband loves the lamb burger here. He comes often. We met for for a late lunch on a Saturday. The restaurant wasn't too busy, I'd say it was a lull in the day. Service was quick. I enjoyed the l'americain with American cheese, onion rings and mushrooms. The lamb burger did not disappoint either. He likes his med rare served on the the ovendried tomato bun. I chose this bun too and while it's not something I traditionally order it was quite good I recommend it. Don't miss the waffle fries. They are delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The l&#39;americain
Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lamb burger

ZzaVFpzVbomHAHaD8vVwvQ.text: The food here was really great. I recommend the Nutella milkshake. My husband and I both love it. I had Le Paris burger and he had the Mediterranean. I enjoyed his more than mine. Just be aware fries do not come with the order, you pay for those separate. The waitress could have been more friendly. It took her ten minutes just to come over and tell us she be with us in a bit. Restaurant wasn't even full. The only time she came over was to take our order, bring our food and then bring out check. No drink refills, no asking if we needed anything else. When she brought back the check she said have a good day with her back turned towards us walking away.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella milkshake

noBWy9FJA55wxCJyPmeaQQ.text: Awesome to not have a wait! Good serivice. Food was pretty good. I really enjoyed my creamy tomato soup (soup du jour) that went really well with the MUST HAVE blue cheese fries.... Fries + blue/Brie cheeses, bacon & avocado = amazing. It's otherwise a large sports bar with a ton if tv's & bar in the middle. Nothing too extraordinary.

ZeVZ0C13qjGYHgXFurrvCA.text: This is a great place to go if you want to be sure that whatever you do is easiest for them.

ArLAf2FpQH-a1zff4_WWTQ.text: I went here a couple of days ago for lunch. I'd seen some good reviews so I suggested that we eat here when we arrived. There was no line when we got here and it was pretty empty. This wasn't a problem because we were starving! Our waitress was extremely nice and very attentive. The burgers are out of this world! Everyone in my group joked about how we couldn't look at burgers the same because they wouldn't be from here. The burgers are moist and cooked perfectly! I will definitely be coming back again

photos.caption: Photo of Burger Brasserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. L&#39;Americana

rsitxeZAswNUKZipUavnaw.text: Came in right before leaving to go home and had mixed feeings about the establishment. It's a neat place with amazing food. Burger was perfectly cooked and fries were great but the wait staff was all rude!  The hostess, waitress, and water girl were rude. Not only did the girl splash water on my friend and create a little puddle on the table, she never acknowledged it nor cleaned it it.  Food was good. Staff sucks

UPjLUmHpLgNw8lGcgxTypw.text: Had a great experience here yesterday. Right when we walked up we were greeted by a really sweet hostess who sat us quickly. I really wish I got her name because she deserves some praise for being so nice and she had a smile the whole time. As soon as she sat us she asked us a sport question and if we got it right it was 10% off of our check. This was a great idea, it made the start of our experience really fun.   They had tv's everywhere! Which was good for me because the World Cup was starting and I didn't want to miss a thing. I didn't have any alcohol but it seems like they had a stacked bar and had beer on tap.  Our server (I believe her name was Rachel) was nice and got to us promptly. There were also other people coming around to help refill drinks and making sure we were ok.  I got the po boy sandwich which was really good! I haven't had anything like it. My mom had a burger which I had to taste and hers was really good as well, it was cooked perfectly and the meat they use is really good.  It was kind of weird that the entrees don't come with sides but the entrees are so big that you won't be hungry without a side.  But we did get the onion rings to share. I had to get them after seeing they were covered with cheeto dust!  Overall: great service, great food, will definitely be back!

Vw2mqNQzG3yPuGhSRWjohg.text: This is a pretty cool place to hang out....  I'd give it more like 3.5 stars.  Friends wanted to grab a late bite to eat at 9:30pm on a Friday night.... only took about 5 minutes or so for them to prep a table for 7. The greeter was very nice and genuine... our server was nice and she dealt with indecision on our part smoothly. And we weren't rushed so it was nice to visit with friends.  So... we enjoyed the 100oz beer bong looking thing.... what's great is that there is a cooler thing in it so the beer stays cold... not that it took long to drink 100oz between 4 people.  Also, if you order this... you get to spin the Wheel of Discounts.... we didn't hit it big... just $5 off our bill....  I didn't order dinner.... just dessert.... the beignets.... which were NOTHING like the beignets from Cafe du Monde.... so I was pretty disappointed.  They were more like frozen creme puffs that were heated up.... the chocolate sauce was really thin like warm Hersheys syrup... but I think the whip cream was home made... it was silky and smooth.  Everyone else ordered dinner and it looked pretty darn tasty. The most appetizing-looking one was the Lamb burger.... I need to go back and check that out.  Also, their fries on the appetizer menu.... the one with blue cheese, bacon and avocado... yea... those ones.... were killer.  Prices seemed pretty reasonable considering it's a restaurant inside a strip hotel.  The 100oz beer was $30.... just to give you an idea.

iFcajhkqGQ8DwaVdFqWBkA.text: After a long day at a conference we decided to eat in the casino we were staying at and picked this place because there was no wait. We made it for happy hour and the drinks were half off. I ordered the build your own burger with bacon & American cheese, and it was a great choice. My coworker ordered the Paris burger with the Brie cheese and sauteed onions, she loved it. The burgers were cooked and seasoned perfectly. We ordered the double order of fries and the waffle cut fries were good. I would define back if I'm ever at BALLYS again.

WtABazFS5aC4MkZJTHeLYA.text: DAMN....this place was good.   We got a 2for1 entree from the Total Rewards booth and figured we would give it a shot. We have walked by the place several times through our many trips to Vegas. The place looks cool from the outside, with all the TVs on sports and all the great looking girls all dressed in their corsets and what-have you.   As we sat down, we were greeted by the waitress. My wife and I were starving and the first thing my wife asked for was the onion ring tower and she asked if she could rush it, because she was so hungry she was about to pass out. We saw her go around the corner and not even a minute later she flew around the corner with the onion rings. The waitress said she had taken someone else order. I don't know if that was the case or not, but it was great that she made it happen.  My wife and I each got the Kobe Burger, I added bacon on mine and my wife added avocado to hers. We tried each others and they were both juicy and very very good. They burgers are normally $20 ($19 for TR members), even if I paid full price, it would have still been worth it. We will make it a point to come back here every time we come back to Vegas. The service was amazing and the food was great too.   For the people who don't know, if you get a discount like 2for1 or something like that. Please tip your wait staff off of what the total bill would have been. They still worked for that money. And usually they don't give you half the service they normally would, just because you have a discount. They work hard for that money. Take care of them.

gYiSiTMxxicUUAuprhnUXA.text: Let me start by saying that my waitress was excellent. Sorry, wish that I had remembered her name. The food, however, was a different story. I ordered the La Combinaison-The Combo. The onion rings were cold and the onions were stale. Tasted like old onion rings. The chicken fingers and small potato skins were not much better. The hot wings were the best of the combo.  I also had the Le Paris Burger combo with a shake. Fries and shake were delicious. The taste of the burger was awful. The worst tasting beef that I've ever had.   Could get much better food someplace else for the price. Will not go back !!!

Fzd6MIya4SonydqF7Oaa6Q.text: Ok burger... Bit pricey, odd atmosphere, slow service. Not the best place in Vegas for a burger. Probably not even in the top 20 in Vegas. Lame atmosphere also...feel free to skip this place and enjoy one of the many other great Vegas places.

LCtKiFEEAlgAUjzIK0Kfhg.text: $13 for sliders that were the same size as the pickle put on them, waitress never came over once to check on us, combo plate was pathetically small. No wonder there was no wait, go somewhere else.

DT1WN_glBrXDNCDJRmDCXg.text: Very good burgers.  They were tasty and well crafted.  They run from $8.99-$77.  The $77 one has lobster, 100 year old balsamic dressing, and a lot of hoopla.  The simple crafted burgers though are very good.  I had the blue and the wife had the brie burger.  They have a wide selection of buns to complete your burger as well.  The fries were ok.  We got the steak fries.  The service was very good.  The waitresses are dressed pretty provocatively so I dont know if I would bring too young of children in there.    They had the NCAA games on their many screens throughout the restaurant so this would be a great place to watch any of your sports desires.  Overall we really enjoyed it and if we were on this side of the strip would go back.

pVhuemcOVugPeZX2M3UwHg.text: Purchased an awesome groupon for this place and WOW, I could have eaten here every day during my stay in Vegas. Our waitress called everyone "Sweetie" and really knew her burgers. When I asked her if we get to chose our buns she had already picked them for us and like a magician, she picked the EXACT ones we were going to choose! *Magic* The food arrived very quickly -came in about 12noon, before the rush. It was absolutely delicious. We had "le bleu" and the turkey burger with a fried egg on top -YUM!! Thanks sooo much for making our experience that much better. We'll be back soon.

QArSkJIToGvXM9j1Z9gBIw.text: As the 3 stars say it was OK. Average at best. Lots of TVs with a huge one over the bar. To me, this is the kind of place you wander by in Las Vegas and just stop in for a burger. Definitely no real need to seek it out.

0MFFXA_ZZEYFfyNmBBLNrw.text: I don't like to eat on the strip much but I took a chance on Burger Brasserie. The first time was great, our server, Amanda, was wonderful. The second time our server was not so great. The food was more than good, but service makes a difference.

xkNHRKRnuk3hcC5VtLSo3g.text: My boss was raving about this place so I met up with him and my coworkers here.  Nestled in a sea of greatness in the Paris hotel, this burger place is an amazing prize.  I ordered the Paris burger with brie cheese and bacon - two things that are always great in my book.  I had waffle fries which were delicious and we split onion rings - perfectly fried and amazingly tasty.  I rounded out my meal with a strawberry frozen mojito - I literally chugged it down because I couldn't stop.  The food was delicious and the servings are huge - top that off with surrounding flat screens to watch all your favorite teams and you never have to leave.  This would be a great place to drop the bf or hubs off while the ladies spent big cash in the awesome shops around the area.

K7d1NPtHi3y014GMQtJiFg.text: My wife ate here while in Vegas for a conference.  She ordered the Philly steak sandwich with a side of waffle fries.  The sandwich was huge and stuffed with shaved steak, mushrooms, onions, and provolone cheese (she told them to leave out the peppers).  It came with au jus (which she did not use) and garlic aioli - great flavor!  The waffle fries are priced as a side, but you get a huge amount and they are very tasty.  Her coworker ordered the le classique burger in a combo.  This is a basic burger with choice of 1 added topping, she added cheddar cheese and said the burger was delicious.  Being a combo meant that it came with fries, she chose the steak fries and thought they were well cooked.  All together a great meal!  Maybe a little pricey for the type of food, but not bad at all when compared to other like meals on the Vegas strip!

X_bEOTHr8DqmYmIDVWjgmQ.text: The salmon burger was fair and the yam fries excellent.  They had modello especial on tap which was nice.  The service was friendly.  They've got kobe beef and other burger options as well.

Ov-mJhgGPPuYfsrXJEP2hw.text: I eat my burger with fork and knife.  Layer by layer, starting from the top bun, then the topping, the meat patty, and then the bottom bun.  Hold the garnish - I don't like mayos - and the lettuce, tomato and onion - I am an anti-vegetarian.    Which, due to the abovementioned method, I would end up getting full before I even get halfway through the meat patty.    Yet I find myself finishing Le Burger Brasserie's lamb burger with fried egg topping - must either be the lack of food from the day before, or the overexertion at Tryst the previous night, or neither.  Maybe the burger was just that much more superior than any other gourmet burger I've encountered.  On a side note - the designers of the Paris casino should've known better than to try to French-ize everything.  I can accept Le Burger Brasserie... But Le Car Rental? Give me a break.

oR-MRS96_w2OKVEbUpMYiQ.text: Good value, good food. EXCELLENT SERVICE! We came here for my friend Ray's bday & they were very helpful with seating our table of 9 & our waiter was entertaining & super nice.  Try the french dip cheese steak, it's yummy!

cC6l3uAJ9SDSKjN7VgC-uQ.text: I really liked the Saveur lamb burger. Sooo juicy! I got it with a whole wheat bun and it came with harissa mayo and fresh mozzarella. The petit fries were good, too. We had to wait a while for our food to come out of the kitchen, so maybe the food tasted extra good because I was very hungry.

hId29L1RXfRQCas3lbumog.text: This is another one of those places to get a fancy $12 or so burger.  I had the Paris burger (brie, caramelized onions, and smoked bacon) and it was an excellent choice.  I asked for it cooked medium rare and it was cooked perfectly.  Good flavors... still a little pricey for a burger at $12.  But.. worth it IMHO.  You do also pay for the ambiance.  The waitress was very accommodating to our rather larger party (about 20 people).  For sides, we had the fries, onion rings and I decided to order a cup of fruit.  I needed a little fruit in my diet after eating mostly meat and potatoes.   Nothing note worthy to say about the sides.  I wish my cup of fruit was a little larger for the price ($5).

i-Vi0L2a6O9I9yKrhqZvUQ.text: This is a really great burger place.  We made our own burgers with the toppings we wanted and it was delicious!  The service is great, and its a chill spot to have drinks and good ol' burgers.  The fries are yummy, we had the criss cross and skinny fries, but the skinnies were better.  Check out the 777 burger, for $777 you can get a burger with some rose dom.

UGa98TY5xsvcU3oqvD1LNA.text: Had the best cheeseburger ever and I dont really even eat burgers. The salmon burger was a bit fishy but the place is really fun!!

ZbsauMftQVphBnTm4y4b3A.text: We were hungry, not sure what we wanted with 2 kids in a casino.  We ended up at Le Burger.  Food was great, over priced, but this is Vegas and everything is over priced on the strip, so their prices were no more so than everywhere else.  We have a very good waiter and were attended to regularly.  The burger was excellent!  Could not have been better.  The chicken Caesar salads were excellent too!

y__9wVUY7aEj64cT1gLGig.text: This place was recommended to me several times by a friend, he told me they make the best burgers he has tried. He was not kidding. The food is amazing and prices are great.

0kWy-5yXSGSzBpUOaj-FnA.text: We heard the burgers were great here. Never found out because after being seated and waiting for 10min no one came to the table after we were seated. Not even that busy. We watched as one of the waitresses stood and talked casually with a table of male customers about 20 ft away for the entire time we were waiting. Seating hostess looked and acted with the professionalism of a 12 year old. In the end it was a blessing as we went to Ceasar's and found Rao's. It was great Italian. Highly recommended.

t_fwtR3vD0uqCMNvxWyYXw.text: walking through paris, looking for a casual place to eat with the family.. found this place in the walkway between paris and bally's.  it's really a good old sports bar, complete with beer and plasma tvs.  you get a choice of beef, salmon, turkey, chicken, lamb or veggie burgers.  then you get to pick what type of bun, cheese, and toppings you want (including a fried egg!).    i had the turkey burger on a sesame bun topped with brie (i love brie cheese!  esp. melted on a burger!) and grilled onions.  it was as good as it sounds!  throw in onion rings, waffle fries and a juggling bartender.. i thought that this was a great find and i will totally eat here again!

TIrIKUSyb5WQZTXvaoI-Ng.text: The first joint we hit up in the Paris Hotel happened to be the very first place we noticed walking through. 13 hungry dudes probably wouldn't agree to crepes nor some fancy schmancy high-end casino food just getting off one of the most turbulent flights we've ever experienced. No--not in Vegas. As a friend put it--you go BIG in Vegas. We wanted something to confirm our manhood, something to get our minds off that freakin' exhausting flight, something loaded with carbs and fat and protein and something soo unhealthy and expensive that we could consume to match the debauchery yet to be unleashed. We kinda wussed out on the Kobe beef. I'm talking about paying over $10 for a burger and I could proudly claim we did it here.
